H. Gulomjon is 25 years old and lives with his parents. For the past five years, he has dedicated himself to farming wheat and onions, as well as breeding cattle. Gulomjon enjoys being a farmer and finds harvesting his crops especially gratifying. On the other hand, the most tedious part of farming is the preparation of land for planting and protecting crops from insects that spoil his harvest. Gulomjon also operates a taxi service in his free time. This is his first loan from IMON International. He will use the money to buy seeds and fertilizer for his crops, and calves. Gulomjon thanks all who support him.    
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer, and calves

loans.name: Alcanzando Nuestras Metas Group

texts.es:
Karina Evelyn, tiene 24 años D. edad, soltera,  tiene un hijo, vive en la zona D. Chacracerbo, distrito D. Comas , hace 8 meses forma parte del grupo “Alcanzando Nuestras Metas”, formado por 8 integrantes, por su responsabilidad y muchas ganas D. trabajar la eligieron como Tesorera del grupo. 
Hace 1 año se dedica a la venta D. bisutería y catálogos D. Dyclass,  gracias al negocio ha llegado a independizarse y tener más ingresos para la compra D. materiales y los gastos D. su hijo. 
Su meta a lograr es comprar su propia casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales. 
Con el préstamo solicitado desea invertir en materiales.
texts.en:
Karina Evelyn, 24, is single and has a son.  She lives in the Chacracerbo zone, Comas district.  She's been part of the "Alcanzando Nuestras Metas" (Meeting our Goals) group, which has 8 members, for the last 8 months. Because of her responsibility and eagerness to work she was elected group Treasurer.

For the last year she has been selling costume jewelry and Dyclass catalogues.  Thanks to the business she has managed to become independent and have more income to buy materials and for her son's expenses.

Her goal is to manage to buy her own house and that her children become professionals.

She will use the requested loan to invest in materials.

loans.use: To invest in materials.

loans.name: Altangerel

texts.en: Altangerel, 43, is married and lives with his wife and three children in Uvurhangai province in Mongolia. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, and have a good standard of living. All of his children attend school, and his wife works with him in the meat-trading business he started in 2005 and has since expanded into a food-selling business. He also supplements his income by raising livestock. He is a hardworking and modest person who says, "I want to have my own land and build a house in the near future". Altangerel is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy more meat to sell to his customers.

loans.use: To buy more meat

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice O. is 24 years old and the single mother of one child. She lives in Usenge, which is on the outskirts of Kisumu County.

Beatrice has a motorcycle business that she has been running for three years. She is applying for her third loan from KADET Ltd. to enable her to buy another motorcycle to add to her business. She wants to seize the opportunity as most people use motorcycles for transportation and that business is doing well.

Her desire for the future is to be able to own a car which can be used as a taxi.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo F. is from the village of Sta. Clara Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 44 years old. Leonardo is married with two school-aged children. Leonardo grows rice for sale. Leonardo has been engaged in his business for over 12 years and earns approximately 40000 PHP per harvest.

In 2011, Leonardo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. Leonardo is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be his first from ASKI. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama Y. has been selling maize, konkonte (a staple made with powdered cassava) and drugs in Ntranoa, near Elmina. She is shown in the photo in her drug store. 

Ama is married to a cleaner and they have five children. Her income helps pay for their utility bills and their children's school fees. She plans to expand her business and needs the requested loan to buy more drugs to increase her sales. She intends to save the additional profits for her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine/drugs to increase her store's sales

loans.name: Afiwoa Apetoa

texts.fr: Madame Afiwoa  à 37ans, elle est revendeuse du charbon, de céréales, et de savons et habite Hédzranawoé (un quartier du Togo). Elle achète ses marchandises au marché d’Anié, au grand marché de Lomé et revend au domicile de son papa. Afiwoa est à son premier prêt et sollicite ce montant pour acheter des céréales, du charbon et du savon pour revendre pour pouvoir accroitre son activité, avoir un magasin de vente pour  se prendre en charge.
texts.en: Mrs. Afiwoa, age 37, resells charcoal, cereals and soaps. She lives in Hédzranawoé, a neighborhood in Togo. She gets her supplies at the Anié market and at the Lomé Grand Market, and resells at her father's home. Afiwoa is seeking her first loan in order to buy cereals, charcoal and soaps to resell. This will enable her to bolster her business, and have her own store in order to provide for herself.

loans.use: to buy cereals, charcoal and soaps

loans.name: Hean

texts.en: Hean C., 52, is married and resides in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. C. and her husband are farmers that earn an income of about USD 5 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 58 on food and USD 30 on the other necessary expenses. C. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate a business as motor-taxi driver. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband.

loans.name: Jose Nicolas

texts.es:
José  es un hombre soltero de 38 años edad, tiene casa propia de material rústico, la cual cuenta con sólo agua y luz, ubicada en la avenida Venezuela del distrito de  Monsefú, a unos 15 minutos de la privincia de Chiclayo.  Monsefú se caracteriza porque sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería, artesanía y turismo.
José desde hace 7 años se dedica a la venta de leche y flores.  Estos negocios con los que José cuenta son muy prósperos y cada vez adquieren más importancia en el mercado local, lo cual le permite tener cada vez mejorar su calidad de vida.
A solicitado José un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles mediante Capital Semilla para comprar una vaca de mejor raza y así mejorar la calidad de su leche y pueda seguir incrementando sus ingresos, ya que su clientela cada vez es más exigente, pero también se le da la oportunidad de poder  ofertarlo a un mejor precio. José a demostrado ser un cliente muy responsable mediante otros préstamos que se le ha otorgado y a pagado puntualmente.
texts.en:
José is a single man who is 38-years-old.  He has his own house made from rustic materials which has only water and electricity.  It is located on Venezuela Avenue in the Monsefú district fifteen minutes from the Chiclayo province.  Monsefú is characterized by a population that works in agriculture, livestock, crafts, and tourism.  José has worked selling milk and flowers for the last seven years.  The businesses José has are very prosperous and are getting more important all the time in the local market which allows him to continue to improve his quality of life.  
José has requested a 3000 nuevos soles loan from Edpyme Alternativa through “Capital Semilla” (Seed Capital) to buy a cow of a better breed and thus improve the quality of his milk and to be able to continue increasing his income as his customers are more and more demanding.  This will also allow him the opportunity to offer it at a better price.  José has shown himself to be a very responsible customer through other loans that he has been given which he has paid punctually.

loans.use: to buy a better breed of cow.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 30-year-old housewife. She is a very active lady and does her household work very actively. Her husband operates a construction supplies business. He deals with different construction companies and supplies construction materials to them on order.  

Nasreen is the mother of two sons and a daughter. Both of her sons are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. With the loan, he will buy construction supplies such as cement, bricks and sand in bulk which will help him fill larger orders on time and earn better income. 

Nasreen is hopeful that her husband’s business will grow by purchasing construction supplies in bulk quantity and it will result in better living standards for her family. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nasreen.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for resale.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en: Meriam is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with four children. Meriam has a food shop that sells rice by the kilogram & roasted pig by the kilogram. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional sacks of rice & pigs to be roasted. Meriam is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Meriam hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additonal sacks of rice & pigs to be roasted

loans.name: Brenda Libette

texts.es: Brenda Libeth tiene 28 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. La señora Comenzó su negocio hace cinco años cuando se caso y tuvo que buscar una forma de empleo para ayudar a su esposo y realizar sus propios bienes materiales, luego su esposo viajó a otro país y con las remesas de dinero que le enviaba ella comenzó a ampliar mas su negocio, vende pantalones, camisas, zapatos y prendas de oro y plata. Es así que solicita este crédito para la compra de bolsos, ropa en general, cosméticos, calzado, prendas de oro laminado, plata reloj entre otros.
texts.en: Brenda Libeth is 28 years old, and sells general merchandise.  She set up her business five years ago when she got married and had to find work in order to help her husband and accumulate her own assets.  Her spouse then traveled to another country, and with the money he sent, she began to expand her business even more.  She sells pants, shirts, shoes, and gold and silver items.  Thus, she requests this loan to buy bags, clothing in general, cosmetics, footwear, gold- and silver-plated items, among others.

loans.use: buy bags, clothing in general, cosmetics, footwear, gold- and silver-plated items, among others.

loans.name: Jennifer Elieth

texts.en: Jennifer is a 29-year-old married mother of a 6-year-old.  For almost three years she has baked and sold cookies and various sweets door-to-door.  Jennifer intends to use the proceeds of the loan to buy flour, sugar, and other ingredients for her business.  Her dream is to grow her business until one day she can operate from a storefront.

loans.use: buy flour, sugar, and other ingredients.

loans.name: María Mariela

texts.es:
María Mariela es una emprendedora innata, pues desde pequeña siempre le ha gustado trabajar como independientes, es así, como hace algunos años, decidió montar su propio negocio de helados ya que en el barrio donde vive no cuenta con competencia directa. 

María Mariela trabaja de domingo a domingo, los fines de semana cuenta con el apoyo de esposo quien le ayuda en la atención a los clientes. 

Actualmente María Mariela necesita de un préstamo para comprar un congelador, pues el que tiene es arrendado, así podrá adquirir uno más grande e incluir mayor variedad de helados, así mismo necesita realizar algunas adecuaciones locativas y comprar insumos para la preparación de las copas que ofrece a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María Mariela is a born entrepreneur.  She has always enjoyed working independently since she was a young girl.  Some years ago, she decided to set up her own business selling iced treats as there was no direct competition in her neighborhood.

María Mariela works from Sunday to Sunday.  On weekends she has the support of her husband who helps her to serve her customers.

María Mariela currently needs a loan to buy a freezer as the one she has now is rented.  She would like to buy a bigger one so that she can offer a wider variety of iced treats.  She also needs to make some improvements to her premises and buy supplies for preparing the drinks that she sells to her customers.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, make some improvements to her premises, and buy supplies

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is 42 years old and married with 5 children. Gilda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store. Gilda has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the store for 7 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Gilda aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Sakum

texts.en:
Sakum, 57, is a field hand on area farms.  Her husband, Lun, is a 59-year-old construction worker. They have been married since 1979 and one son and one daughter; one of their children is married and lives away from home, the other one is a garment worker. Sakum and Lun live in a village along National Road Number One, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, Cambodia's capital.   Sakum is asking for a loan of $1,200 to expand her family's house, and to replace support pillars in the house.

Photo: Sakum and her husband Lun

loans.use: to pay for an addition to her house, and to replace support pillars in the house

loans.name: Santa Catalina Group

texts.es:
Santa Catalina es denominado el comité integrado por 15 mujeres de Ciudad del Este, todas ellas se unieron con el objetivo de procurar mayores ingresos y de esa forma poder salir adelante. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, cargadas de muchas ansias de progreso y desarrollo.
La señora Rosa tiene una despensa bien surtida. Gracias a este negocio ella ha podido salir adelante y generar los ingresos necesaR. para la manutención de su familia. Uno de sus sueños es poder tener un minisuper con lo que podrá tener mayores ingresos y atraer a más clientes, no solo de su barrio, sino también de zonas aledañas. Comenta que todo lo que hace es por el bien de su familia, pues desea darles todo lo bueno.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, hortalizas, y demás productos de primera necesidad, para que de esa forma pueda estar bien surtida ante cualquier demanda de sus clientes. Está muy agradecida con la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, ya que de obtener el crédito le será de mucha utilidad.
texts.en:
The Santa Catalina Communal Bank is comprised of 15 women from Ciudad de Este.  They all got together with the objective of getting greater income.  That way they will be able to get ahead.  The women are the heads of their households.  They shoulder a lot of anxiety about making progress and growing.

Rosa has a well-stocked grocery store.  Thanks to this business she has been able to get ahead and generate the needed income to support her family.  One of her dreams is to be able to have a “minisuper” (a small supermarket).  Then she would be able to have greater income and attract more customers, not just from her neighborhood, but also from outlying areas.  She says that everything she does is for the good of her family.  She wants to give them everything that is good. 

She is requesting the loan to buy food, drinks, vegetables, and other basic needs items.  She will do this so that she can be well-stocked for any customer demand.  She is very grateful to the foundation for opportunity it is giving her.  Receiving the loan will be very useful.

loans.use: to buy food, drinks, and other products to stock her store.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 28 años es soltera y tiene una hija de 5 años, vive en Ibarra junto con su padre y su hija. Rosa se describe como una persona alegre, sencilla y tranquila.

Trabaja con su padre en una panadería. Es la primera vez que trabaja con FODEMi y el crédito es para la compra de harina, manteca, huevos, mantequilla para incremnentar la produccción de pan y así poder mejorar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos.

Sus sueños es tener un local amplio para su panadería ya que en el actual forma parte de su vivienda y no tiene mucho espacio, también necesita comprar un carro para distribuir su pan ya que en la actualidad el carro que utilizan es muy antiguo; y en cuanto a lo personal quiere comprar un terreno para construir su propia casita.
texts.en:
Rosa is 28 years old, single, and has a 5-year-old daughter.  She lives in Ibarra together with her father and her daughter.  Rosa describes herself as a cheerful, unassuming and calm person.

Rosa works with her father in a bakery.  This is the first time that she has worked with FODEMI and she will use her loan to buy flour, lard, eggs and butter to increase her bread production and thereby improve her sales and increase her income.

Rosa's dream is to have bigger premises for her bakery since it currently forms part of her home and she doesn't have a lot of space.  She also needs to buy a car so that she can deliver her bread since the car that they are currently using is very old.  As regards her personal dreams, she would like to buy a plot of land so that she can build a little house of her own.

loans.use: to buy flour, lard, butter and eggs

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en: Clarita is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children.  She has a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks & beverages.  She has had this business for 5 years, and has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.  Clarita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Jean Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice is 39 years old and is married with three children. He owns a business selling soft drinks and food in his restaurant. This is his fifth successful year in this work and he currently employs two people to help him.  The hours of his work are from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. every day. 

Maurice has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase his restaurant business. This will allow him to have good profits. With any profit, he will be able to build a secure a future for his business as well as for his family, and he will be able to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more food and drinks for his restaurant to resell.

loans.name: Nelson Ovidio

texts.es:
El señor Nelson tiene 21 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo.

Él se ha dedicado toda su vida a la agricultura a sembrar maíz, fríjol, maicillo y trabaja como jornal. Es una persona honesta, responsable y trabajadora.

Don Nelson esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar lamina, madera y pago de mano de obra, ya que desea construir un corredor de adobe. Para comprar los materiales, que necesita para la construcción deberá trasladarse desde su comunidad hasta la ciudad viajando en autobús por 18 kilómetros.

Con la construcción él mejorara su casa, brindándole a su familia seguridad y que ellos se sientan bien y puedan vivir más tranquilos, ya que él desea que sus hijos se desarrollen en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Nelson, 21, lives with his life companion and their son.  He’s been a corn, bean and sorghum farmer and also works as a day laborer.  He’s an honest, responsible, hardworking person.

Nelson is asking Fundación Campo for a loan to buy metal sheeting and lumber and to pay labor costs because he wants to build an adobe corridor.  In order to buy the building materials he needs he has to go from his community to the city taking an 18 kilometer bus ride.  With the construction he will improve his house providing his family with more security so that they will feel good and live more peacefully because he wants his children to grow up in good conditions.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is forty five and lives in Kasese, Uganda. He is the father of five children. He has been in the computer service business for ten years. George started his computer service business with small capital obtained from manual labor. His hardship is customers not paying on time after rendering the services. George's personal goal is educating his children to university level and he hopes to expand his computer service business into new market areas. George is requesting a loan to buy computer spares and accessories for sale.

loans.use: To buy computer spares and accessories for sale.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: El señor Ruben trabaja  como chofer  asociado un sindicato de trufis de la ciudad de La Paz y su esposa es costurera. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de materiales como ladrillo, cemento, arena, para  la construcción de dos habitaciones en la planta alta de su domicilio. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Es la primera vez que Ruben obtiene un crédito en nuestra institución con el fin de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, y por esta razón se lo canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Rubén works as a driver associated with a cooperative minibus syndicate in the city of La Paz and his wife’s a seamstress.  He needs the loan to build two rooms on the top story of his house.  He lives in his own house located in the city of La Paz’s Alto San Pedro zone; he’s married and has two children.  This is the first time Rubén has gotten a loan from our institution with the goal of improving his family’s quality of life and this is why it’s being channeled through Kiva.

loans.use: to pay cost of adding two rooms to his house.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a hardworking businesswoman. She is married and blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. She has been running a cafeteria for the last three years to support her family. She employs one person to help her in the business. 

Since Caroline joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans to boost her business. With 20,000 Kenya shillings, she intends to buy ingredients, such as cooking fat, salt and cabbages.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, such as cooking fat, cabbages and salt

loans.name: Hicela

texts.en:
Hicela is from the village of Caritan Centro, Tuguegarao City. She lives together with her spouse and two children. To make a living, she sells rice and Del Monte products such as pineapple juice and chunks. She offers her products at the market where sales opportunities are many. She usually makes about P3,000 each month.

She is now asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy more sacks of rice and Del Monte products to sell. 

She hopes to generate good income from her business and someday provide a succesfull life for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice and Del Monte products to sell.

loans.name: Mercedes Adilia

texts.es:
Doña Mercedes reside en el departamento de Masaya su núcleo familiar es de 3 personas incluyendo a su  hija y su esposo. Tanto ella como su esposo trabajan arduamente para salir adelante buscando la manera de llevar el sustento a su hogar.

Actualmente ella se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para realizar la compra de medicina ya que su única hija se encuentra mal de salud y requiere con mucha urgencia los medicamentos para su recuperación.

Ella espera ser beneficiada con dicho crédito y así continuar adelante en su desarrollo y sobre todo para que su hija mejore de salud.
texts.en:
Mercedes lives in the department of Masaya. Her nuclear family is made up of 3 people including her daughter and her husband. Both her and her husband work hard to get ahead and find a way to support their home. 

She needs to request a loan now in order to buy medicine because her only daughter is ill and she needs it soon for her daughter's recovery.

She hopes the loan is beneficial and that way continue with her development and above all, improve her daughter's health.

loans.use: to buy medicine because her only daughter is in bad health.

loans.name: Dios Es Mi Pastor 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Susana is one of the members of the Group Dios es Mi Pastor 3 & 4 (God is My Shepherd), located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris, This group is located in one of the rural area called Batey, populated by Haitian immigrants who came to the country to work in the sugar field plantation. Most of the members in this group are Haitian citizens.

Susana sells miscellaneous products in her business, such as clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and accessories. With this loan, she is planning to invest in her inventory, because in the Christmas season all products are in high demand. Susana is very excited to receive her 8th loan from Esperanza International, after having successfully repaid her previous loans, and thus taken a step towards expanding her business.

She tells us that her most important challenge is to set a store where she can sells all her items, without going outside and walking in her communities and others nearby. She enjoys being at home with her long-term partner and 5 children; right now just two of them live together with her and their father. She is planning to reinvest her profits in her business, and to get clothes and shoes for her children. She thanks all of you for your support!!!

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Engly's Group

texts.en:
Engly, 47, is a farmer in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district while her husband is a village chief. They have three children, two of whom are dependents. She currently earns less than US$4 per day from her current business and is able to save only US$1 daily. 

This is Engly's first group loan with VisionFund. She and her member Sokleng are applying for a loan. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow healthy rice and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is aged 38 and married with 5 children between the ages of 15 and 7 years. She has been farming for 14 years and currently employs one farmhand on her farm. She sells her products of milk, tea and eggs to the local market.

Evaline has requested a loan of 20,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her boost her poultry business by buying more birds and thus produce more eggs for the local market. She adds that the loan will enable her to meet the basic family requirements with much ease.

She laments the high cost of acquiring capital to do heavy commercial farming, but reiterates the benefits of Juhudi Kilimo's loan services.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Maria Emerita

texts.es: María Emérita es una empresaria emprendedora quien tiene una pulpería en su casa desde hace 20 años, es casada, con tres hijos adolescentes. El crédito lo solicita para invertir en el negocio  en inventario tales como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, carne de res, carnes de pollo, productos lácteos, gaseosas variadas, cigarrillos etc.
texts.en: María Emérita is an enterprising businesswoman who has had a grocery store in her house for 20 years.  She is married and has three adolescent children. She is requesting the loan to invest in inventory for her business, such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, beef, chicken, milk products, various sodas, cigarettes, etc.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, toilet paper, various sodas, cigarettes, etc.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco has over 25 years of experience selling veterinary medicine and pet products. Although one would not expect poor family's to have pets they are prevalent in these communities as domestic partners and a source of income. Francisco has been able to take advantage of this with his business which is the only one in the neighborhood to offer food and medicine for animals. With his loan he was able to buy these products at wholesale prices. Once he generated profit from the increased inventory he was able to make improvements to his shop. He now offers seminars and workshops that teach the community how to raise chickens and other animals that can generate revenue. He not only sees this as a service to his neighborhood, he also generates business from the participants of his free courses. Francisco originally opened his business by saving a little bit of money and buying animal food and medicine. His wife and children help out in the store, so this has become somewhat of a family operation for the Ordonezes. With Mifex’s courses, Marcos has begun keeping inventory records and basic accounting, so that he can move into the banking mainstream and maintain a better credit profile. He is applying for this second loan so that he can buy hangers, a display case, and reorganize his store.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: He is applying for this second loan so that he can buy hangers, a display case, and reorganize his store.

loans.name: Mohammad Saleem

texts.en:
M. Saleem was born in 1972 and lives in a household of four in district 3 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

M. Saleem has already finished a group loan and has now taken his first individual loan. Before, he had a small business selling fuel, then he took a loan through AFSG to buy more fuel and make a cart for himself. 

M. Saleem is an educated man, but due to a lack of income in the family he left his government job. Now he is making more money and is thus able to solve his family problems.

loans.use: Buying fuel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of video cassettes, radio cassettes, vcds ans dvds for his business

loans.name: Siv

texts.en: Mrs. Siv A. is a 31 year old widow living in Kampong Chnang with her mother and her child.  She runs a small grocery stand that is incredibly busy, bringing in $38/day in revenue.  It is hard to calculate her daily profits, but it is around $5/day which is enough to support herself, her child, and her mother.  This loan will be used for Mrs. Siv to purchase more grocery products.  In the future, she hopes to continue accessing loans so that she can grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Mrs. Adjo A., 45, is married and mother of four children; she is responsible for another child as well. Her husband was a farmer in the country but since she did not have work there, Adjo came Lomé with her children so as to be able to earn a living. Selling porridge and doughnuts, she has managed to earn a living for her children and her husband.

A hard worker, Adjo is asking for a loan of US$ 500 to purchase corn, sugar, wheat flour, and oil so that she will be able to make a go of her little Togolese fast-food business and satisfy the demands of her customers

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 45 ans, Madame A. Adjo est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants et à sa charge un autre enfant. Son mari cultivateur au village, et comme il n’y a pas d’activités intenses au village elle est venue à Lomé avec les enfants afin de mener à bien ses activités et mieux s’occuper d'eux. Revendeuse de bouillie et des beignets, elle arrive à subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants ainsi que son mari.

Très courageuse, elle sollicite un crédit de $500 pour pouvoir s’approvisionner en sacs de maïs, sucre farine de blé et huile afin de bien rentabiliser son activité et satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Buying ingredients for her Togolese fast-food  Approvisionnement en sac de maïs, sucre, farine de blé et huile

loans.name: Cara Eduardo

texts.pt:
Clara Eduardo M. is 37 years old, married and a mother of 4 children. She lives in the neighborhood of George Dimitrov in Maputo and has a business selling coal out of her home. She became a member of the group in 2004 with an initial loan for 960MT. She is in the 7th loan cycle and wants to take out an additonal loan for 7,000MT to be repaid within 5 months. She intends to apply the funds to increase stock in her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch

Clara Eduardo M. tem 37 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e é mãe de 4 filhos. Vive no bairro George Dimitrov em Maputo e tem o negócio de venda de carvão em casa.Começou como membro do grupo Cinco em 2004 com um empréstimo de 960MT.Está no 7º ciclo e vai tomar um empréstimo de 7.000MT pagável em 5 meses.O valor pretende aplicar no negócio.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Lizete Venancio

texts.pt:
Lisete Venâncio B. is a 34 year old widow. She was born in Boane, a province of Maputo, and raised with her 11 brothers and sisters. She only studied until the 7th grade. She has an 11 year old son. Lisete met her husband in 1994 and moved in with him in the neighborhood of Fiche in Boane. Her husband left for RSA and passed away there. In 1998, after the passing of her husband she started working on her small business.

She first a approached credit program in Gueguegue in the neighborhood of 4 Boane, but this program only offered loans for groups. She was introduced to Hluvuku-Adsemathrough friends and her first loan was of 10.000mt, which she repaid. With the income from her business, Lisete supports her family and pays for the schooling of her son. She manages the business herself. Her work has a positive impact in her community because it provides employment for Lisete and her family and it brings products closer to the clients. In the future she would like to buy her own shop.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localizaçao:Bairro 7 Cliente:Lisete Venancio B. Actividade:Comercio Valor de empréstimo :10.000,00 mt (400.00 USd) Aplicação de montante : Compra e venda de milho Inicio: 28-11-07 Fim : 22-03-09 Lisete Venâncio B., viúva de 34 anos de idade, natural de Boane, província de Maputo,cresceu sob a responsabilidade dos pais numa família alargada de 11 irmaos , tem actualmente 1 filho de 11 anos de idade e estudou até 7ªclasse devido as condições financeiras da família . Conheceu o marido em 1994 e passou a viver com ele junto com os sogros no bairro Fiche em Boane, mais tarde o marido foi a R.S.A e morreu por la. Em 1998 após a morte do marido começou a exercer um pequeno negocio, como forma de sobrivivênca . Teve o seu 1ºcontacto com o credito numa pequena associação denominada Gueguegue localizada no bairro 4 Boane, que oferecia créditos em grupos, não tendo sido uma experiênçia boa porque para alem dos valores cedidos serem menores tinham de assumir a responsabilidade grupal. Conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema através das amigas e dai aproximou e solicitou o seu 1º empréstimo para compra de produtos e pagou sem nenhum problema,com este credito de 10.000,00 MT, pretende aumentar o volume de mercadoria.

Com os rendimentos do mesmo suporta os encargos familiares, as despesas escolares e de saúde da familia. Actualmente esta explorando um pequeno estabelecimento ao lado do mercado Boane. Ela dirige pessoalmente o negocio e na sua ausença o filho é que tem tomado a conta do mesmo A sua actividade tem um maior impacto na comunidade porque para alem de colocar o produto mais próximo do residente de Boane, providencia emprego a ela própria. A perspectiva futura é ter um estabelecimento próprio.

loans.use: To buy maize for sale

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor is the owner of two motocarros (motorcycle rickshaws), and she also works selling food. She has three young children, and her husband Enrique works as the chofer and repairs and cares for the rickshaws. In the future Flor hopes that her children will be successful professionals and for this reason she sells food and administers her rickshaws with the goal of giving her children everything they need. Today she needs a sum of money in order to invest it in the maintenance and repair of the tools of her trade. She would like to improve her food sales and later rent a store in order to sell lubricants. Let’s help this mother who with strength and dedication continues working ardently to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Flor, es propietaria de dos motocarros, y al mismo tiempo se dedica a la venta de comida, tiene tres hijos menores; su esposo el señor Enrique se desempeña como chofer y se encuentra al cuidado de sus motocarros; en el futuro desea que sus hijos sean profesionales exitosos y es por eso que vende comida y administra sus motocarros a fin de brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijos.Hoy requiere de una suma de dinero para invertirlos en el mantenimiento y arreglo de sus herramientas de trabajo, mejorar su venta de comida y posteriormente alquilar un local para la venta de lubricantes.Apoyemos a esta madre que con esfuerzo y dedicación sigue trabajando arduamente por progresar.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for her motorcycle rickshaws

loans.name: Azad

texts.en:
Mr. Azad F. is a low-income person. He is 21, married with two children and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in Caucasus region. Azad rents a barber's together with his father (who is pictured). They serve clients and at the end of each month they pay the landlord for the rent.

There is a school season coming up and as a rule all schoolchildren cut their hair before going to school. Azad's barber's shop isn't in good condition and needs to be renovated immediately. Azad has applied for $500 to Normicro Saatli branch. After getting the loan and renovating the shop he plans to get more customers and increase his daily income.

loans.use: For renovations

loans.name: Kireka B7 A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Ruth M.. She is currently in the business of running a canteen and is requesting a loan to increase stock. Ruth is 48 years old and is a widow. She has 9 children ranging from age 20 to 34. Two of her children go to school while others work. Each week, Ruth makes approximately UGX 40000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up other businesses. Ruth has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 600000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Ruth is joined in her small group by Milly N., Slyvia N., Teopista K., and Resty N.. Milly N. has a restaurant business and wants to buy more food, cutlery and utensils. Slyvia N. is currently operating a bar business and wants a loan to purchase more crates of beer and furniture. Teopista K. operates a business of shoe sales and wants to increase inventory. Resty N. is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan to add more working capital.

loans.use: To add to canteen business

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet B. is married and has 6 children. She is 34 years old and sells clothes (wrapper). She is from Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in business since 2005. She needs the loan of $875 to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Sokha Tong Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha T. is 33 years old and lives in Banh Chhkol village, which is a poor village located in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is the mother of five children, all of whom are studying in public school. She has a grocery store in the village that she manages very well. Her husband, Pov Lim, is a policeman. However, his salary is not enough to pay for the family's expenses. Last year, Mrs. Sokha T. obtained a loan from AMK to buy grocery items to sell in the village. Now, she would like to expand her business and increase her inventory with a new loan.

She is the group leader of four members. Mr. Sakhorn P. is not in the picture but his wife is.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in silver jewelry and women's clothing.

loans.name: Mulikat

texts.fr:
At 41 years of age, Mrs. Mulikat A. is married and has five children. She is a businesswoman who is constantly adapting to the needs of her environment. This is how she came to specialize in the sale of various products : medicines, jewelry, and beauty products. Her business runs essentially in a very busy commercial zone. Thus, it is necessary for her to diversity her products.

This first loan will allow her to increase the range of her medicines, jewelry, and beauty products.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

A 41 ans, madame A. Mulikat est mariée et mère de cinq enfants. C’est une commerçante qui s’adapte toujours au besoin de son milieu. C’est ainsi qu’elle s’est spécialisée dans la vente de divers produits : médicaments, bijoux, produits de beauté. Son activité se déroule essentiellement dans une zone commerciale très animée. Ainsi il est nécessaire pour elle de diversifier ses produits.

Ce premier crédit lui permettra d’augmenter la gamme de ses médicaments, bijoux et produits de beauté.

loans.use: To buy medicines and beauty products

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria P. has used her Esperanza Bank of Hope loan to run two business: She and her husband Miguel manage a general store selling kitchen essentials and snacks on one side of her home, and a clothing store on the other.  The couple still support two of their seven children, and Maria says that she plans to continue to work hard so that they don't have to work as hard as she has.  With her future loans, Maria hopes to expand her clothing business.

loans.use: Colmado de Maria (food and clothing sales)

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
M. Gulnora is 36 years old. She is married with two adorable children. She currently sells men’s garments. For more than seven years she has worked in Spitamen, Tajikistan, which is one of the busiest markets and allows for a good number of sales. Apart from watching over her business, Gulnora is responsible for raising her two children. She states that it's not an easy job; you have to keep watch over the kids' education and check up on their homework in high school.

Gulnora is a dynamic, active and creative woman, and she is always looking to add more products to sell in her business. She recently started to sell shoes, and has earned good profits since the first month. She invested her previous loans from IMON in spring clothes and shoes. Now she would like to continue adding more products and variety to her business, and she is asking for a loan to obtain school supplies to sell. For this reason she is requesting 3300 Somoni ($975) for the term of 12 months. Gulnora hopefully waits for your favorable response.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and clothing.

loans.name: Sarwar's Group

texts.en:
Sarwar baji is the widow of M. A. and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore is famous for its historical places. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 20 years. She is the mother of four children: one son and three daughters. Her son is ten years old but does not go to school. Her daughters make decorative embroidered dresses. 

Sarwar baji runs a canteen in a school and has done this for 6 years. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy material (cloth, beads and patterns) to make more decorative embroidered dresses and to sell them in a big market for a good profit.

She is joined in her loan group by four other members. Maryam baji and Khawar baji each want a loan to repair their auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Rehana baji and Asia baji want loans to buy iron to make chains which are used to tie cattle. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for her decorative embroidery business

loans.name: Wilson Antonio

texts.es: El Señor Wilson está solicitando su crédito para invertirlo en  mejora de su vivienda como es construcción de una habitación, labora como docente en la Universidad URACCAN en la zona Urbana de  Nueva Guinea desde  hace 15 años, actualmente está estudiando una licenciatura en la misma universidad URACCAN recinto Nueva Guinea, se caracteriza por ser humilde, responsable, honesto y con muncho deseos de superación personal y profesional, tiene una hija de 4 añitos, viven en el barrio Linda Vista de Nueva Guinea, su esposa  trabaja para una empresa comercializadora de electrodomésticos, ambos comparten los gastos familiares, su sueño es tener estabilidad laboral, una vivienda bonita y que su hija estudie para que sea una persona de bien.
texts.en:
Mr. Wilson is requesting this loan to invest in home improvement in the form of building a new room. He has worked as a docent in the urban zone of New Guinea for 15 years for URACCAN University, where he is currently studying to obtain a degree. He is humble, responsible, and honest, with a great desire to improve personally and professionally. He has a little 4-year-old daughter, and they all live in the Linda Vista neighborhood of New Guinea. His wife works for a marketing company of electric home appliances; both he and his wife share normal expenses. His dream is to have working stability and a nice home, and to have his daughter go to school to have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a room

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 28-year-old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh in southern suburbs of Lebanon. He owns a small accessory shop and he wants to expand and buy new accessories for his shop. Therefore, he has requested a loan of $1000 from Al Majmoua. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To expand his shop and purchase new accessories

loans.name: Julie

texts.fr: Née vers 1973 dans l’arrondissement de  KESSOUNOU à  GLAHOUNSA  dans la commune de DANGBO, dame  D. Julie est mariée et mère de 3enfants dont 2 scolarisés. Elle cultive dans le village de  HÊTIN SOTA  de la vallée de l’Ouémé et est membre du groupement  GF MAHUKPEGO DE HÊTIN SOTA ; elle vend aussi du poisson et du piment. Les habitants de ce village font les travaux champêtres à la décrue du fleuve ouémé. Leurs terres sont riches et les offrent un bon rendement.  Leurs spéculations principales sont la culture du maïs, du piment, des légumes, du gombo, de la tomate et du manioc qui sont des aliments de grande consommation au Bénin. Le problème de ces habitants riverains du fleuve est que, en période de crue, ils n’ont plus d’activité et dépensent tout le revenu issu de la campagne écoulée à la consommation. A la décrue ils n’ont plus d’argent pour payer la main d’œuvre indispensable pour emblaver la superficie à eux disponible.  La pratique dans le milieu qui consiste au bradage des récoltes ne les sécurise pas et les runes d’avantage. Cette pratique est la vente à un prix dérisoire de la récolte future à un nanti pour disposer de la somme nécessaire aux travaux champêtres. Fatigués de cette pratique elle a sollicité un prêt de 150 000 FCFA pour l’exploitation d’environ 2hectares des spéculations susse indiquées.
texts.en:
Born around 1973 in the district of Kessounou, in Glahounsa in the township of Dangbo, Mrs. Julie D. is married and the mother of 3 children, of whom two are enrolled in school. She is a farmer in the village of Hetin Sota in the valley of the Ouémé River and is a member of the group GF Mahukpego of Hetin Sota. She also sells fish and hot peppers.

The inhabitants of this village work as farmers when the river level is low. Their land is rich and gives them a good harvest. Their principal crops are maize (corn), hot peppers, vegetables, okra, tomatoes, and manioc which are staple foods in Benin. The problem for these people who dwell along the river is that when the river is in flood, they have no more work and spend all the money they earned during the last farming season on foodstuffs. When the waters recede, they have no money left to pay for laborers who are indispensible to them in sowing their land.

The custom of borrowing against the new harvest does not make them more secure and indeed leaves them worse off. They sell their future harvest at a laughable price to weathier persons so that they have the cash needed to do their farming. Weary of this practice, Julie D. has requested a loan of 150,000 F CFA which will allow her to farm about 2 hectares, growing some of the aforementioned crops.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cultivating 2 hectares in corn and hot peppers

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 42 años, es madre soltera y vive con sus dos hijos. Hace 19 años ingresó al ámbito del transporte, es propietaria de tres motocarros que son manejados por chóferes particulares dedicados al transporte público de pasajeros. Las ganancias obtenidas en este negocio le ayudan a solventar los gastos diarios de su familia. Gloria cuenta que cada año ha ido aumentando la demanda por este tipo de transporte, y ahora la competencia es mayor, pero lo bueno es que ella cuenta con tres de estos motocarros, por lo que le es más rentable. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero de este crédito le hará mantenimiento a sus motos, y además mandará a construir un garaje para guardarlas.
texts.en:
Gloria is 42 years old, a single mother and lives with her two children. Nineteen years ago she started in the transportation business. She is the owner of three motocarros (three wheeled motorized cart) which are used for public transportation and are drivien by others. The earnings from this business help her to take care of her family´s daily expenses. Each year the demand for this type of transportation has grown and the competition is now greater, but luckily she has three vehicles and her business is profitable. This is the first time she has asked for a loan from Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money from this loan she will do maintenance on her vehicles and build a garage for storing them.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance for vehicles and construction of a garage.

loans.name: Nojoud

texts.en:
Nojoud is a 35-year-old woman who lives in Bourj el Barajneh in the southern suburbs of Lebanon with her husband and their two children. Nojoud has been working and selling accessories in a cosmetic shop for three years. Nojoud decided on working in this business to make and save some money. Her clients are friends and neighbors.

Nojoud requested a loan of 600 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase accessories for her shop. This is the first time that Nojoud has requested a loan. In the future, she plans to expand her business and increase her income.

loans.use: Purchase accessories for her shop

loans.name: Mutyba Specioza Group

texts.en:
M. is 36 years of age and married with four children. All of her children go to school. She rents a six room house and lives there with her children. She doesn’t have additional family to look after. M. always has three meals a day and her greatest expense is tuition for her children. She makes her living raising chickens and works seven days a week. She normally receives about ten customers a day and most of her clients are men. She sells her hens at retail and she has done this kind of business for over seven years. Besides rearing chickens, she is also a shop attendant. 
The main challenge she faces in her business is that it is seasonal. She can only sell her hens when they have matured.

M. has been a member with MCDT for 5 years. She chose to work with MCDT because they operate in a simply way that is easy to understand. She has worked with her group for 5 years and she wants to use this loan to increase her stock. She also wants to continue expanding her business until it becomes a farm.

loans.use: To increase on her stock

loans.name: Daphrose

texts.en:
Greetings from Daphrose M. in Gasabo District, Kigali city, the capital of Rwanda. Daphrose is 53 years old, married with 4 children.

This entrepreneur invests her money in buying second-hand stuff such as used small and big cans, used crates and bottles. She collects them and re-sells them in large quantity at good prices, earning approximately 30,000 Rwf per month after paying her 3 employees and other expenses. Daphrose has been working at this business for 2 years; she works every day from 7:30am to 5:30pm. She hopes to expand her business and be able to pay school fees for her children.

Daphrose is requesting a loan worth 500,000 Rwf from VISION FINANCE COMPANY S.A., which will be repaid over 8 months on a monthly basis.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret I. is 53 years old and married with four children.  She sells medicine and provisions.  Margaret is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more provisions and medicine to sell.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more medicine and provisions to sell.

loans.name: Faaaloalo

texts.en: Faaaloalo S., 53, is married with 4 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the handicrafts business. She sells to the general public 3 days per week. She has had 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (about US $99).  SPBD loans are Faaaloalo’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase crafting supplies

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita has run her own tailoring business for almost 20 years. She manages her small business in the home she shares with her husban Rodolfo in Magsaysay Saguday, Quirino in the Philippines.

Lolita is 47 years old and with her business, has been able to help her husband in providing some of their family’s daily needs and in sending their children to school. The couple has been blessed with three children. Vanesa is the eldest at 26 years old and a college graduate. Aaron John is 17 years old and is in his second year of college. Jocel Marie is the youngest at 14 years old and in high school. Lolita hopes that someday she will be able to have her own dress shop, and always prays that she will become a successful entrepreneur in the future.

Her business is in need of more capital so she can continue serving her customers. She is hence requesting a loan of PHP10, 000.00 to buy more sewing materials. She hopes her customer base will increase through the loan which will provide more profits.

loans.use: To buy more sewing materials

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr: MODOU G. EST MEMBRE DE LA MUTUELLE DEPUIS UN AN .IL EST CHAUFFEUR DE TAXI ET FAIT PARALLELEMENT DE l'aviculture ;cette activité est gérée par un de ses fils au village ;avec ce pret il veut renforcer son fonds de roulement pour satisfaire sa clientèle qui est basée à dakar;
texts.en:
Modou G. has been a member of the mutuelle for a year. He is a taxi driver, and he concurrently raises poultry, a business managed by one his sons in town. With this loan, he wants to boost his working capital to satisfy his customers, who are based in Dakar.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell poultry

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paullina A. sells tubers of yams to her customers. She is 50 years old and is married with eight children. She hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more tubers of yams to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
La señora Ofelia Z. vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, su esposo labora en una empresa de repartición de frituras desde hace 3 años. 
Ella es propietaria de una tiendita de abarrotes de nombre “Abarrotes Ofelia “ negocio establecido desde hace  3 años, demostrando constancia para que su negocio vaya creciendo y por tal motivo esta solicitando este crédito para la inversión en compra de mas mercancía y así cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes y lograr un mayor ingreso.
texts.en:
Ofelia Z. lives with her husband and their two children. Her husband has worked in a fast food businessfor three years. She is the proprieter of a little grocery store named "Abarrotes Ofelia" (Ofelia's Groceries), established three years ago which is showing certain growth. As a result, she is requesting this loan in order to invest in more merchandise and cover her customers' needs and earn greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment for business.

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es: Doña Maria Elsa es una mujer que a logrado tener su propio negocio ha mucho esfuerzo y apoyo de su familia. Su negocio es la elaboración de espejo y cuadros decorados, que son muy conocidos por los nicaragüenses, los estilo pata de león. Ella tiene 59 años de edad, reside en el barrio Carlos Aguirre en la capital de Managua,  sus dos hijos son mayores de edad casados, su esposo es agente vendedor que le ayuda a distribuir la mercancía en  los diferentes departamento. Con este crédito va a comprar materiales para elaborar los espejos y poder vender a sus clientes. Da las gracias Afodenic por los beneficios por la inversión de su negocio a través de sus préstamos con accesibles plazo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Elsa is a woman who has succeeded in having her own business through a lot of effort and the support of her family. She makes decorative mirrors and frames, which are very well-known by Nicaraguans, in the style of lion’s legs. She is 59 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Carlos Aguirre in the capital of Managua. Her two children are adults and are married. Her husband is vendor, who helps her distribute the merchandise to different departments. With this loan, she is going to buy materials to make the mirrors so that she can sell them to her clients. She thanks Afodenic for the benefits that she has from the investments in her business because of the loans she has received.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to make mirrors

loans.name: Bophann

texts.en:
Mrs. Bophann R. was born in 1980. She lives in Chhoeur Neang Khpoh Village in Takeo province. She sells Khmer noodles. 

Her husband, Mr. Reth Vannarith, is a motor taxi driver. He is also a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he grows rice. He faces an obstacle because he does not have enough money to buy rice seed or to plow the field, and he needs fertilizer to support the rice field. Thus, Mrs. Bophann R. has decided to ask for a loan to help her husband's business. 

She is 29 years old and the mother of two children. One of her children is enrolled in the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support the rice field.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
LUCY J. F., tiene 48 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad y profesionales. Ella vive en la V zona de Collique.
Tiene 12 años trabajando en su Salón de Belleza, Bazar y Librería.
Empezó con un salón pequeño que constaba de un sillón, un espejo y un mueble, luego de seis meses que pudo juntar un pequeño capital,  se trasladó a una zona mas comercial e invirtió en la implementación y decoración de su salón, además de invertir en mercadería de bazar.
Participó en una feria de venta de útiles escolares con lo que da inicio a su negocio de librería.
Hace cuatro años solicitó su primer préstamo a EDAPROSPO, los cuales lo ha destinado a la compra de mercadería y para terminar los acabados de su salón de belleza.
Esta vez solicita el préstamo para invertir en su librería.
texts.en:
Lucy J. F. is 48 years old, married, and has 2 adult children who are professionals. She lives in Zone 5 of Collique.

For the past 12 years, she has been operating a beauty salon, a bazaar, and a bookstore. She started her salon from a small room that consisted of a chair, a mirror, and a cabinet. After six months, she was able to accumulate a small amount of capital so that she could relocate to a more commercial area. Lucy established and decorated her salon, as well as purchased merchandise for her bazaar. She participated in a school supply fair that gave her the idea to open a bookstore.

It has been four years since Lucy received her first loan from EDAPROSPO, which she used to purchase merchandise and make final improvements to her beauty salon. For this loan, she will use the funds to purchase inventory for her bookstore.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her bookstore

loans.name: The Communal Bank San Fer Lay Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Fer Lay tiene ocho meses formado, es su segundo ciclo D. préstamo, lo integran  trece socias actualmente, ellas son socias muy dinámicas y colaboradoras. Kathy B. es la presidenta D. este Banco Comunal, ella es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 26 años D. edad y es madre D. un pequeño  D. tres años, se dedica a la venta D. prendas D. vestir, ella lo ofrece y deja a crédito. Este préstamo D. S 6,500 soles será invertido por cada socia es sus respectivos negocios, piensan comprar: productos D. priM. necesidad (arroz,. azúcar, fideos, etc.), insumos para preparar comidas, gaseosas, golosinas, materiales para costura. 
La meta del Banco Comunal es ser un equipo D. mujeres  responsables, unidas y solidarias.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank San Fer Lay was established eight months ago and is now in its second loan cycle. It's currently maD. up of thirteen partners who are dynamic and collaborative. Kathy B. is the president of the Communal Bank. She is an enterprising lady, 26 years old and the mother of a three-year-old son. She works selling garments, which she offers and which leave her in credit. This loan of 6,500 soles will be invested by each partner in their respective businesses, so that they can buy essential products (rice, sugar, noodles etc.) to prepare food, soft drinks, sweets and sewing materials. The goal of the Communal Bank is to be a group of responsible, united and supportive women.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy essential products to prepare food, soft drinks, sweets and sewing materials.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita A. is from the village of Mangidkid. She is 53 years old. Carmelita is married and has 9 adult children. To make a living, Carmelita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Carmelita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Carmelita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario” Ubicado en Villa Queñuani, del distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 39 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 02 hijos, vive en el Barrio Progreso, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar.

La señora inicia su trabajo con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos con un préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado menor para engorde.

Su mayor deseo es aumentar su capital.

A ella le  gustan las facilidades en los préstamos y las reuniones

loans.use: Para la compra de animales menores (aovinos y chanchos)

loans.name: Melida Catalina

texts.es:
El banco comunal Corazones Unidos está formado por hombres y mujeres que viven en la ciudad de Cuenca su centro  histórico  se ha caracterizado por ser la zona residencial más antigua y más bella siendo considerada Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su arquitectura, paisajes, gastronomía y amabilidad de la gente atrae al turista nacional y extranjero.  

La señora Melida J. es socia del  banco comunal Corazones Unidos, ella vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 36 años de edad se encuentra casada fruto de su matrimonio procreo cinco hijos, su primer hijo es  mayor de edad  y trabaja para aportar un poco con los gastos del  hogar, sus cuatro hijos restantes son menores y aún se encuentran estudiando, entre Méldia su esposo e hijo aportan económicamente con la manutención de la familia.

Melida se dedica a la venta de productos cosméticos para la mujer Oriflame,  sus ventas realiza mediante  catálogos   puerta a puerta, lleva tres años en este negocio y nos comenta que le va muy bien ya que es independiente y con lo que gana ha podido salir adelante con su familia.

Nuestra socia lleva un año trabajando con los  préstamos de la fundación y los ha invertido en su negocio para incrementar su stock; con el nuevo préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR  le entregue va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos, perfumes, cremas, etc., para incrementar su stock de productos para la época navideña.

Su sueño es incrementar su negocio por ende sus ingresos económicos para regalarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Corazones Unidos communal bank is made up of men and women who live in the city of Cuenca. Cuenca's city center has been declared a Cultural Heritage of Humanity for being the oldest and most beautiful residential area for its architecture, scenery, gastronomy and the kindness of its inhabitants. It attracts tourists from all over the world. Melinda J. is a member of the Corazones Unidos communal bank and lives in Cuenca. She is 36 years old, married, and the mother of 5 children. Her eldest is an adult and works contributing some to household expenses. The other four children are still minors and are students. The financial support of the family is met by Melinda, her husband, and her son. Melinda sells Oriflame cosmetics both via catalogue sales and door-to-door. She has been doing this for the past three years and she tells us that she does well because she is independent and she can use what she earns to help her family get ahead. She has been involved with us for the past year and the loans have been invested in increasing her stock. This new loan from FUNDACION ESPOIR will be used to buy cosmetics, perfumes, creams, etc to increase her stock for the Christmas season. Her dream is to increase her sales so that her income can improve thereby providing a better future for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, creams, perfumes, etc. for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia A. is from the village of Tigdok, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Alicia is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Alicia owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over 22 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Alicia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alicia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Alicia is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Alicia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Bebina

texts.en:
Bebina A. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman Camiguin Province. She is 39 years old. Bebina is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Bebina owns and operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Bebina has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Bebina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bebina is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Bebina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Joice Mirella

texts.es:
Joice es una mujer dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 23 años, es soltera y hace un año se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y joyas.
Joice forma parte del Banco Comunal “ Las Tigresas” hace dos años y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los que invirtió en la compra de polos y shorts para la venta.
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 500.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà joyas. 
La meta de Joice es seguir apoyando a su familia y tener una tienda comercial de artículos de belleza.
texts.en:
Joice is a dynamic woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali Region. She is 23 years old, single and for the last year has been working at selling beauty products and jewelry. For two years now, Joice has belonged to the Las Tigresas (The Tigresses) Communal Bank and the first loan of 300 New Sols which she received was invested in the purchase of polo shirts and shorts for resale. Currently she needs a loan of 500 New Sols with which to buy jewelry. Joice's goal is to continue supporting her family and to have a commercial store for beauty products.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jewelry.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca T. is from the village of Magsaysay, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Rebecca owns and operates a business selling selling personal collection Avon products like a make-up, lipsticks, etc., to local community members. She is just starting this business. Rebecca joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support extended members of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel tiene 38 años, vive con su hijo Jordan de 17 años, en la casa de sus padres, que es un inmueble que falta terminar de construir.
Ante la irresponsabilidad del padre de su hijo, Ysabel aprendió a no tenerle miedo a los retos, incursionó en diversos negocios, entre ellos la venta de juguetes, cerámicas y actualmente  cuadros. Al principio caminaba arduamente recorriendo los diversos mercados de la ciudad y sentía que no obtenía ganancias. Pero la perseverancia fue más que el cansancio y desde hace dos años administra su próspero negocio; pues tiene muchos clientes en todos los mercados de su localidad, cuenta con el apoyo de su padre, quien es el encargado específicamente de la distribución. 
Paralelamente, Ysabel trabaja como costurera en un taller textil, ya que desde niña le gustó tal oficio, ahora está cosiendo sabanas y edredones en sus horas libres, y en adelante planea comprarse máquinas industriales para implementar su propio taller en su vivienda. Por lo que su negocio de venta de cuadros se lo dejaría a su padre. 

Este es su décimo crédito con MFP y ratifica su compromiso de seguir siendo responsable en sus cuotas. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de telas para confeccionar más sabanas y cubre camas.
texts.en:
Ysabel is 38 years old. She lives with her son, Jordan, 17, in her parents’ house. It is a property constantly under construction. After dealing with the irresponsibility of Jordan’s father, Ysabel learned not to be afraid of challenges. She launched several businesses, including toy sales, ceramics, and now, pictures. At first, she sold on foot at all the markets of the city, and felt that she was not making much money. But her perseverance paid off and now she has operated her own prosperous business for two years. She has clients in all the markets and she counts on the support of her father, who is in charge of distribution. At the same time, Ysabel works as a seamstress in a textile workshop. This is a skill she has enjoyed from an early age. She sews sheets and quilts in her spare time, and plans to buy industrial sewing machines to set up her own workshop in her home. At that point, she would leave the picture business to her father. This is Ysabel’s tenth loan with MFP and she agrees to continue being responsible in her payments. With this money, she will buy material to make more sheets and bedspreads.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sewing materials

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
Noemí, de 23 años, es una joven muy emprendedora que vive al lado de sus padres, su hermana y sus dos pequeños hijos: José (7) y Adrián (5).
