Desde hace dos años se dedica al comercio, cada día se despierta muy temprano para realizar la venta ambulante de diversos artículos, tales como útiles de escritorio, juguetes, adornos, etc. No tiene un lugar fijo, pero sí tiene muchas ganas de trabajar para salir adelante, esta actividad la hace sola, ya que sus hijos estudian y su madre se encuentra enferma.
Lo difícil es tener que caminar largas horas bajo el intenso sol, pero vende bien y esto le genera las ganancias que le permiten mantener a sus hijos y a su madre. Por otro lado, sabe que puede llegar a obtener lo que quiera con mucho esfuerzo; y como es una joven muy emprendedora para el futuro desea instalar una librería en su casa y así ofrecer sus útiles en un lugar estable y con mayor tranquilidad.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está segura que cumplirá en el pago puntual de todas sus cuotas, ya que tiene muchas ganas de seguir progresando. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más mercadería en útiles para la campaña escolar que empieza en estos meses, sabe que las ganas de salir adelante por el bienestar de su familia es el motor que la impulsa cada día.
texts.en:
Noemí is 23 years old and is a very enterprising young woman who lives alongside her parents, sister and her two young children: José (7) and Adrián (5). For the past two years she has made a living as a merchant. Every morning she gets up very early in the morning to carry out her ambulatory sales of diverse items, such as office supplies, toys, decorations, etc. She doesn't have a fixed site, but she has a strong desire to keep working and making headway. She does her job alone since her kids are in school and her mother is ill. The most difficult part is having to walk many hours under the intense sun, but she sells well and it earns the income that allows her to provide for her children and mother. She knows that she can achieve what she wants with a lot of hard work, and, as an enterprising young woman, her wish is to set up a bookstore out of her home so she can offer her products in a more stable site under much calmer conditions. This is her first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she is certain she will comply with all her payments because she has a strong desire to keep making progress. With the money she is requesting, she plans to purchase more merchandise, specifically school supplies for the upcoming months. She knows that the desire to keep making headway for her family's well being is what drives her every day.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes O. is a single parent with two children. She has received a senior high education. Agnes sells foodstuffs such as tomatoes, onions, pepper, and provisions at Elmina, which she has been doing for some time now. Agnes uses her income to pay school fees and utility bills. Agnes will use the loan to purchase more provisions and food supplies to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes plans to save in order to reinvest in the business and to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and food supplies to sell

loans.name: Julianna

texts.es:
Julianna tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos menores de edad, vive junto a su madre en el distrito de Castilla, de la provincia de Piura en la región Piura, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace tres años se dedica a la distribución de ropa y calzado en su domicilio. Ella viaja frecuentemente a las ciudades de Trujillo y Lima para comprar la mercadería que necesita y distribuirla en base a pedidos que le hacen sus clientes. Este negocio le ha brindado los ingresos necesarios para seguir manteniendo a sus hijos y también apoyar a su madre con los gastos familiares.

Debido al inicio de clases escolares en la mayoría de colegios del país, Julianna ha estado recibiendo pedidos de zapatos de colegio por parte de sus clientes. Por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de calzado para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

Julianna es una mujer que ha sabido responder con calma, responsabilidad y buen ánimo a los retos que le ha puesto la vida. Ella no se avergüenza de su situación de madre soltera, sino que lucha diariamente para salir adelante. Su mayor anhelo es ver convertidos a sus hijos en profesionales y hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Juliana, age 32, is a single mother and has two minor children. She lives with her mother in the Castilla district, Piura province, Piura region. It is three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the the Lambayeque region. For three years she has been distributing clothes and footwear from her home. She frequently travels to the cities of Trujillo and Lima to buy the merchandise she needs. She delivers it according to orders that her customers make. This business has given her the necessary income to keep supporting her children. It also helps her mother with the family expenses. Due to the start up of classes in most schools in the country, Juliana has been receiving orders for school shoes from her customers. That is why she is asking for her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,500 PEN. She plans to use the money to buy footwear to satisfy her customers’ demand. Julianna is a woman who has known how to respond calmly, responsibly, and in good spirits to the challenges life has presented. She is not embarrassed about being a single mother, and she fights everyday to get ahead. Her biggest desire is to see her sons become professionals and upstanding citizens.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy school shoes to expand her business

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en: Every day, Mrs. S. goes to the market and buys ingredients that she uses to produce fritters to sell to her neighbors for daily profit, earning approximately US$ 2 a day. She has another breadwinner in her husband who drives a motor taxi. The couple is blessed with ten children; four of them are married and the others are single. Four of their daughters are employed at different tasks. To earn additional income, S. requests a loan to buy pigs to begin raising them in her stall. Mrs. S. was not available at the time when the photo was taken so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To buy pigs to begin raising them in her stall

loans.name: Mario Enrique

texts.es: Mario Enrique M. C. de 33 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Sonsonate, lugar en el cual vive junto a su familia la cual esta conformada por su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, y junto a sus dos hijos de 9 y cinco años de edad los cuales son estudiantes. Mario posee un negocio en el cual comercializa suplementos deportivos como uniformes, balones, y otros más. Desde hace 7 años que el negocio esta ubicado en este lugar, contando con muchos clientes como estudiantes de colegios y equipos que juegan en el lugar, lo cual le permite mantener estable su negocio. Él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda incrementar su mercadería comprando accesorios como calcetas, rodilleras, protectores,  guantes, balones y otros productos más los cuales son muy necesarios para las personas que practican deportes.
texts.en:
Mario Enrique M. C. is 33, lives in Sonsonate with his family comprised by his wife who is a homemaker and their two children ages nine and five who are students. Mario has a business where he commercializes sport items such as jerseys, balls and others. He's had the business at its current location for seven years, having many clients such as college students and sport teams which allows him to maintain a stable business. He requests a loan through which he can increase merchandise buying accessories such as socks, knee pads, protectors, gloves, balls and other products that are necessary for the people that play sports.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sport items

loans.name: Pablo Eliecer

texts.es:
Pablo Eliecer R. B., tiene 38 años y vive en el barrio la Magdalena al sur de Barranquilla, con su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 1 a 19 años, él es un hombre muy inquieto que vende  queso desde cuando quedó sin empleo y un amigo le enseñó las bases de este negocio;  ahora vende por encargo este producto en un fin de semana  y en el otro vende frutas como cerezas,  manzanas y uvas chilenas, pero como buen comerciante ofrece a todo el que conoce  mercancía al detal, especialmente calzado para damas y caballeros que también maneja a crédito. Esta es una de las razones por la cual solicita su segundo crédito por valor de $1.700.000 para invertir  la  mayor cantidad de queso que es su producto estrella, otra parte en los encargos de cerezas frescas y la otra en calzado para damas y caballeros.
Su negocio de queso empezó hace 12 años cando solo vendía una o dos libras, ahora tiene más cliente y vende 120 kilos, él lo compra en los cuartos fríos, su esposa lo apoya porque trabaja en una empresa y también está atenta a conseguirle clientes. Su meta principal es educar bien a sus hijos ofrecerles estudios de calidad y este es su más grande reto, más adelante  sueña con tener un carro propio, para llevarle la mercancía a sus clientes pues en la actualidad se  transporta en moto y paga su pasaje.
texts.en:
Pablo Eliecer R. B. is 38 and lives in the La Magdalena neighborhood in southern Barranquilla with his wife and 4 children, who range in age from 1 to 19 years. He is a very enterprising man who has sold cheese since he was once left without a job. A friend taught him the basics of this business. Now he sells his product by making deliveries on the weekend. On the other days, he sells cherries, apples, and Chilean grapes, but like a good merchant, he retails every kind of merchandise with which he is familiar, especially men's and women's shoes, which he sells on credit. This is one of the reasons he is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,700,000 Colombian pesos: to invest mostly in the purchase cheese, which is his star product. He will also invest some in the purchase of cherries and strawberries and in shoes for men and women. He started his cheese business 12 years ago when he only sold 1-2 pounds. Now he has more customers and sells 120 kilograms, which he buys in cold, 1/4 kilogram blocks. His wife helps him because she works at a company, and she is also thoughtful and tries to earn new customers for him. His main goal is to educated his children well and to offer them high-quality studies. This is his biggest challenge. Later on, he hopes to have his own car so he can take his merchandise to his customers. Currently he transports his goods on a motorcycle that he pays to use.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cheese, his main product, as well as fresh cherries and men's and women's shoes.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina R. is from the village of San Jose. She is 42 years old. Gina is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Gina has been engaged in her business for over 24 years and earns approximately 150,000 PHP a month every harvest season.

In 2005, Gina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 28,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Gina is requesting a new loan of 32,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the tenth loan taken out by Gina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba C. is from the village of Canitoan, Kalilangan Bukidnon. She is 48 years old. Melba is married and has 4 school-aged children. She owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Melba has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2009, Melba joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melba has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to  purchase additional inventory & working capital. Melba is requesting her fourth loan, for 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: for store inventory

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Mrs. Seng O. operates her own small trade out of her home. She makes traditional noodles to sell to buyers who come to purchase directly from her house. She is married and blessed with four school-aged kids, while her husband works on their farm fields. Recently, Seng O. got orders from her regular clients but her inventory is not adequate to fill them. Because she has no money, Seng O. requests a loan to purchase ingredients to produce noodles to meet her customers' requirements.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to produce noodles.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is married to a businessman and they have five children, all of whom go to school. Christine also takes care of additional family members.  She owns a canteen and sells snacks like chapatti, samosas, donuts, and pancakes. She wants to use this loan to buy more baking flour, cooking oil, cow peas, and a bag of charcoal. She has been in this business for five years. Besides this canteen business she also sells firewood at her stall in Natete market. Her customers are the market vendors. She works six days a week. Her business challenges include thieves and transportation of firewood from villages to her place of work. She is aspiring to grow her business and eventually own a big bakery. Christine decided to work with MCDT because of the trustworthy staff. She resides in and owns a two-room house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees, food, and medication.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and cooking ingredients

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; El  socio vive en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.
	
El socio es el Sr. Feliciano; el tiene 61 años de edad y El socio es viudo y tiene dos hijos es natural de Yucay y radica en Urcos desde hace más de 20 años, él tiene trabajando en venta de medicina natural cerca de 40 años, El socio es una persona responsable y con muchos deseos de superación y apoya a sus hijos e todo lo que puede, él socio suele viajar y traer productos naturales para vender en su tienda ubicada en el centro de la plaza de Urcos. El socio  solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de medicina natural para vender.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Feliciano belongs to the “Qori Orcco” Communal Bank and lives in Urcos district, province of Quispicanchis, Department of Cusco. He is 61 years old, a widower, with 2 children, and was born in Yucay. Feliciano has lived in Urcos for more than 20 years and has been selling natural medicines for over 40 years. He is a responsible person with a great desire to get ahead and help his children in every way he can. He wants to travel and bring natural products to sell in his store, located in the center of the plaza in Urcos. Feliciano requests a loan to buy natural medicine products to sell. He values and is infinitely thankful for the credit offered, because this permits his business to grow and his quality of life to improve. Feliciano commits himself to comply with his payments as scheduled.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING NATURAL MEDICINE PRODUCTS TO SELL

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 34 years old and married with two children who are 12 and 5 years old.  He operates Biz Niz Enterprises where he sells electrical goods.  He has done the business for over ten years.  He gets contracts for wiring in building sites to get more income.  Currently, his major challenge is inadequate stock. Therefore, he has requested a loan of 60,000 KES.  With the loan, he will buy cables, bulb holders, bulbs, sockets, cello tapes and soldering materials.  Peter hopes to become a well-known electrician in the future.  He sees himself being the major supplier of electrical and electronic goods in the future.

loans.use: To buy cables, bulb holders, bulbs, sockets, cello tapes and soldering materials

loans.name: Santusa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; La socia vive en la provincia de Urubamba, departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Santusa; ella tiene 31 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos la socia se dedica a la elaboración de chicha, ella compra maíz y lleva y procesa la chicha para la venta en su casa.  La socia solicita el préstamo para compra maíz para elaborar la chicha. 

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado  y de este modo se compromete en cumplir con las cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Santusa is a member of the Communal Bank “San José de Urubamba”. She lives in the Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

Santusa is 31 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children. She prepares “chicha” (a beverage made from corn). Santusa buys the corn and brings it home to process into chicha before selling it. She is requesting a loan to buy corn for making chicha.

Santusa says she is grateful and values the loan that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn for preparing "chicha"

loans.name: Delphine

texts.fr: F. Delphine est née en 1975 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à GBETCHOU Robert, Delphine est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Il y a environs sept ans que Delphine s'est installée au quartier Agbato à Cotonou, où elle vit avec ses enfants et son mari. Delphine vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les différentes charges de la famille, grâce au revenu de son activité. Depuis une douzaine d'année, Delphine mène comme activité la vente de divers produits (pâtes alimentaires, huile d'arachide et de palme, couscous, savons, lait, conserves de sardine et de tomate, petits pois, etc.) dans sa boutique à son domicile. Delphine achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est la deuxième fois que Delphine sollicite auprès de ALIDé un crédit, en vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Delphine a bien remboursé le premier prêt qu'elle a reçu de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Delphine F. was born in 1975 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Robert Gbetchou, she is the mother of two children, both attending (or having attended) school. Seven years ago Delphine settled in the Agbalo borough of Cotonou, where she lives with her husband and children. She assists her husband in taking care of various family expenses, thanks to the revenue generated by her activity. For the past 12 years, Delphine has been active as a retail merchant, selling various products (pasta, peanut and palm oil, couscous, soap, milk, canned sardines and tomatoes, green peas, etc.) in her home-based shop. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. This is the second time Delphine has requested a loan from ALIDé, to strengthen her activity and improve customer satisfaction. She fully reimbursed the first loan received from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products (pasta, peanut and palm oil, canned sardines and tomatoes, green peas)

loans.name: Minda

texts.en: Minda M. is from the village of Flores, Naguillan, Isabela. She is 42 years old and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Minda operates a jeepney transportation service to the local community. Minda has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Minda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Minda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. Minda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to repair another transport vehicle used in the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Minda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta D., 52, manages a small farm. She grows rice and she earns enough income from it to buy food and cover the basic needs for her family. She also grows pigs and she dreams that someday she will have a bigger piggery business. 

At the moment, she would like to apply a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos. She will use it for buying farm supplies like fertilizers and seeds.

loans.use: Farm supplies like fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Floribel's Group

texts.en:
Floribel B. is from the village of Ugad. She is 28 years old. Floribel is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Floribel B..

Floribel is single. To make a living, Floribel owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Floribel is just starting this business.

In 2010, Floribel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Floribel is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in future. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Floribel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Matano

texts.en:
Matano is married man with a child who attends school. He lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Matano’s greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Matano operates a business making jikos, Kenyan ceramic cook stoves, for resale. His potential customers are women who purchase jikos for cooking. Matano's major challenge in the future is seasonality, as sometimes it is difficult to get the used metal that is a raw material needed to make jikos. 

Matano is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase metals that are used in making jikos. He hopes to open a big workshop in the future and decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase metal to make ceramic cook stoves (jikos)

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” ubicado en el distrito Azángaro,  provincia de Azángaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 48 años de edad, de estado civil  conviviente y tiene 03 hijos (01 dependientes), la señora estudió educación primaria.

Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 02 años, nos cuenta que el primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  utilizó para  incrementar el capital de su negocio de venta de escobas y escobillas para zapatos.

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá  para comprar materiales para su negocio como colas, alambres y maderas.

Su sueño para el futuro es engrandar su taller. Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la facilidad del préstamo y intercambiar palabras con las socias.
texts.en:
Francisca is a member of the “Punta Sahuacasi” community bank which is located in Azángaro district, Azángaro province, in the department of Puno.   She is 48 years old and lives with her partner.  She has 3 children (1 dependent).  She completed her primary education.

Francisca has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 2 years.  She tells us that her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles which she used to increase the working capital of her business selling brooms and shoe brushes.

She is requesting a new loan for 1,000 nuevos soles which she will invest in buying material for her business such as glue, wire and wood.

Her dream for the future is to expand her workshop.  What she most likes about her community bank is the ease of obtaining a loan and being able to chat with other members.

loans.use: To buy material such as glue, wire and wood

loans.name: Rakita Ole

texts.en:
Rakita Ole K. is 41 years old. He is married to Talasha K. and a father of seven school-going children. He is a businessman involved in the trade of livestock, which he buys and sells at a profit.

He learned about KADET from other members in a group already registered with KADET in his area of residence. This will be his first loan, which he is planning to spend to buy more cattle for fattening and then selling. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his business and become a commercial animal seller.

Rakita‘s dream is do well in the business and start dairy farming. He is a hard working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To buy more cattle for fattening and selling

loans.name: Pech's Group

texts.en:
The fifteen people who make up this village bank loan live in Prey Theat village in Takeo province. They will use their portion of the loan to improve their family living.  They have selected Mrs. Pech H. to become the village bank president.          

Mrs. Pech H. owns a general store in the local village.  She is able to earn profit to support her family.  Her husband, Mr. Sabun Meas, is a staff member in an organization.  He is also a farmer who owns a 1.50-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell to support his family.  

They try to work a lot but they earn very little income.  So to improve her family, Mrs. Pech H. is applying for a loan to buy some piglets and chickens for breeding to start a new business. She has a child who is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy piglets and chicken to breed and sell

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua A. is married and has four children. Her husband is a carpenter.  She has received junior high education.  Ekua cooks banku and serves it with okra and pepper sauce at Abura, which she has been doing for twenty years. Ekua uses her income to assist her husband in taking care of her family. She is going to use the loan she hopes to receive to buy bags of maize to prepare banku and to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to put up a structure where her customers can eat.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize to prepare banku and to sell.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en: Alaa is a 28-year-old married man from Gaza who lives with his wife and three children. One of the children has entered school.  In 2009, Alaa opened his own carpentry business. He is now hoping that with this loan, he will be able to buy all the equipment that he needs for his carpentry store, which will bring in more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy equipment needed for his carpentry store.

loans.name: Sarita De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La señora Sarita de los Ángeles H. G. es trabajadora de una Empresa de Acueductos y Alcantarillado, desempeñando el cargo de Conserje desde hace 6 años.

Es Soltera con 30 años de edad, bachiller, no tiene personas a cargo, Vive en la ciudad de Managua en el Municipio de Tipitapa, desde hace 30 años.

Este es el Primer crédito que tiene con CEPRODEL y se encuentra agradecida por este préstamo, ya que le permitirá construir un servicio Higiénico en su casa, y poder estar en un ambiente seguro y saludable.
texts.en:
Sarita de los Ángeles H. G. has been working as a caretaker in a Water Supply and Sewerage Company for 6 years.  She is 30 years old and single.  She has a high school graduate and doesn't have anybody in her care.  She has lived in the city of Managua, in Tipitapa municipality, for 30 years.

This is Sarita's first loan with CEPRODEL and she is grateful to be receiving the loan since it will allow her to build a bathroom in her home which will enable her to live in a safe and healthy environment.

loans.use: To build a bathroom

loans.name: Um

texts.en:
Um S., age 38, makes a living by selling fish and pork in and around Kompong Tom province. Um S. sells fish that she buys from fishermen and pork from her husband's butcher business. She currently earns an average of US $3 a day, and she has been running her business for years. Her husband is 34 years old and is a local butcher. 

Um S. is the mother of three teenage children who are no longer in school. All of her children are working at various occupations, and they each contribute some of their incomes to help the family meet its daily expenses. 

Um S.’s employed son has been paying money for taxis to get to work because he doesn't own a vehicle. To solve this problem, Um S. is applying for a loan to purchase a used motorcycle, which will allow her son to commute to his work location.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle for her son in order to provide transportation for him to get to his work location.

loans.name: God Will Provide Group

texts.en:
Sophia W., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God Will Provide.  She is 62 years old, widowed, and has five children who are between the ages of 45 and 33 years. She was only able to attend school through 2nd grade due to financial constraints. 

For 15 years, she has been selling pepper, palm oil, rice, salt, etc in Garnerville, outside Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 7,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 31,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more pepper, palm oil, rice, salt, charcoal etc. to sell.  She describes herself as a hard-working woman whose goal is to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy pepper, palm oil, rice, salt, etc. to sell

loans.name: Sor's Group

texts.en:
This village loan consists of eleven members who will use their portions to support different purposes. Mrs. Sor, a married woman who was born in 1980, was selected to be the village bank president by the other members. 

Mrs. Sor earns a living by selling groceries in the local village. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to support and enlarge her business. Her husband, Mr. Pin, was born in 1979 and works as a house constructor. He is also able to earn a small amount of income to support their family. The couple has two children who attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to expand her business

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba F. is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer, and she is a fishmonger from Ntranoa, a village near the fishing town of Elmina. In the photograph, she is smoking fish. She has been in this business for 35 years. Araba also sells oil for additional income. The income she earns contributes to her children’s education and some of the household expenses.

Araba wants to expand her business so that she can save up enough money to provide her four children with a meaningful education. Her loan will be used to purchase larger quantities of fish and oil to sell.

loans.use: To purchase larger quantities of fish and oil

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en:
Onesmus is a member of Faulu Kenya under Wendani group.  He joined the group so that he would save his money.  In the group, he is able to access loans easily.  

Onesmus does dairy farming for a living.  It's twenty years since he started the business.  He has employed one person to assist him in the farm.  He hopes to add more cows to his farm for more milk production.  He has requested 50,000 Kes to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mira's Group

texts.en:
Mira A. is a member of this group. She is 40 and married to a tractor driver. Together they bring up two daughters and two sons. The first son studies at the university and the other children are at school. The family is engaged in agriculture. They cultivate agricultural products and then after getting the harvest, they sell some part of it to make money. In this way, they earn 8500 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Mira wants to purchase 30 liters of fuel and potato seeds. In the future, she wants to provide her children with a good education. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fuel

loans.name: Futuro De Vida (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Futuro de Vida esta formado por 9 mujeres y un hombre quienes trabajan diariamente en diferentes oficios que le permiten aportar a la economía familiar y ofrecerles un mejor futuro. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca que fue nombrada en 1999 como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, esta ciudad es hermosa por su cultura, tradiciones, su variada gastronomía y por su gente que es calida y cordial.

La Señora. María Angelina M. vive por el sector de Perespata en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 52 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 26, 20, 17, 15 y 9 años de edad, su primer hijo es  casado e independiente, sus hijos de 20 y 15 años trabajan y ayudan a la economía del hogar, su hijo de 17 años estudia en el colegio y su ultimo hijo en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en un pequeño taller de aluminio y vidrio que es de su propiedad, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive arrendado.

Doña María se dedica a la venta de joyas de goldfield y cosméticos de la marca Avon, actividad  la realiza hace 8 años, vende a sus amigas, conocidas y clientela que le conoce. También se dedica a la fabricación de guaipe (Trapos para limpiar) y a la recolección de chatarra.

Se encuentra en el primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal  y lo va a invertir en la compra de joyas y cosméticos Avon.

Su meta es de tener un vehículo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Futuro de Vida” (Future of Life) consists of nine women and one man. They work every in different trades so that they can support their families financially and provide them a better future. They live in different areas within the city of Cuenca, which was named a World Heritage Site in 1999. This beautiful city is known for its culture, its traditions, its various cuisines, and its warm and cordial people.

Sra. María Angelina M. lives in the sector of Perespata in the city of Cuenca. She is 52 years old, married, and has five children (ages 26, 20, 17, 15, and 9). Her oldest child is married and independent. The children who are 20 and 15 work and help with the household expenses. Her 17-year-old son is a high school student and her youngest son attends elementary school in the city. María’s husband works in a small aluminum and glass shop that he owns. They live in a rental property since they do not own a home.

Doña María sells goldfield jewelry and cosmetics from the Avon brand. She has been in business for eight years and sells her products to friends, acquaintances, and customers who know her. She also manufactures “guaipe” (rags used for cleaning) and collects scrap metal.

She is receiving her first loan from the Communal Bank and will invest the funds in the purchase of jewelry and Avon cosmetics. Her goal is to own a vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 28-year-old Lebanese single man living with one parent and two siblings. He has been working as a mechanic for the past 13 years. He started his career at a very young age.  In 2000, he opened his own car repair shop. He specializes in repairing vehicle bodies. He has taken advantage of his first Kiva loan and has been a reliable client, paying on his scheduled dates. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase more needed tools in order to reinforce his business operation and further develop his work.

loans.use: to purchase more tools

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Mrs. Van is a 61-year-old farmer and mother from the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She was blessed with four children, two of whom are employed in various jobs. Her husband, Gnim, is 52 and works in the farming business. Mrs. Van and her husband grow different kinds of crops on the farmland she inherited from her grandmother. Mrs. Van will be using her loan to buy a secondhand motorcycle for her children to ride to work so that they can decrease their traveling expenses. Mrs. Van and her husband are pictured under their house.

loans.use: to buy a secondhand motorcycle for her children to ride to work

loans.name: Edgar Armando

texts.es: Edgar : de 31 años de edad es casado y tiene cuatro hijos dos grandes estudian en un colejio de la comunidad donde el vive su negocio es de venta de electodomesticos lo hinicio hace 5 años el esta solicictando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia ya que sus clientes le piden pedidos grandes y le falta mas capital para satisfacer a sus clientes.Su sueño es agrandar mas su negocio y darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en: Edgar, 31, is married and has four children; the two oldest attend the local secondary school.  His business is selling home appliances.  He started it five years ago.  He is asking for this loan to buy more merchandise because his customers place large orders and he needs capital to meet customer demand.  His dream is to enlarge the business more and provide a better future for his children.

loans.use: to buy home appliances.

loans.name: Orlando Enrique

texts.es:
Orlando  es un hombre de 43 años  casado, que tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 10 y 16 por los cuales él y su cónyuge no se cansan de trabajar para brindarles bienestar.   Orlando vive en pleno centro de Malambo, un municipio a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla,   receptor de muchas personas que vienen desde todos los rincones del país; en este municipio  abundan en sus barrios las actividades informales  y también se encuentra ubicado el parque Industrial de Malambo S.A. “Pimsa” donde ingresan Motonaves Marítimas procedentes de Estados Unidos, Centro y Sur América y el Caribe.
Orlando tiene el negocio de alquiler de lavadoras desde hace 11 años, su esposa también es una mujer trabajadora,  con habilidades culinarias que pone en marcha dedicándose al  negocio de preparar pasteles los fines de semana y vender refrescos. Estos dos negocios les ha  permitido obtener ingresos con los cuales han logrado el bienestar de su hogar; Gradualmente   se han expandido, consiguiendo hacer inversiones importantes para su crecimiento, como cuando compraron el enfriador y una vitrina calentadora, para dar una imagen de calidad a su microempresa. Así mismo han aprovechado su clientela para vender minutos a celulares, generando ingresos adicionales, así como también compraron    una moto taxi, vehículo muy usual en esta población, para transportarse. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que Orlando  hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará 4 lavadoras más, e insumos para la preparación de sus pasteles,  pues su cobertura en el servicio de lavadoras se ha ampliado y muchas veces pierde clientes porque no puede responder oportunamente a la gran demanda que se presenta. Con esta inversión espera mejorar la rentabilidad y fortalecer su trabajo y el de su esposa como independientes para que sus hijos se proyecten con mucho éxito.
texts.en:
Orlando is a 43 year-old, married man who has two children aged 10 and 16.  He and his wife do not tire in working to provide for their children's well-being.  Orlando lives in the very center of Malambo, a town which is located 15 minutes from the city of Barranquilla.  Malambo is a place where many people come to live from all corners of the country.  In the neighborhoods of this town, there are a lot of informal businesses.  One can also find the Malambo S.A. "Pimsa" industrial park where motorboats come from the US, Central and South America and the Caribbean.

Orlando has been in business renting out washing machines for 11 years.  His wife is also a hard-working woman who has culinary skills which she uses in her business making cakes and selling soft drinks on a weekend.  These two businesses have allowed the couple to make income for the well-being of their household.  They have gradually expanded their businesses and made important investments in order to help them grow such as, for example, when they bought a cooler and a heated display case, to provide their small businesses with a good image.  They have also made the most of their customer base in order to sell their customers cell phone minutes too.  This makes them additional income.  They also bought a motorcycle taxi which is a common type of vehicle in this area and is used to transport passengers.

This Kiva loan is Orlando's first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use it to buy four additional washing machines and supplies for making cakes.  His washing machine service has expanded and he often loses customers because he cannot respond in a timely fashion to the great demand that he has.  As a result of this investment, Orlando hopes to improve his profitability and strengthen both his own and his wife's business so that their children can be successful.

loans.use: to buy four additional washing machines and supplies for making cakes

loans.name: Bendición De Dios Group

texts.en:
Veronica is the president of this group comprised of two women and one man living and working in Ibarra, Ecuador. Veronica, Maria and Alvaro formed their group in February of this year and are already beginning their second loan cycle. Veronica is 24 and lives in Ibarra with her 6-year-old daughter and her 4-year-old daughter. She has one more child on the way. She is a calm, peaceful and cheerful person. She is a homebody who is hardworking and responsible. 

Veronica raises, fattens and sells pigs. She started her business with only two pigs. Later, with a loan from FODEMI, she purchased more pigs so that she could sell one or two pigs each month. Veronica says that her work is going well because she has made progress and now has the possibility to grow her business. Veronica’s new loan will be used to buy more pigs and pig feed. Her past loan helped her increase the amount of animals she has in her herd. In the near future, she’d like to add chickens to her business. Veronica’s dream is to continue growing her business with the support of microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy artificial jewelry to sell

loans.name: Esmily

texts.en:
Esmily is a 33-year-old married mother of three children. She is a dry fish vendor, a business that has been in operation for the past sixteen years.

She is a KADET client and this is her fourth loan. With the money she plans to purchase more fish to sell. She hopes to use the profit from her sales to repay her loan and to also support her family.

Her main dream is to expand her business and to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fish to sell

loans.name: Hebert

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en el  mercado Virgen Asunta en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio Hebert tiene 27 años de edad,  el socio es soltero; el socio trabaja en turismo como guía y está terminando sus estudios de turismo en el instituto, él va comprando poco a poco con el crédito que obtiene mediante este medio su equipo de turismo, el socio está deseando poder comprarse sleeping, y una carpa, por ahora. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de equipo de turismo.

El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Hebert is a member of the Communal Bank “Siempre Unidos” (Always United) which is located in the Virgen Asunta Market in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

He is 27 years old and single. Hebert works as a tour guide and is finishing his studies in tourism at an institute. He buys merchandise a little bit at a time, so he will use this loan to obtain equipment for tourists. Hebert wants to buy sleeping bags and a tent for now. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of camping equipment for tourists.

Hebert is grateful for the support that has been provided and promises to complete his payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy camping equipment for tourists.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es: Paulino, natural de la ciudad de San Francisco, tiene 32 años de edad, es un joven soltero y sobre todo muy entusiasta en sus labores, vive en la casa de sus padres y se esmera a diario para entregar lo mejor a su futura familia. Paulino se esmera en trabajar arduamente sus campos de cultivo donde siembra variedad de plantas tropicales como: cacao, café, y frutas de piña, los cuales después de cosecharlos los lleva a vender a la ciudad de San Francisco, en donde ya tiene diversos compradores, que sabiendo de la calidad de sus productos no dudan en ir al encuentro para comprarle todos sus frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles y productivas, lleva  05 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es combatir la plaga de insectos que se apoderan de los brotes de los frutos, es por ello que tiene que combatirlos de manera natural colocando trampas y cortinas para no dañar el medio ambiente. En adelante, espera seguir ahorrando sus ingresos por que desea comprar nuevas tierras. Este es será su sexto crédito con MFP y  ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos anteriores y espera beneficiarse una vez más con el crédito y de ante mano agradece a todos ustedes por concederle el préstamos. Los 3,000 soles que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para mejorar la calidad de sus tierras y sembrios.
texts.en:
Paulino is originally from the city of San Francisco. He is 32 years old, single and very enthusiastic in his work. He lives at his parents' home and works hard to provide for his future family. Paulino works hard in his farm, where he grows different tropical plants such as cocoa, coffee and pinaple fruit. After the harvest he sells them in San Francisco, where he already knows several buyers. They know of the quality of his products and don't hesitate to meet him and buy all of his products. 

What he enjoys the most about his work is sowing the fields and making them fertile and productive. He has been in this line of business for 5 years and thinks that the main difficulty is fighting the insect plagues in the fruit. He fights them naturally, using traps and nets to avoid damaging the environment. 

In the future he hopes to continue to save money because he would like to buy more land. This will be his sixth loan with MFP and he has paid back previous loans on time. He hopes to benefit once more from the loan and is very grateful in advance to everyone providing him with a loan. He will invest the 3,000 soles requested in the purchase of manure and fertilizers to improve the quality of his land and crops.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Annalou

texts.en: Annalou is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and five children. For the last nine years, she has earned a living by running a store where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to more items to sell to her customers. She joined HSPFI earlier this year as a way to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell in her store.

loans.name: Joselito

texts.en:
Joselito is married and has four school-age children. He is 40 years old and lives in Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte, Philippines.

Joselito is a farmer and a gardener. He has been planting and harvesting coconuts to earn a living. He makes money from the palms, fruits, husks, shells and logs. He has owned and enjoyed this business for 15 years already. 

His spouse runs a small business as well. Having all these sources, Joselito gets PHP 9,000 a month. He has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 from GDMPC to invest in expanding his coconut production. 

Joselito is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, he hopes to improve and expand the business to earn more income. He plans to buy some land and hopes for a high buying rate of coconuts in the future.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his coconut production.

loans.name: Espoir Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ESPOIR est composé de trois membres qui sont des amies. La représentante de ce groupe du nom de Sèna Augustine est celle qui à une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe sollicite pour une première  fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Sèna Augustine est âgée de 41 ans et est mariée à Razak, un revendeur. Le couple  a un enfant scolarisé et à leur charge. Sèna Augustine a arrêté l'école au cours primaire. Pour subvenir à ses différents besoins, Sèna Augustine mène comme activité la vente des friperies. A côté de cette activité Sèna Augustine fait le service traiteur.Sèna Augustine exerce cette activité depuis quatre ans.Sèna Augustine s'approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle,Sèna Augustine et les autres membres du groupe ESPOIR sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en:
The 'ESPOIR' (Hope) group has three members who are friends.  The group's representative, called Sèna Augustine, is the lady raising her hand in the photo.  With the goal of boosting their businesses so that they can better meet their customer demand, this group are requesting the financial support of ALIDé for the first time.

Sèna Augustine is 41 years old and married to Razak, a re-seller.  The couple have one child in school who is in their care.  Sèna Augustine stopped attending school during her primary education.  In order to cover her different needs, she works selling used clothing.  In addition to this business, she also works as a caterer.  She has been in this business for four years.  She stocks up in the markets in Benin.  With the goal of strengthening their businesses and better satisfying their customers, Sèna Augustine and the other members of the ESPOIR group are requesting a loan from ALIDé.  Their ambition is to grow their businesses.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothing

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 31 year-old single man.  He does a carpentry. He has been in this business for the last two years and earns an income of KES.11,900 per month.

Patrick has a good credit history in KADET LTD, and he is applying for his second loan of KES.30,000 with which he plans to buy wood for the business.  He will use the anticipated profit to expand the business.

Patrick hopes to raise a family and to boost the business to be big. He is very hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase wood for the business.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.es: La señora Glenda trabaja en una tienda de ventas de artículos para damas y además es pintora y pinta cuadros. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una computadora portátil, una mesa de dibujo, una impresora y materiales para sus pinturas; así será más eficiente su trabajo. Vive en  casa en alquiler la misma queda  ubicada en la zona de Achumani de la ciudad de La Paz, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Es la segunda vez que el cliente obtiene un crédito en IMPRO y también la segunda vez que se fondea a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Glenda works in a store that sells women’s items but she’s also an artist; she paints.  She needs the loan to buy a laptop computer, a drawing table, a printer and supplies for her painting so that her work will be more efficient.  She lives in a rented house located in the city of La Paz’s Achumani zone; she’s single and has no children.  This is the second time she’s gotten an IMPRO loan and also the second time it’s funded through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a computer, a drawing table, a printer and supplies.

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna is 49 years old, married and has 2 children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 28 years now, and has borrowed 24 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, Erna would like to save enough to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: To buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa, age 44, oversees the operations of the tricycle transportation business she operates with her husband Bienvenido, who drives the vehicle and performs maintenance. They both manage their household while running their business. They have one tricycle unit that carries up to four passengers. For additional income, Luisa sells personal products.  

She lives with her husband and their child in GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She works hard to continually provide income for the everyday expenses of the family. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She earns a minimum of PhP 500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PhP 24,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan for maintenance of their motorcycle vehicle. 

She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business over the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members*, where she shares stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their motorized tricycle unit

loans.name: Vadim

texts.ru:
Вадим женат. Его супругу зовут Наталья. У них двое детей. Вадим имеет свой бизнес - он занимается фермерством. 

Вадим выращивает ранние овощи: помидоры, капусту, перец, баклажаны и т.д. Ему нравится это направление, и он хочет развиваться. Вадим трудолюбивый, предприимчивый и целеустремленный.  Этот бизнес - основной источник дохода для семьи Вадима.

Вадим просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 15,000 гривен на закупку удобрения, семян, пленки. Кредит поможет ему увеличить прибыль и улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en:
Vadim is married. His wife's name is Natalia. They have two children. Vadim has own business - he is engaged in farming.

Vadim grows early vegetables such as tomatoes, cabbage, peppers, eggplant, etc. He likes this business and he wants to develop it. Vadim is industrious, enterprising and goal oriented. This business is the main source of income for Vadim's family.

Vadim is asking for a loan in the amount of 15,000 hryvna to buy fertilizer, seeds and film. The loan will help him increase profits and improve the welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and film for the greenhouses.

loans.name: Mahukpego Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUKPEGO est composé de deux personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Adelaïde Ayaba est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Adelaïde Ayaba est âgée de 46 ans et vit au Bénin. Adelaïde Ayaba n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Adelaïde Ayaba est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Alphonse. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Adelaïde Ayaba vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Adelaïde Ayaba vend depuis une vingtaine d’année, divers produits, des céréales et des chaussures. Adelaïde Ayaba s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Adelaïde Ayaba sollicite ensemble avec le second membre du groupe MAHUKPEGO, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: MAHUKPEGO is a group composed of 2 people who live in the same neighborhood. The group representative, Adelaïde Ayaba, is the one raising her hand on the picture. Adelaïde Ayaba is 46 and lives in Benin. Adelaïde Ayaba never went to school. She is married to a mechanic named Alphonse. They care for their 4 children, who all go to school. Adelaïde Ayaba lives with her husband and her children. They both take care of the family financially. In order to meet the financial needs of her family, Adelaïde Ayaba has been selling miscellaneous items for about 20 years (cereal, shoes, etc). She buys those items in a market in Benin. In order to meet the needs of her customers as well as to increase her sales and her income, Adelaïde Ayaba, along with the other member of MAHUKPEGO, is applying for this first loan from ALIDÉ.

loans.use: to buy cereal and shoes.

loans.name: Wesley

texts.en:
Wesley has been  a farmer in Litein for 9 solid years within his home area. He produces milk  and runs a retail shop besides farming. He is aged 35 and married with two children aged 3 and 2 years.

Wesley has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a chuff-cutter for his dairy farming business. He says it will boost his feeding and reduce wastage of costly feeds. He is glad about the business. He is glad that  Juhudi Kilimo is making loans to smallholder farmers and helping them do farming in a more commercial way.

Wesley says animal diseases and poor weather are his major challenges.

loans.use: To buy a chuff-cutter (to cut fodder).

loans.name: Missimide Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MISSIMIDE est composé de trois personnes qui  résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe,nommée Awawou(celle dont la main est levée sur la photo)est âgée de 38 ans. Awawou est mariée à un certain Aziz. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et un à leur charge. Awawou vit seule avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Awawou vend des chaussures, des tout cousus et des produits cosmétiques dans sa région depuis dix ans. Awawou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et au Togo. Dans le souci de renforcer davantage son pouvoir d'achat et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Awawou ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MISSIMIDE sollicite pour la troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Missimide Group is made up of three women who reside in the same neighbourhood. The group representative, Awawou (the woman with her hand raised in the photo), is 38 years old. Awawou is married to a man named Aziz. The couple has two children, both of whom are receiving an education, as well as having another child in their care. Awawou lives with her husband and their children. Together, the couple meet the costs for their household expenses. In order to meet these expenses, Awawou sells hand-stitched shoes as well as cosmetic products. She has done this in her local region for the last 10 years. Awawou gets her supplies from the markets in Benin and Togo. In order to further strengthen their buying power and better satisfy client demand, Awawou and the other members of the Missimide Group are requesting their third loan from Alidé. Their previous loans have been paid back in full.

loans.use: to buy hand-stitched shoes and cosmetic products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Lillian wants to buy hair chemicals and manicure sets

loans.name: Metanet

texts.en: Metanet is an IDP from occupied Agdam district of Azerbaijan. She fled to Baku in 1993. She is married and has two children. She started her business in 1995, and borrowed two Normicro loans from Baku branch totaling $1400. Now she would like to borrow $500.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra sells roasted chicken. She is 21 years old and has two children. Her husband helps her tend the business. Their home and business are both in Alto Chijini in La Paz. They prepare the take-out food daily. This is the first loan she has taken out and it will go to paying for bulk groceries, sauces and vegetables, saving money. She previously tended a similar stand as an employee before setting up shop on her own. She has access to this credit on the strength of her work experience and her receipts, which show she will be able to repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

Alejandra vende pollo al broaster. Tiene 21 años y dos hijos, su esposo le ayuda en la atención de su negocio. Su negocio y domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Alto Chijini de la ciudad de La Paz. Sus ventas son diarias por se trata de comida al paso y la preparación la realiza diariamente. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra abarrotes, salsas, y verdura en cantidad para reducir sus costos. Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia porque atendía un negocio similar anteriormente como empleada y hace un año que instaló su propio negocio. Sus ingresos demuestran que tiene las posibilidades para poder cubrir la cancelación del crédito sin dificultades.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en: "LAPO has rained on me," says Mrs. Philomina E., who is happily married with a child and lives in an urban area of Edo State. She sells provisions in her shop and hopes to expand her shop and her business as well. In her store, she has goods worth N250,000 (Naira). She needs additional funds to increase her business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en: Latifa is 58 years old, married, and has 2 children . She is lives in the Khachmaz region, in Muktadir village. Five years ago she started this business. In the picture, you can see the oven where she bakes the bread. This oven is called "kherek" in Lezghin. She bakes Lezghin bread and sells it to support her family. Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy flour, firewood and other necessary things for baking bread.

loans.use: To buy flour, firewood and necessary things for baking bread

loans.name: Marie Antoinette

texts.en:
Marie, 42 years old, is married and mother of eleven children. Nine years ago, she gave birth to triplets. Marie has been living in the Dominican Republic for more than ten years. Like many Haitian women, she thinks that living in this country, she’ll have more chance to earn a living and support her large family.

Since her arrival in Santo Domingo, Marie started a very small business which has grown a lot. She sells women’s clothes, shoes, perfumes, deodorants and hand and body lotion. She buys the goods in Dajabon, a frontier province with Haiti where products can be obtained at very low prices. Till now, Marie has been selling her products at a public square. She wants to rent a small locale in the public market so that she can attract more clients and sell her products easily. With the loan she has requested, she will also buy more goods in order to continue satisfying the customers’ needs. Given the loan, the entrepreneur will increase her income and help her very large and needy family.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of clothes, shoes, perfumes and deodorants for her business

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en: Mrs. Chhin N. E., 25, is a mother of two young children and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She works selling grocery products to the people in her area, earning on average about $7/day. Her husband works as a mechanic and generally earns about $8/day. Mrs. Chhin N. E. requests a loan of $1000 to increase her inventory in order to meet her clients’ needs.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: Olga Johana

texts.es:
Olga Johana Hernandez is a young wife, she studied up to fourth grade and has 4 children, 2 of whom are of school age. Like all women in Nicaragua she is always looking for a way to help the family cover its expenses and to be able to give her children what they need.

Because of the need to get ahead, she started selling clothing six years ago. She began selling by walking the streets, carrying a large basket. Now she has established her business in the municipal market. She tells us that the achievements she has been able to reach have been through the loans she has obtained from our institution.

This business is very profitable. Today her sales have increased, her start-up capital was her savings. Her husband is a laborer at Ingenio San Antonio.

Mrs. Hernandez has worked with CEPRODEL for the past year, and she is pleased with the loans received as they have been given to her in opportune moments, helping her to meet the needs of her business and those of her customers. She has a track record of seven loans.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Olga Johana H. es una joven casada, curso hasta el cuarto grado de primaria, tiene 4 hijos, dos de ellos se encuentran en la edad escolar. Como todas las mujeres de Nicaragua siempre están buscando una forma de ayudar a la familia para poder cubrir las necesidades del hogar y poder darles a sus hijos lo que ellos necesitan.

Producto de la necesidad de salir adelante ella comenzó a vender ropa hace seis años, comenzó a vender de manera ambulante, es decir andaba en las calles con un canasto, en la actualidad ella ya tiene establecido su negocio en el mercado municipal, ella nos expresa que los logros que ella ha llegado a alcanzar han sido a través de los créditos que ha obtenido en nuestra institución.

Este negocio es muy rentable, hoy en día sus ventas han incrementado, su capital inicial eran ahorros, cabe señalar que el marido trabaja como obrero en el Ingenio San Antonio.

La señora H. trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace un año manifiesta que se siente satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando así a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela, Ella tiene un record de siete créditos.

loans.use: Purchase goods.

loans.name: Kabojja B1(A) Group

texts.en: Margret is 48 years old and married with six children. Her husband sells cereals. Margret has a retail shop business. She wants to use the extra profits to provide a good quality education for her children. Ritah sells clothes and wants to expand business with the loan. Mariam has a beauty salon and wants to use the loan to buy a hair steamer. Agnes sells raw foods in the market while Goretti is a poultry farmer.

loans.use: To increase stock in the shop

loans.name: Shova

texts.en:
Mrs. Shova K. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishapati, Lalitpur, Nepal. She lives with her mother-in-law and with her husband. Her husband, Mr. Dinesh K., is in Saudi-Arabia. He went there to work.

Mrs. K. is a farmer. She prefers to grow seasonal vegetables in her land. Farming is their traditional work, so she doesn’t want to leave farming. She sells her vegetables in local market in the morning and in the evening.

Now Mrs. K. seeks Rs10000.00 loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her work. She wants to spend her income to improve the livings standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: O. Justina is married and has 5 children. She is 45 years old. She hails from Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells fairly used clothes and has been in business since 1997. She needs the loan of $700 to buy more used clothes for sale.

loans.use: To buy more fairly use clothes for sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 50 year old entrepreneur. She is a widow and lives with her eight children in Midhine Siaya in Kenya. She runs a small shop adjacent to her home that she started in 2006. She sells basic commodities, such as bread, rice, flour, cooking oil, sugar, eggs, milk, salt, and soap. She requires $700.00 to add more stock to her shop.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her shop

loans.name: Maqsoodan's Group

texts.en:
Maqsooda B., wife of A. G., is a mother of two children, a daughter and a son. Maqsooda B. would like to give her children a better education than she can currently afford. Her husband has a cattle business and she is requesting a loan for her husband so that he is able to buy cattle and increase the family income.

Other members of the group have other needs for the loan. Samina B. would like money to repair her van. Sharifan B. wants a loan to expand her medicine business and Hanifan B. would use the loan to expand her cloth business.

The funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase cattle, expand existing businesses and repair a vehicle

loans.name: Mujeres Victoriosas Group

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Ana A. me dedico a la fabricacion de fritas de yuca-elote con azucar, tengo varios años haciendo este trabajo, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el suentento de mi famila, en estos momentos tengo contratadas dos mujeres para la reparticion de mi producto, pero necesito tener mayor produccion ya que las ventas se han ido arriba y no me doy abasto con las necesidas de mis clientes, por lo tanto solicito su apoyo para poder comprar mas materia prima y tener una produccion mayor, con parte de las ganancias que obtenga deseo seguir ayudando a mi nieta que esta en la escuela.

loans.use: compra de yuca, manteca, sal, aceite, leña, fosforos, azucar, elotes

loans.name: Sarim

texts.en: Mrs. Sarim H., 48, is a widow and has six children, three of whom are employed in different businesses, while another one is attending school. The remaining two are still too young to study. Mrs. Sarim H. and her children live in the Sya Village, Kampong Speu Province. She is a farmer cultivating crops twice a year. During the rainy season, she cultivates rice; in the dry season, she grows vegetables. Currently, Mrs. Sarim H. is unable to plant rice, because she does not have enough cows to plow the rice field. Therefore, she has decided to ask for a loan to be able to buy another cow for this purpose.  Previously, Mrs. Sarim H. obtained a loan from AMK to buy a cow for breeding, and she fully paid it back.

loans.use: Purchase of a cow to plow a field

loans.name: Sokea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokea S. is 37 years old and has been farming rice for about eighteen years. She is married to Mr. Sokun Shav, 39, and they live in Ptas Rong Commune, Pursat Province. They have three children, all of whom are living in the family home and are in school. She can earn 8,000 Riel (US $2.00) per day.

To prepare for the coming season, she is requesting a loan of 200,000 Riel (US $50.00) to purchase fertilizer to use for the rice crop. Sokea hopes the loan will increase her income and help to pay her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her rice crop

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a 43 year old entrepreneur and mother of seven children, who are all going to school. She lives in Kisumu, Kenya and began her current business selling second-hand and new clothes in 1996. She specializes in women's clothing, like skirts and dresses, as well as bed sheets. She periodically travels to Kampala in Uganda, where she is able to purchase a good variety at wholesale prices. The prime location of her business on a busy street, her many years of experience, and her friendly interaction with customers has enabled her to establish a good client base.

With this loan of $600, Pamela plans to expand her business by buying stock of new clothes.

loans.use: To buy stock of new clothes.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es: La señora Olivia es cliente antigua, trabaja con la  institución desde el año 2004. Tiene como actividad  principal la elaboración de helados, que vende en un puesto callejero. Vive en alquiler, se pudo ver que el microcrédito le sirvió mucho para el desarrollo de su negocio. La señora no tiene créditos con otras Instituciones financieras siendo cliente exclusiva de Emprender. El Crédito que se le otorga será destinado en esta ocasión para la compra de una moderna máquina para hacer helados. Tiene una hija estudiante universitaria que le ayuda en el negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Olivia is an old client. She has been with our institution since 2004. Her main job is selling ice-cream out in the streets. She rents. All previous loans have helped her business in a big way. Señora Olivia doesn't have any other loans with other financial institutions since she has been an exclusive client of Emprender. With this loan, she's hoping on investing the money in an ice-cream maker. She has a daughter who's currently going to college and she helps her with the business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ice-cream maker machine

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 45-year-old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in southern suburbs of Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Ali is a carpenter. He has requested a loan of $500 from Al Majmoua to pay the school fees for his three children. This is the first time that he has asked for a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To pay his children's school fees

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia A. is a 30-year-old trader. She is married with three children. She has been selling used clothes in the local market of Teshie in Accra for seven years. With income from her business, Patricia is supporting two of her kids in junior high school while the last-born is still breastfeeding.

Her major business challenge over the years has to do with funds to scale up the business, especially in this crucial election period in Ghana. She has lots of marketing experience with a strong customer base as compared to her competitors and very confident that the loan would enable her to achieve remarkable business progress. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothes from the importers to serve her customers. She hopes to save enough to support her kids to complete school.
