El ya cuenta con varios años  dedicándose a esta actividad y debido a ello conoce mucho del manejo de estos cultivos.

Catalino  desea adquirir fertilizantes para poder asegurarse una buena producción de su cultivo, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo. 

Catalino es una persona bastante hogareña y estimada por las personas de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Catalino is 57 years old living in his own house.  He’s married and his home is located in the rural part of Mórrope District.

Catalino has farmland near where he lives.  He tends to plant brown beans.  Income he earns from this activity is used to support his family.  El has been in this occupation for many years now and because of this he’s very knowledgeable about these crops.

Catalino wants to acquire fertilizer to insure a good crop yield so he’s thought it advisable to request a 2000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to help him reach his goal.

Catalino is a man who is quite attached to his home and highly esteemed by people in his community.

loans.use: to acquire fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es:
La señora maricela  vive es de un lugar conocido como san miguel, de copaínala estado de Chiapas México. Ella es cada  con el señor Alfonso  y con quien procreo una hija de nombre Sandi anay de cuatro años de edad.

   Ella se dedica  a la compra de  y venta de trastes como son: ollas, platos, bajillas, vasos, entre otros, en esta actividad aun esta iniciando  y lleva cuatro meses ya que la actividad anterior no le dio un buen resultado por la competencia que hay.

  Lo que lo  motivo ha esta  nueva actividad fue su vecina quien es la que se encarga de comprar la mercancía y también se las da a ella para  que la apoye a venderlo  y las ganancias que baya obteniendo lo sirva ella para tener sus  propios ingresos.

     Lo que más desea es que con el préstamo que a solicitado pueda mejorar su compra de mercancía para que con ello mejor sea sus ganancias que baya obteniendo y así sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maricela is from an area known as San Miguel, in Copaínala in the state of Chiapas, Mexico. She is married to Alfonso with whom she has a daughter by the name of Sandi Anay who is four years old.   

She devotes herself to buying and selling dishware such as pots, plates,and bowls, dinner sets, cups and other items. She is just starting up this business and has been doing it for four months, since her previous business did not yield good profits on account of the competition. 

She was motivated to start this business because of her neighbor who is responsible for purchasing the merchandise, and who also gives them to her so she may help her sell it and have her own income from the profits she is making. 

What she most wishes for is that with the loan she has requested, she would improve her buying of merchandise in order to improve her earnings and thus get her children ahead.

loans.use: to purchase plastic dishware.

loans.name: Erica Jharly

texts.es:
Erica Jharly tiene 18 años, Es soltera vive con los padres y con un hijo de 2 años, ella es madre soltera, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL DIVINO NIÑO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Estero Lindo, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembre de maíz y arroz.

Erica Jharly se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial AGRIPAC y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de semillas y abonos de maiz y arroz.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas en los cultivos y la falta de dinero para pagar a mas trabajadores. Su sueño es tener una vida economicamente estable.

Le gusta bailar en la fiestas del recinto.
texts.en:
Erica Jharly is 18 years old.  She is single and lives with her parents in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  She is a single mother and has a 2 year-old son.

The "EL DIVINO NIÑO' community bank is located in Estero Lindo, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Ericais a farmer who grows corn and rice.  She buys her products in Comercial AGRIPAC and makes her sales in the wholesale market in Ventanas.

Erica is requesting this loan to grow corn and rice.  She will buy seeds and manure for her corn and rice crops.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as pests on her crops and a lack of money with which to pay more workers.  Her dream is to enjoy a more financially stable life.

Erica enjoys dancing at local fiestas.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure for her corn and rice crops

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 35 years old and single. She sells meat. Her business is well organized. The hours of her business are from 7 am to 9 pm every day. She has two years experience in this business and she currently employs one person to help her. 

Beatrice has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase large quantities of meat for resale to the restaurants. With her profit, she will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of meat to sell

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
BilA. is a 31-year-old single man, who loves life, as he describes himself, that's why he insisted on working with beauty all around him. He translated his dreams through opening a flower shop six years ago to keep himself in a colorful place, filled with peace all around him and clean atmosphere.

BilA. is a hard-working man, who improves his business as much as he can, from time to time, to open a wider shop in the future. He hopes to make his dream come true through planting and harvesting his own flowers from his own nursery.

BilA. has been A. Majmoua borrower for two cycles, and he's requesting a loan from this Kiva partner, in order to prepare himself for the Holy Ramadan celebrations, where most people decorate their homes with flowers and enjoy their scent. They also visit cemeteries to check on lost beloved ones and decorate their tombs with the colorful flowers he sells.

BilA. is a man with a good reputation. Most of his friends enjoy dealing with him and are proud of his friendship.

BilA. also wants to do necessary construction on his own house which he is building to be ready when he can think of getting married in the future.

loans.use: To increase his capital for flowers for the Holy Ramadan celebration.

loans.name: Dalmith

texts.es:
La Sra. Dalmith pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Victoria II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 28 años y dos  hijas de 4 años y ocho meses de edad.
Se caracteriza por su entusiasmo y alegría, siempre con las ganas de salir adelante, esto le valió para iniciar su propio negocio con una inicial de S/. 300.00  Nuevos soles.  Se dedica a la venta de comidas  en un puesto del mercado cerca a su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja quien la traslada en su motocarro. Poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes que son vecinos, familiares y transeúntes, por  su amabilidad y el buen trato que les brinda a sus clientes.Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000.00 nuevos soles, comprará insumos para sus preparados como: sacos de arroz y azúcar, carnes, pescados, plátanos en racimos, fideos, aceites en docenas, verduras y frutas regionales, asimismo implementar su mobiliario como mesas y sillas plásticas.
Dalmith es una mujer luchadora,  su sueño es contar con un Restaurant con comidas típicas de la Selva del Perú.  Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de poder hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Dalmith belongs to the Mujeres de Victoria II Communal Bank in the Tarapoto District of the province and department of San Martín.  She is 28 years old and lives with her partner and two daughters, one who is four and the other eight months old.

She is known for her enthusiasm and cheerfulness.  She has always had the drive to get ahead, which enabled her to start her own business with a down payment of 300 nuevos soles.  She sells food in a stall at the market near her house, and she has the support of her partner, who drives her around in his three-wheeled delivery van.  Little by little, her friendliness and good customer service have brought her very close to her customers, who are made up of neighbors, family members, and passers-by.  With this loan of 2,000 nuevos soles, she will buy ingredients for her prepared meals, such as bags of rice and sugar, fish, bunches of bananas, noodles, dozens of oils, and local fruits and vegetables.  She will also install furniture, such as plastic tables and chairs.

Dalmith is a fighter; her dream is to have a restaurant that serves dishes typical of the Peruvian jungle.  She is very appreciative of the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women like herself get the opportunity to make their dreams a reality.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as bags of rice and sugar, meats, fish, bunches of bananas, etc.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Mirian es socia del Banco Comunal Totorilla, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, ella tiene una Marisquería de dia y Chifa por la noche, tambien tiene un recreo, es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 3 años, recuerda que con su primer préstamo se compró una cocina, ella empezó su negocio, con una mesita y 4 sillas en un ambiente que le dio su papá, de ésta manera empezó su negocio agradece mucho por todo el apoyo que le brindaron, ya que gracias a Finca y la responsabilidad que le enseñaron, ahora ella tiene todo lo que se propuso, siente que ha progresado, las capacitaciones y el ahorro le ayudan a poder administrar mejor su negocio. La meta que tiene es poder comprar otro terreno y hacer bautizar a sus hijos.
texts.en: Mirian is a member of the Totorilla Communal Bank. She is 35 and has 3 children. She runs a seafood restaurant by day and a Chinese restaurant by night. She also has a tourist shop. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for three years. She remembers that with her first loan she bought a kitchen and started her business with a small table and four chairs in a location that her father gave her. She is very grateful for all the support that has been provided for her; thanks to Finca and the responsibility that they taught her, she now has all that she set out to have. She feels that she has progressed. The training and the savings help her to run her business better. Her goal is to be able to buy another plot of land and to baptize her children.

loans.use: to stock her food business.

loans.name: Sitoma Group

texts.en:
Thomas is the facilitator of the Sitoma group. Thomas and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Thomas and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Thomas takes care of five children at home with his wife. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Thomas had a very good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Thomas was only able to harvest three bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Thomas will educate his children and save for future use.

In 2012, the members of Sitoma group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photo above, Thomas and his group are holding maize cobs from the recent harvest!

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is divorced with three children, all of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

She sells bananas at the market on retail basis. She works six days a week. She has been in business for the last one year. She has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more green bananas. 

Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children to the university level. She lives in her house, and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To  buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”IMASUMAC II”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Sonia; La socia tiene 28 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 1 hijo de 13 meses de edad; la socia es comerciante minorista, la socia tiene su stand en uno de los centros comerciales de la ciudad, la socia se dedica  a la compra y venta de ropa, la socia viaja a las diferentes ciudades a comprar de las fabricas ropa de bebes y los trae a vender en su stand. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ropa para bebe.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "IMASUMAC II", which is located in the district of Huanchac in the province and deparment of Cusco.

The member is Ms. Sonia who is 28, married and has a 13-month-old son.  She is a retail merchant and has a stand in the city shopping center where she sells clothing.  She travels to different cities to buy baby clothes that she sells at her stand.  She is requesting a loan to buy infant clothing.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy baby clothes.

loans.name: Ankhbayar

texts.en: Ankhbayar is 30 years old and runs a grocery store near her home. She lives with her son and husband in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been running her store since 2008, and there are no other grocery stores near hers. Therefore, she plans to expand it and offer her permanent customers more products. She uses a minivan to bring supplies to her store, but now she needs to exchange it for a bigger van so that she can carry more supplies. The loan Ankhbayar is taking out will be used to make payments on her new minivan so that she can bring more supplies to her grocery store.

loans.use: to make payments on her new minivan, which she will use to bring supplies to her grocery store.

loans.name: Mirian Del Socorro

texts.es: Mirian Del Socorro de 56 años. Su negocio es una pulpería, lo inicio aproximadamente hace 7 años. Su negocio está ubicado en su vivienda, la mayoría de sus clientes se encuentran satisfechos con el servicio que ella ofrece. Su horario inicia a las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, de lunes a viernes. Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, pan, jabón, fósforos y sopas. Su sueño es poder crecer poco a poco con su local.
texts.en:
Mirian Del Socorro is 56 years old. 

She has a grocery store which she opened about 7 years ago. Her business is located in her home. Most of her customers are satisfied with the service that she offers. She starts at 7:00AM in the morning working until 9:00PM in the evening from Monday through Friday.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy basic grains, candy, drinks, bread, soap, matches and soups. Her dream is to be able to grow her home business little by little.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, candy, drinks, bread, soap, matches and soups

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a married woman and has eight children. She is 60 years old and resides at Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. 

She owns and operates a farm, planting & harvesting rice to sell to earn a living, and she's been 10 years in this business. Each month, she earns about 10,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Rosita wants to make improvements to her house and to finish the studies of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Bayambadorj

texts.en: Bayambadorj is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His wife works at a water supply company. Byambadorj operates transportation service business using his own truck. He started his business in 2000. He transports firewood and coal between provinces and Ulaanbaatar. Byambadorj's transportation service business income is pretty much the same since he started the business. With his business profits he is buying construction materials to build his own house. He is requesting 2,600,000 MNT to buy more wood and coal to deliver and to increase his income with coming new year.

loans.use: To buy more wood and coal

loans.name: Fazil

texts.ru: Etot molodoy chelovek jenat i imeyet odnogo rebonka. Fazil rodilsya v 1981 qodu. On jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Fazil uje 4 qoda kak delayet derevanniye okna i dveri. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye noveyshiye instrumenti dlya uludsheniya i razvitiya yego raboti. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego dyadi kotoriy toje zanimayetsya etim biznessom.
texts.en: This young man is married and has one child. Fazil was born in 1981. He lives in the Baku region with his family. Fazil has been making wooden windows and doors for four years. Currently he requires 2000 AZN in order to purchase the necessary tools to improve and develop his trade. He learned this business from his uncle, who also does this for a living.

loans.use: Purchase tools

loans.name: Aida Yanina

texts.es:
La Señora Aída es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Triunfadoras, vive en un hermoso lugar de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera de mayor importancia del país, por su actividad económica, tiene una gran riqueza cultural, gastronómica, su gente es amable y mantiene las tradiciones de sus padres.

Doña Aída tiene 31 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 14, 12 y 2 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión pintor, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad. 

La Señora. Aída se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de varias marcas, esta actividad la realiza hace 8 años y hace apenas 6 meses también labora como cocinera en un negocio de su mamá.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su hermana. Su primer crédito lo va a invertir para iniciar en la venta de chuzos (carne en palito) y comida rápida va a comprar carne, papas, salchichas y otros víveres.

Su meta es terminar su casa y comprarse un vehículo.
texts.en:
Aída is a member of the “Mujeres Triunfadoras” (Successful Women) communal bank.  She lives in a beautiful place in the city of Cuenca.  This city is the country’s third most important because of its economic activity.  It has great cultural and gastronomic riches.  Its people are kind and maintain their parents’ traditions.

Aída is 31 years old, married and has three children who are 14, 12 and 2 years old.  Her first two children attend a school in the city.  Her husband is a painter by profession and the house they live in is theirs.

Aída sells cosmetics of various brands; she’s been in business 8 years and just six months ago started working as a cook in a business of her mother’s.

This is the first loan she’s taken with the communal bank which she was invited to join by her sister.  She will use her first loan to start selling ‘chuzos’ (skewered meat) and fast food.  She will buy meat, potatoes, sausages and other foodstuffs.  Her goal is to finish building her house and to buy a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy meat, potatoes, sausages and other foodstuffs.

loans.name: Mujeres Al Poder Group

texts.es:
19 mujeres de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo se han unido con la esperanza de poder formar parte del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. Luego de interiorizarse decidieron formar su grupo, del cual surge el comité llamado Mujeres al Poder, donde todas las miembros trabajan dentro de un ambiente de cooperacion, respeto y mutua ayuda.
Una de las miembros es la señora María Fatima, quien se dedica a la venta de carbón, comenta que tiene muy buena venta, ya que el carbón últimamente se está usando mucho y es por ello que sus ventas van creciendo lo que a la vez le da muy buenos ingresos. Ella dice que trabaja mucho, pero que no le importa ya que todo el esfuerzo que hace es por darle a su familia todo lo que necesitan para una vida digna y decorosa.
Ella solicita el préstamo para abastecerse con carbón, ya que no quiere quedar desabastecida, pues en este tiempo hay mucha demanda.
texts.en:
Nineteen women from the city of Coronel Oveido have gathered in hopes of joining the Program of Women Entrepreneurs through Fundación Paraguaya. After the internal decision was made to form a group, the members decided to call themselves “Mujeres al Poder” (Women of Power). All of the members work together in a spirit of cooperation, respect, and mutual assistance.

One of the members is Sra. María Fatima, who sells charcoal. She says that she has very good business since there has been great demand as of late. For this reason, her sales have been increasing and resulting in very good income. She says that she works hard, but it is important that all of her efforts focus on providing her family everything they need to have a decent and dignified life.

María Fatima is requesting a loan to restock her inventory of charcoal because she does not want to run out of her product during this time when there is great demand.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 36 years old, married to Josephine, and they have three children. He is a small-scale farmer in his locality and has been in operation for the last two years, earning a monthly income of Kes 8,000. 

He is taking out his first loan of Kes 30,000 from KADET LTD. He plans  to use the loan  to purchase farm inputs, i.e fertilizers and seeds.  With the anticipated profits he will educate his children and improve the farm.

His hopes and dreams are to improve his farming operations as well as the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs (fertilizers and seeds).

loans.name: Mirna Nobella

texts.en:
My name is Mirna M. and my business is to manufacture bed linens. I have been in business for 3 years, and my clients favor the quality of my product. My business generates income to support my family. My goal is to increase my inventory and production capacity. I'd like to to remodel my home and support my family.

Mi nombre es Mirna M. me dedico a la fabricacion y venta de ropa para camas, tengo mi negocio hace 3 años, mis clientes son buenos ya que les gusta la calidad de mi producto, mi negocio me genera ingresos para mantener a mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor produccion y con los ingresos que obtenga poder remodelar mi hogar y mantener a mi familia.

loans.use: Compra de telas, hilo, tijeras, esponja

loans.name: Eldaniz

texts.en: Eladaniz S. lives in Aghsu city where he owns a small tire shop. He has been selling and repairing tires for the past eight years. Eldaniz is married with two children. With this loan he wants to purchase more tires and other items for his shop.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
Mrs Sreng C., 37 years old , is a widow living with 9 children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is struggling to feed all her children by selling fruits at the nearby market. Usually, she earns an average of $4 a day. Three of her children work at the local garment factory and contribute their salary to the household. Two others are ordained and stay with the monks at the pagoda near this village, and they are students as well.

C. hopes to use the loan to purchase a variety of fruits to run her business, and to fix her current house. In the future, she thinks about being able to expand her business and build a suitable concrete house for her family. One more hope, if she saves enough money, is to send her children to the local university.

loans.use: To buy more fruits to run her business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: "I like the timber business because it fetches me money and I hope to expand the business if I have additional funds," says Mrs. Janet I.. She hails from Edo State in Nigeria.

loans.use: To buy more timber woods for sales

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en:
Mr. Tahir is a vulnerable low-income person. He is 50, married with five children, and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Tahir sells beef in Saatli town, while his son grazes cattle. The income from the four cows they have is too low to support the family. That’s why Tahir applied to Norwegian Microcredit Saatli branch for $500 loan to buy one more cow to make his monthly income higher. In the Caucasus region the price of good cow is about 300-400 USD.

loans.use: To increase the number of animals

loans.name: Klara

texts.en: Klara runs a cosmetics sales business from a little space at the Univermag store in Vinogradov, Ukraine. In business for about five years, she sells about $1800 worth of products and makes around $250-$300 per month. She has been able to secure a very good location for her business and tries to maintain a broad assortment of quality cosmetic and personal care items to sell. She has requested a loan of $500 to increase her working capital and allow her to purchase additional inventory.

loans.use: Klara would like to increase the inventory for her cosmetics business.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.pt:
Location: Neighborhood 6 -- Boane/Maputo

Client: Rosalina M.

Activity: Residence

Loan Value: 15000 meticais ($635USd)

Application: Purchase of construction materials

Beginning: Nov 28, 2007

End: March 22, 2009

Rosalina M., 46 years old, is from Xai-Xai in Gaza Province. She is an orphan and has three sisters who are still living. She started school at Maciene Elementary School. In 1978, she went on to the Chokwe Agricultural School to major in agriculture, through 1980.

In 1981 she went to the Accelerated Learning Center in Boane, living in the school home at 20 years of age. After the course, she went to work in Tete province as a middle-school teacher for six years. During her stay in Tete, she married and had two girls, one now grown. Her third child was born in Maputo, in Boane district.

In 1990, she returned to the Institute in Boane and simultaneously transferred to an elementary school. After finishing, in 1993, she went to work in the Agricultural Institute of Boane as a teacher, living in the Institute home.

When land was being subdivided in Boane, she approached the District Administration to request a lot for construction, having had the construction of her house authorized.

After some time off from studies due to her youngest child, in 2004 she decided to go back to school. She applied to the School of Social Science. She studies and continues to work.

She heard of Hluvuku Adsema through conversations with her co-workers and friends in other schools in the district. She decided to submit her first proposal for the value of 15000 meticais to buy construction materials.

Her greatest dream is to see her house built and her children complete higher education.

Translated from Portuguese by Ilse Ackerman, Kiva volunteer

Localização Bairro 6- Boane/ Maputo

Cliente: Rosarolina M.

Actividade: Habitação

Valor De Empréstimo: 15.000,00Mt(556.00USS)

Aplicação: Compra de Materiais de construção

Inicio: 28-11-07

Fim: 22-03-09

Rosalina M., de 46 anos de idade, natural de xai-xai província de Gaza, órfão, tem 3 irmãs ainda vivas. Começa a estudar na escola primaria de Maciene até a conclusão do nível primário do primeiro grau(Ep1) e Ep2 antigamente chamado primeiro ciclo preparatório- assim dito pela cliente. Em 1978 passa para Escola básica agrária de chokwe para se formar na área de agricultura até o ano de 1980.

Em 1981 segue para o centro de formação acelerado em Boane vivendo no lar da escola com os seus 20 anos de idade. Depois do curso, vai trabalhar na província de Tete como professora de nivel medio durante 6 anos. Na sua estadia em Tete casa-se e deste resultam duas meninas, uma já maior de idade. O seu terceiro filho veio a ter ja em Maputo no distrito de Boane.

Em 1980 volta pra instituto de formação em Boane e em simultâneo a sua transferência para Boane para uma Escola primaria. Depois da formcão, em 1993 vai trabalhar no instituto agrário de Boane como professora até o ano em curso. Vive na casa do Instituto.

Durante o período do parcelamento, em Boane, ela aproximou-se a Administracão do Distrito para requere um talhão para construir a sua obra tendo sido autorizada a construção da sua casa.

Durante algum tempo parada nos estudos por causa do seu filho menor, em 2004 decide voltar a estudar. Concoreu para Faculdade de cienciais sociais. Estuda e continua a trabalhar.

Conhece a HLUVUKU ADSEMA apartir de conversas com seus colegas, nossos clientes, e suas amigas das outras Escolas do distrito. Decide remeter seu primeiro pedido no valor de 15.000,00MT para compra de materiais de construção que foi aprovado na sua totalidade.

Tem como seu maior sonho ver, sua casa concluída e a sua filha a concluir o seus filhos com nível superior.

loans.use: To buy material to build a house

loans.name: Casilda

texts.es:
Casilda is a woman who works untiringly for the well-being of her family. Her husband also toils firmly in agricultural activities. She comes from an agricultural family for generations and has been immersed in this type of work. At this time agricultural activities are her only source of income and have allowed her to support her beloved children.

She plans to increase the nutritional value of her cow food, acquire greater amount of compost and fertilizers for her field and to invest in the implementation of a small grocery store, which will generate additional income. Let’s make possible her request so this family can progress.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Villegas, Kiva volunteer.

Casilda, es una mujer que día a día trabaja incansablemente con el propósito D. procurarles bienestar a su familia, su esposo también labora firmemente en las actividades D. siembra y cosecha D. sus campos D. cultivo y aunque muchas veces Casilda ha estado en situaciones D. pérdida por el bajo precio D. sus productos, sigue esforzándose porque quiere trabajar.Ella se considera una agricultora desD. su nacimiento debido a que proviene D. una familia se ha dedicado a estas labores y como siempre ha estado inmersa en este campo D. trabajo hoy por hoy las actividades agrícolas son su única fuente D. sobrevivencia ya que con esta actividad por años ha podido ofrecerles lo mejor a sus queridos hijos. Tiene planes D. incrementar el valor nutricional D. los alimentos que ofrece a sus queridas vaquitas, adquirir mayor cantidad D. abonos y fertilizantes para sus campos D. cultivo e invertir en la implementación D. una pequeña bodega para que ésta pueda otorgar ingresos adicionales a su hogar que le permitan incrementar su nivel D. vida familiar.Posibilitemos su petición para que esta familia pueda progresar.

loans.use: Purchase of food for her cows, compost and fertilizer for her field for growing crops and the implementation of a small grocery store, which will be in partnership with her daughter.

loans.name: Vagif

texts.en:
53-year-old Vagif lives with his family including three children in Saatli town of Azerbaijan, which is situated in Caucasus region. Vagif is the only breadwinner for his family. His family’s living conditions are not good enough because the family income is rather limited.

Vagif began his business 15 years ago. Because he did not have sufficient financial resources, he couldn’t develop his business well enough in the beginning. With this small business and only $200 in working capital, he could hardly earn enough money to meet his family's food and important consumption needs, but after awhile he made important steps in his business and increased the area of his trading.

Now, he wants to borrow $500 in order to further develop his business, and therefore to improve his family’s living conditions and obtain some funds for the education of his children.

loans.use: To expand volume of business

loans.name: María

texts.en:
María sells fried vegetables and ripe fruits in the Batey of Palavé community of San Cristobal. She has a lot of experience, since she has been carrying on different kinds of businesses for a long time. María is thirty-six years old, and she has three children, two girls and a boy. They all attend school.

The entrepreneur explains that she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables to increase her sales volume and her income. María’s business supports her children’s educations. The entrepreneur says she’ll keep working hard to provide a comfortable lifestyle for her family.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fruits in order to expand a small business.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia O. is 38 years old; she is married with four children and lives in Benin City with her family. She is a fashion designer. She studied the profession for two years and started her own business in 2000. She is requesting a loan of $450 to buy more tailoring materials for her business. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru:
Alisher S. lives in Yavan. He is 21 years old and is not married. He lives with his parents. The family is large and everybody has to work to help provide for the family. Alisher is involved in animal husbandry. He has a small business: he is raising cattle. Alisher wants to obtain a loan to increase his turnover. This additional financing will help him increase his profits. He will be able to repay his loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers

Сатторов Алишер житель города Яван. Возраст 21 год , не женат. Живет с родителями. Семья большая и всем приходится много раболтать , чтобы прокормить семью. Занимается животноводством. Имеет небольшое хозяйство , где разводит мелко-рогатый скот и бычков. Хочет получить кредит, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Дополнительное финансирование путем получения кредита поможет ему увеличить доход. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Choeun

texts.en:
Choeun S. is 45 years old and lives in Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. She sells chickens in the meat section of her local market. She has been developing her store for some time now, and has had her business since 1998. Her husband also deals in animal sales; he sells cows that he purchases throughout the area. Together, they earn approximately $6 USD per day.

The couple has six children, all of whom attend school. A few will graduate soon and begin looking for work. Choeun recognizes the potential earning power of her two businesses and wants to invest by buying young cows and chickens to boost sales.

loans.use: To buy cows and chickens.

loans.name: Association Lonlon Agoe Group

texts.fr:
The LONLON Agoè Association ("L’ Association LONLON Agoè") was founded in July 2006 in the Agoè district of Lomé. The members who make up this group are involved in small businesses. Three women from this association had the vision to help each other and find ways to profit each of their businesses. They are all married and have families. They are talented in their work, having had more than 7 years of experience running small businesses. This is the LONLON Agoè Association's second loan. The group requests a loan to buy 3 sacks of rice, 1 bag of chili peppers, and 6 sacks of mustard.

Translated from French by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

L’ Association LONLON Agoè est créée en juillet 2006 dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Les activités des membres de cette association sont les petits commerces. Les trois femmes de cette association ont pour objectif l’entraide mutuelle et la recherche du profit sur leurs activités. Elles sont mariées et mères de famille. Elles sont douées dans l’exercice de leur activité car ayant des expériences de plus de 7 ans dans le petit commerce. L’association LONLON Agoè est à son 2ème cycle de près et sollicite ce crédit pour acheter 3 sacs de riz, 1 sac de piments et 6 paniers de moutarde.

loans.use: to buy basic goods

loans.name: Nasibakhon

texts.en:
Nasibakhon H. is 32 years old, married and the loving mother of four children. For the last eight years, she has made a living selling children's and women's clothing from a stand located in an especially busy part of town.

She started out with only a few products, but her business has grown thanks in part to help from her husband, who acquires goods for her to sell from a neighboring town. Today, Nasibakhom is able to make a large contribution to the family budget. To continue to do that, she has applied for a loan of $750 to expand the range of items she has to sell. She plans to repay the loan in nine months, promises to make payments on time and thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: To buy additional clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Tatu's Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Tatu is 39 years old. She is married with 1 child aged 20. She has been a charcoal and juice seller since February 2008. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Tatu is now requesting a loan to buy more charcoal and juice for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with coconut sales, soap and spices sales, tailoring, and charcoal and firewood sales.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and juice for her business

loans.name: Waisdin

texts.en:
Waisdin is married and lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan.  He has a retail shop with two other workers, where he has worked for more than 8 years. Before opening this retail shop he was in Iran with his family, where he worked in a shop.  When he came to Kabul he opened his own retail shop.

Now he wants to take out an individual loan to complete his retail stock and further his business.  He wants to succeed and become strong in his business to support his family.  He is happy with this loan process. He would like to thank those who help poor people in his country, and he would like to continue this partnership.

loans.use: To complete his retail stock

loans.name: Esperance Group

texts.fr: Pour valoriser les ressources notamment halieutiques dans la communauté rurale de Palmarin (http://www.sem-fund.org/palmarinfr.php),  les femmes se sont constituées en groupement pour s’aider et accroitre leur capacité d’acquérir les produits halieutiques auprès des pêcheurs. Avec le prêt de Kiva, elles vont acheter du poisson frais qu’elles vont transformer en bien les séchant. Par manque de moyens de conservations du poisson, les femmes s’adonnent à la transformation des produits halieutiques surtout avec le poisson séché qu’elles vont vendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires et dans les grandes villes comme Dakar.
texts.en:
To enhance resources, notably fish, in the rual community of Palmarin (http://www.sem-fund.org/palmarinfr.php), the women formed a group to assist one another and to grow their capacity to acquire fish products from fishermen. With a Kiva loan, they are going to buy fresh fish that they will transform by drying. Lacking ways to preserve fish, the women dedicate themselves to transforming seafood, especially dried fish, which they will sell in the weekly markets and in big cities, such as Dakar.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To transform fish products

loans.name: Chheuk

texts.en: Chheuk P., 30, works raising pigs together with her husband on a plot of land near her house and earns around US$4 each day. This couple has two young children and resides with an old mother in Battambong province, Cambodia. Chuueuk P. would like to take out a loan of US$600 to increase her livestock and purchase feed for pigs as well.

loans.use: Raise pigs.

loans.name: Honorine

texts.fr: Née vers 1978 à  HÊTIN DOGODO  dans la commune de DANGBO, dame      K. Honorine est mariée et mère de 3enfants dont 2 scolarisés. Elle cultive dans le village de  HÊTIN SOTA  de la vallée de l’Ouémé et est membre du groupement   GF DJIDJOHO DE HÊTIN SOTA  situé à proximité de la source thermale de dangbo ; elle vend aussi du poisson. Les habitants de ce village font les travaux champêtres à la décrue du fleuve ouémé. Leurs terres sont riches et les offrent un bon rendement.  Leurs spéculations principales sont la culture du maïs, du piment, des légumes, du gombo, de la tomate et du manioc qui sont des aliments de grande consommation au Bénin. Le problème de ces habitants riverains du fleuve est que, en période de crue, ils n’ont plus d’activité et dépensent tout le revenu issu de la campagne écoulée à la consommation. A la décrue ils n’ont plus d’argent pour payer la main d’œuvre indispensable pour emblaver la superficie à eux disponible.  La pratique dans le milieu qui consiste au bradage des récoltes ne les sécurise pas et les runes d’avantage. Cette pratique est la vente à un prix dérisoire de la récolte future à un nanti pour disposer de la somme nécessaire aux travaux champêtres. Fatigués de cette pratique elle a sollicité un prêt de 110 000 FCFA pour l’exploitation d’environ 1,5hectares des spéculations susse indiquées.
texts.en:
Born around 1978 in Hetin Dogodo in the township of Dangbo, Mrs. Honorine K. is married and the mother of 3 children, of whom two are enrolled in school. She is a farmer in the village of Hetin Sota in the valley of the Ouémé River and is a member of the group GF Djidjoho of Hetin Sota, located near the hot springs of Dangbo. She also sells fish.

The inhabitants of this village work as farmers when the river level is low. Their land is rich and gives them a good harvest. Their principal crops are maize (corn), hot peppers, vegetables, okra, tomatoes, and manioc which are staple foods in Benin. The problem for these people who dwell along the river is that when the river is in flood, they have no more work and spend all the money they earned during the last farming season on foodstuffs. When the waters recede, they have no money left to pay for laborers who are indispensible to them in sowing their land.

The custom of borrowing against the new harvest does not make them more secure and indeed leaves them worse off. They sell their future harvest at a laughable price to weathier persons so that they have the cash needed to do their farming. Weary of this practice, Honorine K. has requested a loan of 110,000 F CFA which will allow her to farm about1.5 hectares, growing some of the aforementioned crops.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cultivating 1.5 hectares in corn (maize) and hot peppers

loans.name: Fagaitaua

texts.en: Fagaitaua F., 41, is married with 6 children. She has 1 year of experience in an elei printing business. She sells to the general public 5 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (~250 USD). SPBD loans are Fagaitaua’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy fabric paints, cotton materials, painting equipments and printing boards for her elei business.

loans.use: To purchase printing boards, fabric paints, fabrics, painting brush and roller.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: El señor Juan Antonio labora para una maquiladora de ladrillo, su esposa y el atienden su negocio propio de abarrotes, se dividen el tiempo para atender  la tiendita , ellos están solicitando este crédito para  invertir en mercancía y asi atraer a mas clientela.
texts.en:
Juan Antonio works for a brick manufacturer. He and his wife also run their own grocery store, and each takes turns staffing the small shop. They are seeking a loan to buy merchandise for their store in order to attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in his business

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama Mané, 40 ans est mariée avec 04 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Tenghory Transgambienne depuis 2 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des crèmes de beauté et des ensembles  d’habits. Elle veut un prêt pour renforcer son commerce. Ses revenus  vont lui permettent d’améliorer ses conditions de vie et  de santé de sa famille.  Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Mariama Mané is 40 years old, married, and has four children in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group Tenghory Transgambienne for 2 years. Her business consists of buying and re-selling beauty creams and outfits. She is asking for this loan to strengthen her business. Her income will allow her to improve her living conditions and her family's health. She is seeking a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and re-sell beauty creams and clothing

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama N. is fifty years old. She is widowed and has given birth to seven children, two boys and five girls. She lost her husband three years ago. She says all her children are out of school and are working. She lives with some of her children in a family house in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the inhabitants, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are into trading activities and palm oil production.

Ama is into palm oil production and farms as well. She says she procures palm fruits from the local farmers and nearby farms and adds them to what she harvests from her own farm. She distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. Ama wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute to the increasing number of her customers. She has been in business for five years and is hopeful to improve her living standard.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luís  vive, en la calle Los Olivos, junto a su esposa y sus hijos que aun se encuentran en edad escolar, en su casita propia que a base de esfuerzo y ahorros lograron adquirir en una zona periférica de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
 El trabaja como empleado publico en una institución del Estado, su esposa Maria cuenta con dos trabajos de medio tiempo como telefonista y radio operadora, ambos en la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo destinará a la adquisición de materiales de construcción para ampliar las habitaciones de su domicilio, que actualmente esta en construcción.
 
 
Es el tercer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Luis lives on Los Olivos street with his wife and school age children in their own little house, which, due to much effort and saving, they were able to buy in the outskirts of the city of El Alto. He works as a public employee in a state institution. His wife Maria has two part-time jobs as a telephone operator and a radio operator, both of them in the city of La Paz. The loan will be used to purchase construction materials to enlarge the rooms of his house that is currently under construction. This is his third loan with Impro and he has qualified by evaluation to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials such as brick, sand, cement to enlarge rooms in his house.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en:
G. Rustam is 28 years old and a married father of two small children. He owns a shop in which he sells spare moped engine parts, a business he has been running for the last 12 years. The income he earns allows him to support not only his children and his wife but also his two baby sisters and two brothers.

To meet his customers’ constantly growing demand, Rustam would like to increase his shop’s capacity. The profits from these sales will allow him to continue to support his large family and improve his living conditions. The loan will greatly improve Rustam’s income and his family's living standards.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others.

The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for cars in order to increase his range of goods

loans.name: Sherlith

texts.es: Sherlith tiene 35 años, es madre soltera y vive junto a sus 3 hijos quienes la apoyan mucho, en casa de su madre. Tiene un negocio de venta de jugos en un puesto de un mercado de su localidad, viene realizando esta actividad hace 7 años atrás y le va muy bien, ya que cuenta con una clientela regular que le es fiel. Sherlith está contenta porque gracias a este negocio está solventando las necesidades de sus hijos. Además le es rentable porque todos los días vende las porciones de jugo que se propone. Para más adelante quisiera tener un local propio y apropiado para su juguería. Con MFP ya tiene 10 créditos y le gusta trabajar con su grupo porque existe mucha comprensión y comunicación entre todos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará frutas y utensilios necesarios para implementar mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
Sherlith is 35 years old, is a single mother, and lives at her mother's house with her three children, who are very supportive. She has a business selling juices at a post in the local market. She has been doing this activity for 7 years and it is going very well, she already has regular and faithful customers. Sherlith is happy because thanks to this business she is meeting her children's needs. Moreover it is profitable because every day she sells portions of the juices that she offers. In the future she would like to have her own seperate place for juice selling. With MFP she already has 10 loans, she likes to work with this group because there is a lot of communication and understanding among members. With the money that she requests she will buy fruit and utensils that are necessary to better implement her business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit and utensils.

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en:
Ziad is a 27 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their child. Ziad owns livestock and sells milk. He is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua in order to increase his livestock. This is the first time that Ziad has requested a loan.

Ziad decided on his business because it is a demanding work in his region. When he first started, he faced the competition. He is speciA. in his work because of his experience with livestock. His clients are people from his region. In the future, he plans on increasing his livestock.

loans.use: To increase his livestock.

loans.name: Asibi

texts.en:
Asibi S. is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to six children. Some are in the senior high and others are in the junior high school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a commercial town in the western region of Ghana. Her husband is a farmer.

Asibi sells second hand clothes, ladies’ wear and bed sheets. She buys her goods in Kumasi and sells them at the market square in her community. She also treks to other markets to sell. Asibi has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy bales of textiles in bulk. She wants to expand her business and give her children the best of education that she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bales of textiles

loans.name: Phol

texts.en:
Phol M., 36, has been involved in her business of producing pillowcases since 2008 for an income of US$5 per day. She lives with her husband and three school-aged children. Her husband sells her production and bedroom sets for an income of US$13 per day in his village and in other nearby places that he can easily access with his motorbike.

M. wants to take a loan US$750 to expand the inventory of her husband’s business because she thinks that she will be able to generate more income for savings and expenses. M. is shown in the picture with her husband.

loans.use: To buy nets and blankets for her husband's business

loans.name: Ayub Kinuthia's Group

texts.en:
Ayub N. is married with one son. He runs a building and construction materials business at Kikuyu where he has lived for the past five years. His expected monthly profit is about 20,000 Kenyan shillings ($250 U.S.).  His construction supplies business is his only source of income.

Ayub was introduced to KADET by a friend who is already a KADET client.  With this loan, he intends to buy more supplies for his construction supply shop.

Ayub hopes to expand his business to a include more hardware, and to buy a plot of land to build a new store. He also wants to buy a pickup truck to deliver goods to his customers, and later venture into the freight business. Ayub also dreams of opening a home for needy children.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for a construction supply shop.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia es socia del Banco Comunal Amauta.
Eugenia es conviviente, tiene 44 años y 4 hijos, Eugenia tiene un kiosco ubicado cerca de un terminal terrestre, en donde vende productos variados como linternas, golosinas, pilas, artículos de aseo, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Eugenia necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de linternas y cepillos.
Los sueños de Eugenia son tener una tienda grande y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a member of the village bank "Amauta."

Eugenia is 44 years old, has four children, and lives with her partner. Eugenia has a kiosk located near the ground terminal where she sells various products like flashlights, candy, batteries, and toiletries where she works every day.

Eugenia needs a loan of 600 soles that she will invest in buying flashlights and brushes.

Eugenia's dreams are to have a large store and to provide a good education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying flashlights and brushes

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es: Felicita tiene 51 años, vive con sus hijas Julia de 24 y Fany de 20, en su casa propia. Desde hace 8 años se dedica al cuidado de niños en su Wawahuasi (Casa de cuidado de niños, programa gubernamental) llamado “Los Suspiritos”, lugar donde alberga a 5 niños, los cuales sus madres dejan a su cuidado cuando salen a trabajar. Ella es muy paciente y animosa, ya que dice que “cuidar niños no es nada fácil, están en una etapa en la que requieren mucha atención y aprenden todo lo que ven”, es por ello que Felicia trata de educarlos con juegos ilustrativos y lecturas. Para el futuro desea tener un local de estimulación temprana para ayudar a los niños a desarrollar sus talentos, es por ello que siempre está preocupada de aprender nuevas técnicas de enseñanza en su wawahuasi. Actualmente está pensando en contratar a una nutricionista para que pueda desarrollar dietas con alimentos balanceados para que puedan crecer saludables. Felicita quiere a los niños como si fueran sus hijos y ahora que su segunda hija está estudiando para ser profesora de educación inicial, cree que podrán hacer crecer su hogar y brindar una mejor atención. Este es su tercer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y todos los préstamos que ha tenido anteriormente le han ayudado a mejorar su hogar. Ella está muy agradecida y es por ello que siempre es muy puntual con los pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará material educativo, así como sacos de arroz, fideos e ingredientes para el preparado de los alimentos de los niños.
texts.en:
Felicita is a 51-year-old woman who lives with her daughters—Julia, age 24, and Fany, age 20—in her own house. For 8 years now, she has been taking care of children for a living in her Wawahuasi (a government-funded day care center) called “Los Suspiritos.” She looks after 5 children whose mothers leave them under her care so that they can go to work. She is a very patient and spirited person, stating that “Taking care of children is no easy task. They are at an age when they need lots of attention, and they learn everything that they see.” For this reason, Felicita tries to educate them by giving them lessons and using illustrative games. In the future, she would like to have her own early childhood educational center so that she can help students develop their talents, which is why she is always concerned with learning new pedagogical techniques in her wawahuasi. She is currently thinking about hiring a nutritionist who can create well-balanced diets for the children so that they can grow up healthy. Felicita loves the children as if they were her own, and now that her youngest child is studying to be an Early Education teacher, she thinks that they will be able to expand their home and provide better service. This is her third loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. All of her previous loans have helped her to improve her household. She is very grateful, which is why she is very punctual with her repayments. With this loan that she is requesting, she will purchase instructional materials, as well as sacks of rice, noodles, and the ingredients she needs for the children’s meals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase instructional materials and food for the children that she looks after

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La señora Maria Elena es socia del Banco Comunal “24 de Junio”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 34 años de edad, estado civil casada y madre de 02 hijos, estudio educación primaria completa, vive en la Parcialidad de Alinsuyo Ilave.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, hace varios años es una de las socias fundadoras,  su préstamo inicial fue de  S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invirtió en la compra de animales menores. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de llicllas para aumentar su mercadería, y venderlos en su puesto del mercado de Ilave, principalmente en las ferias semanales.

Su deseo es tener una casa propia en Ilave.
A ella le gustan las reuniones y los ahorros
texts.en:
Mrs Maria Elena is a partner of the Communal Bank "24th of June" which is situated in the district of llave, the province of El Collao, department of Puno. She is 34 years old, has a common law husband and two children. She completed her primary education and lives in the Parcialidad de Alinsuyo Ilave.

Maria Elena has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for some years and is one of the founding partners. Her initial loan was 500.00 soles which she invested in buying small animals.

Now she is requesting a loan of 500.00 soles to buy mantles to increase her merchandise and to sell them at Ilave market, mainly at the weekly fairs. Her wish is to have her own house in Ilave and she enjoys the meetings and savings.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mantles.

loans.name: Las Chavalas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las chavalas está integrado por  María de los Ángeles B., María Auxiliadora Pavón R. y Estela García, ellas son originarias de camino viejo a los Brenes zona rural de Nindiri.

La coordinadora del grupo María de los Ángeles B. de  28 años, ella  tiene tres años con la venta de verduras y frutas como pipian, ayote, tomate, yuca y pepino entre otros en el mercado de Masaya y lo que más anhela es tener su propio tramo, ya que es vendedora ambulante.

 Las otras dos integrantes son  Estela García quien vende ropa usada y María Auxiliadora Pavón R. que produce todo tipo de platos tipos derivados del cerdo como nacatamal donde se mezclan la masa, carne, arroz, chiltoma, cebolla, tomate, papa, todo en rodajas; se terminado condimentar con dos chiles congos enteros y se pone cubieto en hojas de chagüiete a cocer. Otro de los platos es la moronga, el frito, el chicharrón, el chancho con yuca y la venta de carne.

loans.use: Para comprar frutas y verduras como yuca, pipian, ayote, naranjas entre otros.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
La señora Delia es socia del Banco Comunal “Rió Desaguado” del distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 25 años de edad, estado civil conviviente, tiene 01 hijo, vive en el jr. Puno s/n, estudio educación secundaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace varios años no recuerda, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de verduras.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar papa, y verduras así como zanahorias, cebollas, zapallos, apio, etc para venderlo en el mercado de Desaguadero..

Su deseo es convertirse en mayorista y surtir mejor su mercadería.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y las reuniones

loans.use: Para la compra de papa, y verduras así como zanahorias, cebollas, zapallos, apio, etc

loans.name: Joselinda

texts.en: Mrs. Joselinda D. is from the village of Tugas, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is married and is blessed with five children who are school-aged. Joselinda owns and operates a business selling of RTW's (ready-to-wear clothes) in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for more than ten years, earning PHP 5,000 net income from her business. In 2002, Joselinda joined PMPC to access its programs and services. Currently, she's obtaining her 12th loan in the amount of PHP 50,000 which will be used for house renovation. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Savet

texts.en: Mrs. Savet Y. is a villager in Slaeng Kaong village in Takeo province. She is a grocer and now she wants to expand her store. Thus, she decided to request a loan to buy more grocery products to resell in order to earn more profits. She hopes to improve her business and provide a better life for her children. Mrs. Savet Y. is a widow with one child who is attending the local school.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products to resell

loans.name: Jamileh

texts.en: Jamileh is a 43-year-old widow who lives with her two siblings. Since 2000 she has run her own business producing dairy products, and has 15 years of experience in this field. Today, Jamileh is requesting a loan of $1,200 USD to purchase a refrigerator in which to present her products with a view to attracting more customers.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Yulissa Amparo

texts.es:
La señorita Yulissa es socia del Banco Comunal “Dulce Amanecer” desde hace 4 meses atrás del distrito y provincia de Puno, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 18 años de edad, cuenta con estudios superiores incompletos, es soltera y tiene 3 hijos.
Yulissa se dedica a la venta de artesanìas y nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo incrementar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles con los que podrá comprar lana y chompas.
Su sueño para el futuro es ser profesional y tener su empresa de artesanías. 
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Yulissa has been member of the communal bank "Sweet Dawn" for 4 months in the district and province of Puno in the department of Puno. She is 18 years old, she has not completed her secondary education; she is single and has 3 children. Yulissa sells handicrafts and she told us that with her first loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement for 300.000 soles she was able to increase her capital. She will ask for a credit of 500.000 new soles with which she will be able to buy wool and sweaters. Her dream for the future is to be a professional and have her own handicaft business. The thing she likes most about her communal bank is the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wool and sweaters

loans.name: Cristina's Group

texts.en:
Cristina S. is from the town of Rizaluna, Cordon. She is 43 years-old. Cristina is the leader of a 17-member group loan offered by Kiva partner ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Rizaluna Group.

Cristina is married and has adult children. Cristina is a tricycle operator. In 2009, Cristina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide the service. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Cristina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials.

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia A., 38, is a hardworking single parent of two children. She makes sure that she earns so that her family can have a better life. She has been managing her own water business and is also into the direct selling of ready-to-wear garments.

Dionesia has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than three years. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow 13 times in CCT’s Cooperative, a Kiva partner. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to buy equipment and containers needed for her water-station business. Her two businesses let her earn a profit of 4,000 Philippine pesos per month.  

Now, with your help, she would like a PHP 16,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying additional containers and additional clothes for her direct-selling business.

She dreams that she can have her own variety store someday and prays that she and her children will have a brighter future. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: Buying additional containers and additional clothes for her direct-selling business

loans.name: Doljindolgor

texts.en:
Doljindolgor is a 33-year-old very busy mother of three. Ten years ago, she started making felt shoes and boot liners for winter.  She used to live in the countryside but two years ago she moved to town.  Since moving, she has become very busy.  She has started making several new styles and has started to gather a growing clientele.  In order to keep her business growing, she needs some equipment and materials. She needs wool and combing and shaking machines to make the felt.  She also needs materials and detergent to wash the wool and felt.  She has also recently bought a knitting machine and is learning to use it.  As her patterns and product appearance get better, she wants to take on partners and maybe even teach other people how to make it. 
	Doljindolgor lives with her husband and three sons (6, 9, and 12) in Uvurkhangai province.  During the winter her husband drives a taxi and in the summer he goes to the countryside with the boys to tend to the livestock. Doljindolgor is meticulous in her work, hard working, and humble to a fault.  Since she was little, Doljindolgor has always finished what she started and seeing something she has accomplished makes her happy.  “There is a lot I want to do!” she says.

loans.use: To purchase materials and equipment to make felt

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: El Sr. Luis Alberto C. Ramírez, es casado, padre de dos hijos independientes, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos especialmente los cultivos de maíz,  trigo  y fríjol, tiene amplia experiencia en la agricultura y los créditos que ha solicitado con CEPRODEL  le han beneficiado para realizar sus labores de presiembra y pos siembra.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto C. Ramírez is married and has two, independent children. He is a farmer, particularly of corn, wheat and beans. He has ample farming experience and the loans that he has requested from CEPRODEL have been of use to him in his preplanting and postplanting labors.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming supplies for the approaching planting season.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen M. is married and has five dependents. He has been through junior high school.  Stephen sells rechargeable cards, top-up phone unit cards and also does transfer units to individual phones at a fee. He has set up a small stand by the street where he sells most of the top-up credits. 

His clients  are mostly people walking along the street who happen to run out of units needed to make calls with their mobile phones. His business is doing well since almost everybody in his area uses mobile phones. His business is located at Elmina. His wife is a petty trader. 

Stephen uses the income from his sales to educate his children.  Stephen will use the loan received to purchase more rechargeable and top-up cards from all the mobile phone service providers for resale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Stephen plans to save to buy a piece of land and hopes to get more profit to build a house on the land.

loans.use: to purchase more rechargeable and top-up cards

loans.name: Benso. Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benso sont essentiellement de  femmes mariées  ayant en moyenne 32 ans, 3 enfants et  vivant dans des familles monogames à Noumousso, un des quartiers de la ville de Kadiolo, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur cinquième  prêt solidaire, tous les précédents se sont  bien dénoués. 
Elles font la  la vente d’habits, de beurre de karité, de gingembre, la fabrication des boissons non alcoolisées, d’encens etc.
Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 3 douzaines d’habits pour  enfants, 85kg de beurre de karité, 20kg de sucre, 5 types d’encens, 3kg de tamarin, 10 paquets de sachet en plastique. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Kadiolo ville et dans les villages avoisinants. Elles vendent au marché, à domicile et  de façon ambulante, au comptant  souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 22.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elles comptent avoir plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et  pouvoir aménager un coin de vente.
texts.en:
The members of the Benso group are for the most part married women. On average they are 32 years old, have three children and live in monogamous families in the Noumousso neighborhood of Kadiolo, in the third administrative region of Mali. They work with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI to satisfy their customer needs and are requesting a fifth group loan, all preceding loans having been reimbursed in full. They retail clothes, shea butter, ginger, incense, produce non-alcoholic beverages, etc. With their new loan they want to buy three dozen sets of children’s clothes, 85 kilos of shea butter, 20 kilos of sugar, 5 sorts of incense, 3 kilos of tamarind, 10 packages of plastic bags. They get their supplies from the main market in Kadiolo and from neighboring villages. They resell in the market, as itinerant vendors or by home delivery, for cash but often on credit, to a customer base of both men and women. They hope to reach an average monthly income of 22,500 FCFA each, of which part will go into savings and answer family needs, and the remainder will be reinvested in the business activities. They are counting on an increase in their working capital to better satisfy customer demand and to set up a stall for their sales activities.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products

loans.name: Hortense

texts.fr: Née en 1979, A. Hortense vit depuis sa naissance à Tchinvié, dans le deuxième arrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Hortense est mariée à ADANOU Charles, un chauffeur, et est mère de deux enfants dont un est scolarisé. Hortense vit avec sa famille à Tchinvié. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Hortense vend des vêtements et des produits cosmétiques à Porto-Novo. Hortense s'approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, et au marché de Ouando à Porto-Novo. Hortense a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, et les a tous bien remboursés. Dans le but d'élever un peu plus le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Hortense sollicite un troisième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1979, Hortense A. has been living since her birth in Tchinvié, in the 2nd borough of Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She is married to Charles ADANOU, a driver, and is the mother of two children, of whom one is still attending school. She lives with her family in Tchinvié, where the couple shares responsibility for family expenses. To meet her needs, Hortense sells clothes and beauty products in Porto-Novo. She gets her products from Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, and from the Ouando market in Porto-Novo. Hortense has already been granted two loans from ALIDé, both of which have been repaid in full. Wishing to raise the level of her activity and increase customer satisfaction, she is now requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy second-hand clothing and beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy palm nuts

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny F. is a simple woman who dreams of getting her family out of poverty and helping her children enjoy careers of their choice. She also hopes that her husband's fishing business will grow, and help their children attend college and go to work for a business rather than becoming fishermen. Jenny joined ASHI as a way of achieving her dreams, and has applied for and received loans to support her husband's business.

Jenny is now applying for a new, larger loan from ASHI to start a business fattening pigs. Her goal is to augment her husband's small income and build up enough savings to achieve the dream of sending her children to college. She plans to spend four months fattening the animals, which she then plans to sell to people who live in her village.

loans.use: To buy piglets for fattening.

loans.name: Zosimo

texts.en:
Zosimo M. is from the village of Tapon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 50 years old. Zosimo is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Zosimo owns & operates a tire retreading and vulcanizing (chemical rubber processing) business to local community members. Zosimo has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.
