In 2010, Zosimo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zosimo is requesting a  loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools and other materials needed to improve the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Zosimo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support education of his children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase equipment to improve the business.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok C. is married and lives with her husband and three children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, known as the most populated city in the country. She sells beverages and coffee for an income of USD 5 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 8 per day.

C. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to buy groceries for sale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to expand her business. This is her fourth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is married with three children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She owns a stall in Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda, selling second-hand clothes. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for seven years. She does not incur transportation costs, as she buys from the place where she works. She works six days a week. Harriet sells her products retail to a variety of people. She joined MCDT in order to generate capital and because of the low interest rates. She is aspiring to sell wholesale only. Harriet resides in and rents a two-room house. The family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent, school fees, food, and medication.

loans.use: To buy bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es: Saturnina tiene 65 años, es una madre D. familia muy trabajadora, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más D. 5 años se dedica en la venta cereal, ya sea D. cebada, trigo, avena, maíz y chuño. Es entonces que cada 15 días viaja a la zona sierra del país, para abastecerse D. éstos productos que tiene mucha acogida en el mercado D. su localidad. Años atrás era muy tímida para las ventas, pero empujado por sus necesidades se inicio en este negocio, al que hoy le tiene mucho aprecio, por las rentas que le proporciona, actualmente sus hijos la apoyan en este trabajo, seleccionando los granos que están en buen estado. Saturnina está feliz  por  el progreso que ha tenido en su negocio, es así que han transcurrido 3 años y espera más adelante ampliar su mercado, para que sus rentas aumenten y pueda cubrir la educación D. sus hijos. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, y sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para aumentar su capital D. trabajo, por ello se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas oportunamente. Con este crédito que solicita, piensa abastecerse D. variedad D. granos para que pueda continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Sixty-five-year-old Saturnina is the mother of a hard-working family. She lives with her husband and two children in their own home. Five years ago she began to sell cereals maD. from barley, wheat, oats, corn, and potato. Five years ago she began to travel every 15 days to the mountainous region of the country to buy these products that are in demand at her local market. Years ago she was reluctant to sell, but necessity forced her to begin this business, and today she appreciates it because of the income it provides. Her children currently help her in this business by sorting and grading the grains. Saturnina is happy with the growth of her business. Things have been going well for the last 3 years, and she hopes to increase sales and profits in the future in order to pay for the education of her children. This is her tenth loan from MFP, and she knows that this loan will be very beneficial and will increase working capital. She is committed to making timely payments. With this loan, she plans on purchasing a variety of grains, which will enable her to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of grains to continue with her sale of cereals.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania V., 50 years old, sells fish for a living. Her husband is a fisherman. They work together to be able to buy their needs. They are childless. Now, they are just focusing on their existing business. 

She would like to apply for a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy fishing nets and other materials. She said that she likes the services of Community Economic Ventures Inc. She likes it because all of the borrowers have micro-insurance coverage.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Mussarat's Group

texts.en: Mussarat has spent her life in the city of Borewala in Pakistan. She is a housewife who spends most of her time taking care of her home and family. She has two daughters who are getting their education. The elder one is in sixth grade and the younger one is in kindergarten. Her husband has a cigarette-selling business, buying the cigarettes in the city of Peshawar and selling them from a stall which he rents in Borewala’s busy market. Mussarat's husband wants to operate his business on a larger scale by renting an adjacent shop but he has to pay a big advance up front, so Mussarat has applied for a loan from Asasah for this purpose. With the loan amount her husband will pay the advance on the shop and buy cigarettes of different brands in larger quantities. He has 8 years of experience in this field and Mussarat is hopeful that he will be able to increase his income in this way. Mussarat is receiving a loan for the second time. Earlier, she invested the loan amount in the expansion of her husband’s business, which has earned him a good income.

loans.use: Pay the advance rent on a cigarette store

loans.name: Rabeca Nhacale

texts.pt:
Rabeca Nhancale Z. nasceu na Provincia de Gaza Sul de Moçambique, casada e é mãe de 5 filhos dos 13 aos 24 anos, somente os três mais novos e que vão a escola. Fez a 4ª classe não concluiu devido a falta de condições, não responsabiliza se por niguem e consegue poupar 1.000.00mt, conta com ajuda do seu marido que trabalha na Africa do Sul.

Rabeca sai de Gaza para o Distrito de Namaacha com sua mãe, Inicia os estudos muito tarde e abandona quando sua mãe perde emprego, Anos depois  junta se com seu esposo e passa a viver numa casa de aluguer, inicia com seu próprio negócio de criação e venda de frangos. Consegue um lucro de  8.000.00mt quando vende a grosso para revendidores, e de 6.000.00mt quando vende por unidade a consumidores locais.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, este é o quarto empréstimo  na Hluvuku e segundo  com Kiva, com o qual pretende aumentar a quantidade da sua criação. Os empréstimos anteriores foram  de (9.200,00mt, 7.000,00mt e 10.000.00mt) foram para a mesma finalidade.
Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo emprestimo para construir a sua própria capoeira e sair da capoeira de aluguer.
texts.en:
Rabeca Nhacale was born in Province of Gaza, South of Mozambique. She is married and the mother of 5 children ranging from 13 to 24 years old. Only the three youngest go to school. She went to school until 4th grade but didn't finish due to lack of conditions. She doesn't support anyone and manages to save 1,000 meticais with the help of her husband who works in South Africa. Rabeca left Gaza to the Namaacha District with her mother. She started going to school very late and dropped out when her mother lost her job. Years later she moved in with her husband and started renting a house. She then started her own business raising and selling chickens. She has a profit of 8,000 meticais when she sells wholesale to vendors and 6,000 when she sells by the unit to local costumers. She has never had loans from other banks. This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku and second with Kiva. She intends to increase the amount of chickens she raises. Her previous loans were in the amount of 9,200, 7,000, and 10,000 meticais and were used for the same goal. She is confident she will pay the loan back before it is due and request a new loan to build her own coop and leave the rental coop she uses.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase of chicks and feed

loans.name: Catheine Waithira

texts.en:
Catherine Waithira is a 36-year-old single lady who takes care of her three school-age children who are between 16 and four years. She runs a small kiosk in Ngara market, just next to the town centre in Nairobi. She has been in this business for three years. Most of her customers are business people who are mechanics in Ngara.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and is applying for her first loan of 21,000 KES. She plans to buy plastic chairs worth 10,000 KES, kitchenware worth 6,000 KES, and foodstuffs worth 5,000 KES.

Catherine hopes to grow her business with the income received, and has great hopes of operating a big hotel. She expects to have increased profit with a stable income which will improve her standard of living and offer her children a better education.

loans.use: To buy plastic chairs, kitchenware and foodstuffs

loans.name: Timothe

texts.fr:
Homme de 49 ans marié et père de 2 enfants dont l’âge varie de 22ans à 20ans. Ayant un niveau d’étude universitaire, il s’est lancé dans le commerce des plastiques pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille en 2007 avec un capital de 100000frs.sa boutique est située sur une grande avenue à côté d’un petit marché, il à des clients réguliers et fait des revenus considérables allant de 20000frs à 50000frs par jours.

Avec ce prêt il va renforcer son commerce en achetant : des cantines, paniers en plastique, chaises, bassine et cuvette.

Son ambition est d’avoir plus de revenu afin d’ouvrir d’autres point de vente. Il aimera soutenir ses enfants et en améliorant leurs condition de vie.
Discret, et fait attention à tout le monde, il est  prit comme exemple par les jeunes gens de son quartier.
texts.en:
This 49-year-old man is married and has two children, ages 20 and 22. He attended university. 

In 2007, he started selling plastic ware with a capital of 100 000frs to support his family. He keeps a shop on a major street near a small market. He has regular customers, and earns substantial revenues averaging from 20 000 to 50 000frs per day.

With this loan, he plans to strengthen his business by buying bottles, baskets, chairs, bowls and basins.

His goal is to boost his income and open additional retail outlets. He wants to keep providing for his children by improving their living conditions. 

Discreet and attentive, he is a role model for the local youth.

loans.use: To buy bowls, baskets, tables, basins, etc.

loans.name: Rosalin Orcullo's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosalin O., 33 years of age, married, is a resident of Tabid, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. Rosalin is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Rosalin Orcullos’s Group.
Rosalin is married to Walther, a security guard of Johanne’s Cuisine. They are blessed with 2 children of school age. To help her husband, she decided to engage in micro business particularly in processing fish ball for her snack vending activity.  For 2 years already, she has been able to maintain the said business activity and this time she is earning an average net income of not less than P3,500.00 a month in which the said amount is so helpful to their family income. Upon hearing the good news of PAGLAUM MPC for being one of the most outstanding cooperative in Northern Mindanao and awarded coop for being Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines during the search for COOP-LGU Partnership Award 2006 and awarded for CUMI Performance Award she joined  the cooperative just this year. As a newly recognized member of the PDP-LP Program of PAGLAUM MPC, a micro-finance program that reached out the rural poor, she is requesting an amount of P5,000.00 as her 1st loan to be used for additional capital for her fish ball vending activity. The future income from this loan will be used to improve the living conditions for her family, to meet their basic needs, make loan repayments to PMPC, provide for their children’s education and for possible business expansions.

loans.use: Additional capital for her fish ball vending business

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 33 years old and married with three children who are 3, 5 and 8 years old. Rachel owns a shop where she sells a variety of goods including cosmetics, water and some other goods as shown. Rachel has had this shop for a few years. Her shop is open from early in the morning until late in the evening.

Rachel needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a. With this loan, she will expand her business by purchasing a variety of foodstuffs in high demand by a large number of her customers. These foodstuffs will include rice, sugar, beans, Irish potatoes, cooking oil, etc. With these additional foodstuffs, Rachel will hopefully earn more profit, which will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability and to continue taking care of her future.

loans.use: To buy a variety of foodstuffs including rice, sugar, beans, Irish potatoes, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase nuts to roast and sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 22-year-old single man living with his parents and one brother. In 2003, he opened a small car repair shop. He works independently in his business. He repairs different type of cars and works hard to cover the increasing costs of food, housing, and other family expenses. His income is needed to help his father to meet the needs of the family. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve his business level and purchase needed tools to attract more clients. In the future, he is planning to expand his shop and add a new service by selling car oil.

loans.use: to improve his business level and purchase needed tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase items to expand his business

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman is married with 2 children. He is a manager in a small firm from Stryi. His company offers energy efficient and made-to-offer doors and windows for both construction and replacement. Roman doesn’t only sell the items but also offers installation services to clients. Roman’s pay is about 2,000 Grivnyas a month.    

Roman owns a vehicle that he uses for both business and personal purposes. He is seeking a loan of 3,000 Grivnyas to do much needed repairs of the vehicle. The family has had the car for awhile and now it needs some repair work. Roman can be characterized as a focused businessman and a wise steward of his finances.

loans.use: To do repairs on his vehicle

loans.name: Messelle

texts.en:
Messelle F. is from the barangay of Cebedo St. Aguada Ozamiz City. She is 36 years old. Messele is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Messelle owns and operates a sari-sari store and a boarding house. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Messelle joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used as additional working capital for her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions for her family.

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as working capital for business

loans.name: Virgilla

texts.en:
Virgilla L. is from the village of Banigan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 40 years old, is married, and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Virgilla has been engaged in this business for more than 15 years and earns approximately 3500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from the business.

Virgilla joined PMPC in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virgilla has successfully repaid a previous PMPC loan of 10,000 PHP, which she used to purchase breeding livestock. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will likewise be used to purchase breeding livestock. This will be her fifth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna M., 44, has got big dreams, and she’s working out her entrepreneurial capabilities to reach them. Lorna graduated from college and is now raising a family with two children, hand in hand with her husband, Michael. They currently live in Tanza, Cavite.

The main business Lorna manages is selling slippers. Also, she is into direct selling of products from beauty brands, like Avon and Natasha. She has been keeping her merchandise at home and sometimes brings them over to her customers’ houses so that they can have a good pick of what suits their taste. Lorna knows the tastes of her regular customers well, having been nine years in this business. Monthly, she is able to earn around Php10,000.

To help her continue operation of her businesses, she is requesting a Php18,000 loan. She plans to buy assorted slippers in bulk so that she can offer various options to her customers. She will also use part of the money for the renovation of their house and the studies of her children, while making sure the business stays profitable.

At present, Lorna faces problems in her family. Nevertheless, her strength comes from the time she spends praying to the Lord. She knows that if she can endure, she will emerge victorious, as the Word of the Lord says. Lorna sees that part of the victory the Lord will give her is a commercial space in a mall, where potential buyers are close at hand. She hopes for increased profitability so that, in the end, she will be able to help others in need. That, for her, is one big dream she is ready to fulfill.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase quantities of assorted slippers

loans.name: Siyethemba Group

texts.en:
Carol is 53 years old and married, with 4 children between the ages of 10 and 25 years. Only one of her children attends school. She runs a clothing business in Mtubatuba in South Africa (KZN). In the photo she is in a green shirt raising her hand.

She has been in this business for 5 years, selling new clothes and hiring, or renting clothes to customers at her home. She also earns income from  a government disability grant. She says that the main challenges to her business are customers who do not pay on time. She requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to buy new clothes. She adds that the extra income from this loan will help her buy furniture for her family and extend her home. In the future, she would like to own a big shop in town.

loans.use: To buy new clothes and fabric

loans.name: Shameem's Group

texts.en:
Shameem is a very helpful lady, Along with her household responsibilities, she also helps her husband in his agriculture business. She is married to S., who works in the fields. He grows different seasonal crops, and after cultivating the crops he sells them to his customers. He is very experienced in his work and has many business contacts. 

She has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, to improve her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy seeds and fertilizers for his fields to gain good results.  She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. She established a good credit record in the previous year by paying her installments on time. 

Shameem belongs to a small city of Pakistan called Khanewal. It is known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in the area called Shanti nagar in a two-room brick house with her family for the past fifteen years. She has a son and a daughter. Her son has a job in the private sector, and her daughter is studying in college.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for the farm

loans.name: B. En Desarrollo 1 Group

texts.en:
Guillermina began with a small investment when she received her first loan from Esperanza. She will use the ninth loan to buy apparel. She will use her earnings to buy other necessities for her home, like a computer that her children need as well as for her business. Now, she will also save to build a future place for her business, as she wants to have a successful business. Her main goal is to have an improved business and give her family a more stable life. She loves to read the word. 

Guillermina is one of the members of Group B developing 1, made up of 5 micro businesswomen selling clothing, miscellaneous products, shoes, handicrafts, etc. She works in Samana, an up and coming tourist city on the Atlantic coast that is rich in natural resources. She is associated with Esperanza International, and she began about 6 years ago and currently is very excited about receiving the 11th loan after having satisfactorily paid back the previous ones. Guillermina is the mother of 3 children, and they live together with her long-term partner.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Josabeth

texts.es:
La señora  Josabeth es socia del banco comunal Nuevas amigas, del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 55 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo en edad escolar.
Todos estos años se dedicó a trabajar en la venta de diferentes mercaderías, especialmente ropa (polos para hombres).  Es socia de Manuela Ramos desde hace 10 años, éstos préstamos que le han servido como capital de trabajo.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 5 docenas de polo en diferentes tallas y colores. 12 blusas, 6 pantalones, 6 faldas para niñas.
Tiene que trabajar para poder solventar los gastos de su hijo que todavía sigue estudiando y tiene que ayudarlo hasta que termine sus estudios, porque es el único apoyo que tiene hasta el momento.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por toda la ayuda brindada todos estos años
texts.en:
Señora Josabeth is a member of the Nuevas Amigas (New Friends) Community Bank in Calleria District in Ucayali Department. She is 55 years old and a single mother of a school-aged son.

Josabeth has earned her living for many years selling different types of merchandise especially clothing (men’s sports shirts). She has been a member of Manuela Ramos for ten years and has used the loans as working capital.

With this new loan of S/.2,000 she plans to buy five dozen sports shirts of different sizes and colours, twelve blouses, six pairs of pants, and six children’s skirts.

Josabeth has to work to pay for her son’s expenses as he is still in school and she is the only person supporting him. She is grateful to Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for the help it has given her over the years.

loans.use: to buy sports shirts, blouses, pants etc.

loans.name: Bayarjargal

texts.en:
Bayarjargal B. is a 37-year-old divorcee. She lives with her only daughter, Munkhjargal, 16, in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter attends a secondary school. 

Bayarjargal is a hardworking woman with a strong desire to raise a healthy daughter and to give her a proper education. Seven years ago she bought a minivan and obtained a license to carry passengers on one of the remote bus lanes. She hired a driver and she works as a conductor. During the past seven years she has gained a lot of experience and her business is running smoothly. 

Each year she has to pass the safety test for her minivan and every two to three years she has to renew the car. Now it is time for the test. Therefore, she is planning to do a proper annual service to her minivan, servicing the engine, replacing seats and doing some body work. The loan she is requesting will be used to pay for spare parts and for the service to her minivan, including engine and body work.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and to repair her minivan to meet the transportation authorities' requirements.

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.en:
Victoriano A. is 57 years old, married and has two adult-aged children. He lives in the village of Katipunan,Sinacaban,Misamis Occidental. Victoriano owns and operates a business in the services sector operating transportation services. The main source of his income comes from operating tricycle transport services. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP.

In 2011, Victoriano joined Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to access financial services to improve his living situation and ability to engage in business.  He requests a new loan of 10000 PHP to purchase tires and other transportation accessories. It will be his first loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand his business. 

About Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC):

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 31 years old and single.  For four years, he has been operating a stationery shop.  His desire is to enlarge the business premises and get more customers.  Currently, he operates the business with one employee and hopes to employ more people.  James says that he has benefited from Faulu Kenya because he has managed to save his money and share business ideas with his group members.  He has requested 50,000 KES to buy toner, cartridges and printing paper.

loans.use: to buy toner, cartridges and printing paper.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Mary Jane is providing manicure & pedicure services. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy utilities for the maintenance of the service. Mary Jane is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Mary Jane hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional nail polish and nail enhancer.

loans.name: Felipe De Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Felipe, de 59 años, habita en la comunidad Santa Teresa ubicada en Condega municipio de Estelí, esta casado, tiene 6 hijos , el es agricultor. El empezó en esta actividad gracias a su padre quien le enseño el oficio de la siembra, preparar  terrenos para cultivar, al transcurrir los años se independizo de su papa trabajando muy duro desde tempranas horas de la madrugada  el logro comprar su propia finca donde siembra maíz y frijoles, también tiene otros ingresos como es el ganado el vende leche, el lo comercializa dentro de su misma comunidad, tiene a trabajadores que le ayudan a sembrar.  
El solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de tres manzanas de frijol, compra de abono, pago de mano de obra, compra de fertilizantes. Con esta inversión espera poder sacar una buena producción y obtener mejores ingresos. En lo futuro le gustaría tener en su finca con un buen sistema  de pasto que le permita sacar una alta producción leche.
texts.en:
Felipe, 59, lives in the community of Santa Teresa located in Condega, Estelí.  He’s married and has six children.  He’s a farmer.  He started this occupation thanks to his father who taught him how to farm and prepare the soil for planting.  In time, he became independent from his father working hard from very early in the morning.  He managed to buy his own farm where he grows beans and corn.  He also earns additional income raising cattle; he sells milk in his own community.  He hires laborers to help him plant.

He is asking for the loan for maintenance of his three manzanas (Central American unit of land measurement) of bean crop, to buy manure, to pay labor costs and to buy fertilizer.  He hopes the investment will lead to a good harvest and better income.  In the future, he’d like to have a farm with good pasturage so that he can increase milk production.

loans.use: to care for his bean crops, purchase manure, pay labor costs and to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
La señora Georgia, vive en la localidad de San Juan, cerca de coapilla, ella es madre soltera con una hija  de nombre Rosalba Esther  de ocho años de edad.

    Se dedica a su negocio de abarrotes desde hace seis años y cuatro meses, y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía y  así tener surtida su tienda, ya que es con esto  que está teniendo  ingresos para sacar adelante a su pequeña hija.

   Se inspiro a esta actividad para tener sus propios ingresos   y así de esta manera tener sus propios ingresos, paraqué con ello tenga de donde darle lo mejor a su hija ya que su esposo el abandono cuando la bebe estaba muy chico y ella decidió tener un trabajo en donde pueda apoyarse con lo gastos.

    Lo que desea es que con esta actividad pueda salir adelante y con la bendición de dios con el tiempo agrandar su negocio para apoyar a su hija a que  tenga una profesión.
texts.en:
Señora Georgina lives in San Juan, near Coapilla.  She is a single mother with a daughter named Rosalba Esther, who is eight years old.

She has been working in her grocery business for six years and four months, and is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of goods to keep her store well stocked, as it is through this that she earns income so her young daughter can move forward in life.

She was inspired to do this activity so as to have her own income, and in this way she earns her own income.  With this she can provide the best for her daughter.  Her husband left her when the baby was very young and she decided to take on work which could help her with expenses.

What she wants is for this business to progress, and that with the blessing of God she can in time enlarge her business to support her daughter, so she can get a profession.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of goods to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Nonvignon (Habitat) Group

texts.fr: NONVIGNON (Habitat) est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la  présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Blandine. Les membres du groupe habitent dans la même maison au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Blandine est âgée de 38 ans et est mariée à un certain Maximin. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et vivant ensemble avec eux. En dehors de ces enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge. Après avoir arrêté l’école au primaire, Blandine a commencé depuis une dizaine d'année, la vente de cartes de recharges téléphonique à son domicile. En dehors de cette activité, Blandine vend de "pur Water". Blandine s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à ainsi assurer les diverses charges de la famille. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Blandine et aux autres membres du groupe NONVIGNON (Habitat) de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en: The Nonvignon (Habitat) group comprises three people and its president (with the raised hand in the photo) is named Blandine. The group members live in the same house in Benin. With the goal of increasing their working capital, this group is seeking its first loan with ALIDÉ. Blandine is 38 years old and married to a man named Maximin. The couple have two children, both in school, and all of the family lives together. Apart from their own children, the couple have one more child in their care. After having ended her studies in primary school, Blandine started selling rechargeable phone cards at her home about ten years ago. In addition to this activity, Blandine sells "pure water." She gets her supplies at one of the markets in Benin. This business provides her with an income that helps her meet the various family expenses. This first loan will certainly allow Blandine and the other Nonvignon (Habitat) group members raise the level of their businesses and increase their clientele and income.

loans.use: To buy rechargeable phone cars and a machine to make "pure water"

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is a mother of seven; she is married and is 56 years old.  She is a farmer working in the Philippines and earns an average annual net income of PHP 30,000 every cropping season during April and November.  Income generated from the business supports their daily needs and pays for the children's school fees. 

She is asking for a loan amount of PHP 10,000 to use to pay the labor fees of hired people working for her in the rice field and to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm.  She has always wanted to do farming and she has been in this business for over 20 years.

loans.use: to pay labor fees of hired people working for her in the rice field and to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Lourgen

texts.en:
Lourgen is 46 years old. She is married with 2 grown dependents. The family is living in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Lourgen owns and operates a retail store at home to make additional income for the family. She has been running the store for 15 years. The store operations give her a montly income of 3,000 PHP.

Earllier this year, she became a member of GDMPC. She has applied a loan of 5,000 PHP from the cooperative to purchase liquor supplies like Tanduay, San Miguel beer, etc. Lourgen plans that a portion of the income generated from this loan will be set aside to buy a new freezer for the store.

loans.use: To purchase liquor supplies like Tanduay, San Miguel beer, etc.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio de 50 años es casado y padre de dos hijos que aun dependen económicamente de él y de su esposa Rudith, él trabaja como carnicero desde hace 5 años  y su esposa hace un años que cuenta con un empleo que le permite apoyar los gastos del hogar;  tienen 30 años viviendo en su domicilio y poco a poco le han ido haciendo mejoras a su casa, en Agosto del 2010 Antonio  y su familia llenos de ilusiones iniciaron la construcción de un cuarto grande en la parte de atrás de su vivienda y hasta el día de hoy no lo han podido concluirlo  por falta de los recursos económicos y requieren el apoyo para compra de lámina galvanizada, cemento y pintura para poder hacer su sueño realidad.
texts.en: Antonio is 50 years old, he is married bad has two children who are still economically dependent on him and on his wife Rudith. He has been a butcher for 5 years, and since a few years his wife has got a job with which she helps paying for family expenses. They have been living in their own house for 30 years, making improvements to their house little by little. Full of anticipation, in August 2010 Antonio and his family started the construction of a big room at the back of their house. As to today they have not yet been able to finish it due to lack of money, they are requesting a loan to buy zinc-coated steel sheets, cement and paint to succeed in making their dream come true.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a roof on a room at the back of his house.

loans.name: Gilda Analia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal 8 De Diciembre.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Gilda, tiene 52 años de edad, está divorciada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad, con ella vive uno de sus hijos que está por terminar sus estudios en medicina. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que les dan a todas las socias del banco.

Ella es fisioterapista y trabaja en una escuela para niños con problemas de aprendizaje (niños especiales), además de esto también en su casa tiene una óptica que la administra junto con el ex esposo el cual es oftalmólogo, nos cuenta que a pesar de estar separados ellos tiene esta sociedad en el negocio y que lo han tenido por más de 19 años y les ha dejado muy buenos ingresos ya que tienen muchos clientes que llegan hasta sus local por la calidad de la atención y servicio que ofrecen.
 
Este crédito es para comprar materiales para elaborar lentes como vidrios ópticos y marcos en toda medida y modelos para dar un buen servicio.

Sus metas son seguir adelante y que su hijo termine su carrera por completo.
texts.en:
Members of the 8 de Diciembre communal bank meet every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi and known for many years as the city of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

Here, we meet Sra. Gilda, who is 52 years old, divorced and who has four adult children. One of her sons, who is about to finish his medical studies, lives with her. She has been with the communal bank since its beginning and she likes the help that all of the members give one another.

She is a physical therapist and works in a school for children with learning disabilities (special education). She also has an optical office in her house that she runs together with her ex-husband, who is an ophthalmologist. She tells us that despite being separated, they have maintained this partnership in the business, which they have had for more than 19 years. It has provided them with a very good income, since many patients come to their office because of the quality of the care and the service they provide.

This loan is to buy materials to make eye glasses, such as optical glass and frames in all sizes and styles, in order to provide good service.

Her goals are to continue getting ahead and that her son finish his medical training.

loans.use: to buy optical glass and frames

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en: Sitha, 51, resides with her husband and a kid in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Sitha is a farmer, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Her husband is employed at the factory, earning an income of USD 2.6 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 37 on the other necessary expenses. Sitha is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for the children to commute to work. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the children to commute to work

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en:
Tungalag is 47-years-old and lives with her husband and two children, aged 19 and 26, in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her family lives in a small house, which is in outer ger district, a district without basic infrastructure of the city. Her son attends a local high school and her daughter helps at her business while her husband works at a rural company.

Tungalag supports her family by operating a clothing retail stall at the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. First she sold her handmade women's coats of various kinds at the another person's stall. As she expanded her business she began to sell women's clothes with imports from Ereen, a border city between Mongolia and China. 

Today, she is requesting a 1.200.000 MNT /Mongolian Tugriks/ loan to purchase more clothes to sell in this autumn and warm clothes to sell which customers need in the beginning winter season. She hopes that she will improve her business as well.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell this autumn.

loans.name: Zenovia

texts.es:
Zenovia es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos.
Zenovia vende abarrotes, recuerda que empezó con 300 soles y con ese primer préstamo compró las cosas que le faltaban para su tienda, y con todo lo que pudo esforzarse pudo construir su casa, ahora con este préstamo comprará atún, azúcar y jabón que es lo que le falta. Da gracias a Finca por toda la ayuda que le brindaron, le enseñaron a ser responsable, le daba las ganas para poder seguir trabajando, el ahorro siempre le ayudo a poder cumplir sus metas, pudo educar a sus hijos.
texts.en: Zenovia is a member of the communal bank "Anabella". She is 32 years old and she has 2 children. Zenovia sells groceries. She recalls that she started out with 300 soles and with this first loan she purchased the items that her store required. And with it all she managed to have a house built for her. With this loan she will purchase tuna, sugar, and soap, which is the merchandise that she lacks. She is thankful to Finca (Kiva Field Partner) for all of the help they have given her. They taught her to be responsible and she gained the strength to keep working. The savings have always helped her attain her goals and she has been able to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to purchase tuna, sugar, and soap.

loans.name: Hope To God Iv Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Hope To God IV” group from Waterloo, a town in Western Sierra Leone where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. These small scale businesswomen have come to SMT, also a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 600,000 SLL for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Mabinty is the leader of this group. The 50-year-old is married to a businessman and they have 4 children – 2 in primary and secondary schools and 2 adults. Mabinty has been a businesswoman for about 30 years now. She sells cooked foo-foo (food made out of cassava roots). With her share of this loan, she is going to buy uncooked foo-foo and cooking ingredients like fish, onions, tomatoes, palm-oil, etc. in order to cook a larger quantity of foo-foo to sell.

loans.use: to buy uncooked foo-foo and cooking ingredients like fish, onions, tomatoes, palm-oil, etc. in order to cook a larger quantity of foo-foo to sell.

loans.name: Marcia Luisa

texts.es: Marcia Luisa tiene 33 años, ella es maestra de primaria está solicitando este crédito para realizarle mejoras a su vivienda como instalaciones de puertas, ventanas y reparaciones. Hace 4 años que Marcia quiere realizar estas mejoras pero no podía porque tenía que cumplir con las obligaciones diarias del hogar. Sueña con mejorar su casa con el paso del tiempo y realizarle las mejoras necesarias. El financiamiento es para la compra de puertas de madera, ventanas de vidrio, clavos, entre otros.
texts.en:
Marcia Luisia is 33 years old and works as an elementary school teacher. She is requsting this loan so that he can make improvements to her home by installing doors, windows, and making repairs. Marcia wanted to make these improvements four years ago, but was not able because she had to fulfill her daily household obligations. She dreams of renovating her house over time and making the necessary improvements.

This loan will be used to buy wooden doors, glass window panes, nails, and other materials.

loans.use: to buy wooden doors, glass window panes, nails, and other materials.

loans.name: Liza Joy

texts.en: Liza Joy  is 54 years old, married and blessed with four children. Her husband is a private employee.  Liza Joy manages their snack vending business. She is a pioneering member of Paglaum MPC.  She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business.  She hopes that her snack vending business will grow, and she will be able to sell and deliver to her customers in future.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Joseph Gitonga

texts.en:
Joseph is married and has two children who are ages of five and seven years old. He has been selling shoes for four years at Kangeta shopping centre in Maua town.The business is faced with the problem of increased costs of maintaining the business. 

Joseph will be using the loan Kes 20,000 to buy shoes. He wants to expand his business in the future and add stocks of shoes.

loans.use: to add stocks of shoes.

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Hajara lives in Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (two orphans). Hajara has a business selling green bananas. She has been in this business for five years, and she works six days out of every week.     

Hajara sells her products at the market as a retailer. Hajara has requested a loan of UGX 1,000,000 from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of green bananas. 

She also generates additional income through rental houses. The main business challenges for Hajara include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to be wholesaler and to own a delivery van to ease transportation. Hajara lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Angel Roberto

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Proyecto 2003 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a don Roberto, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y tiene 6 hijos, 4 en un primer compromiso y dos con su actual pareja que son los que viven con él y que estudian en  escuela. Su esposa es comerciante.

El tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos, como víveres, legumbres, así como papelería y productos de bazar entre otras cosas, allí trabaja su esposa todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 ya en tarde y noche el se hace cargo del negocio ya que en el día el también tiene un carro en el cual trabaja realizando fletes.  Tienen 18 años con este negocio y les va muy bien.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, legumbres, artículos de bazar y papelería, entre otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 4 ciclos le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos.

Su meta es comprar otro carro ya que el que tienen está un poco deteriorado.
texts.en:
The Proyecto 2003 community bank meets every 15 days in Jaramito (Manta), a pretty place known for its beautiful beaches.  Many hard-working local people earn their living from the sea.  

We met Don Roberto, 44, here.  He is married and has 6 children, 4 with his former wife and two with his current wife.  The children live with him.  All the children are in school.  His wife is a merchant.

Don Roberto owns a grocery store where he sells all kinds of everyday products: food, housewares, etc.  His wife manages the business, working there from 6:00am to 8:00pm.  Don Roberto takes over in the afternoons.  During the day, he operates a taxi business.  He has owned the store for 18 years and is happy with his progress.
 
Don Roberto will use this loan to stock his store.  He will buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergents, vegetables, housewares, paper products and other everyday products.  This is his fourth round of funding with the community bank and he likes it because the interest rates are low.

His goal for the future is to buy a new car for his taxi business.

loans.use: to stock his grocery store.

loans.name: Nazik

texts.en:
Nazik, who was born in Yerevan in 1968, is married and has a son and a daughter. Her husband works in an ice-cream factory, while her son has already returned from the army and now is working and helping his parents. Nazik's daughter is a student.

For 11 years Nazik has been selling fruits and vegetables, initially from a rented stall but now from a small rented shop board at the food market. Early each morning she buys fruits and vegetables wholesale and then transports them to her shop board. Her customers from her previous business location continue to patronize her new site, and her profits allow Nazik to take care of the needs of her family and pay for her daughter’s education.

Nazik is now requesting a 300,000 AMD loan to buy a large lot of fruits and vegetables to resell in advance of the New Year’s holidays, when the trade is very active. This will be her third loan from Kiva and Nor Horizon.

loans.use: to buy a large lot of fruits and vegetables to resell in advance of the New Year’s holidays.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is widow with five children, one is still too young for school while the others graduated in secondary level and could not continue to college because of lack of school fees. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three months, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors. 

Asha faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation incurred while traveling from the place of purchasing vegetables to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her business and hiring more employees in the future.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes and fruits for resale. She decided to join Yehu after seeing successful clients in the program.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes and fruits for resale.

loans.name: Selesitina

texts.en:
Salasitina is thirty-five years of age and is married with one child. She owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has 5 years of experience in this business. Selesitina needs a loan of WST 2,500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Selesitina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Selesitina's 5th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Emma's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans un même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Emma est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Emma est mariée à un certain Tanguy. Emma n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Emma vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Emma vend depuis sept ans des dentifrices et du charbon de bois de façon secondaire. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Emma s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et vend ses produits de façon ambulante. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Emma sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des dentifrices et du charbon de bois.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 16,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Erlinda has been in this business for six years. Erlinda earns additional income from buying and selling fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing net for her fishing business.

loans.name: Djekadi  2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe DJEKADI  2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Kapala, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le pois sucré avec Koro assise au milieu sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et la semence pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants et de semences agricoles

loans.name: Francia Argentina

texts.en:
My name is Francia Mensoza. I sell food such as meat burritos, bread and beans, tortillas with cheese, lunches, quesadillas,enchiladas, pupusas, baleadas, and plantains with butter. I have been doing this for five years with the help of my brother who works the front counter. My clients are very good and my business is located infront of a hospital school. My business generates enough income to support my family. My goal is to increase my inventory and with the earnings, I will be able to support my family and pay for school for my neice. This loan will be used to purchase beef, pork and chicken, mortadela, ham, cheese, bread, tortillas, coal, matches, oil, butter, beans, disposable plates, vegetables, refreshments, juice, plates, paper, aluminum, bags, water, rice, churros, eggs, plantains

Mi nombre es francia Mensoza me dedico a la venta de comida como ser burritas de carne, emparedados, pan con frijoles, tortillas con quesillo, almuerzos, quesadillas, enchiladas, pupusas, baleadas, platanos con mantequilla, tengo 5 años de tener mi negocio y tambien tengo la ayuda de mi hermano para atender las ventas, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que mi negocio esta ubicado frente al hospital escuela, mi negocio me genera ingresos para mantener mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario y con las ganancias que obtenga poder mantener mi familia, el estudio de mi hija y de mi hermano.

loans.use: Compra de carne de res, cerdo y pollo, mortadela, jamon, queso amarillo, pan, tortillas, carbon, fosforos, aceite, manteca, frijoles, queso, vegetales, refrescos, jugos, platos desechables, papel aluminio, bolsas, agua, arroz, churros, quesillo, huevos, platanos

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
35-year-old Murad with his 1 child settled in Sumgait city. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Zangilan region. Since 2004 he has been engaged in meat sales to improve his family’s living condition. As he did not have enough funds, he could not develop his business well enough in the beginning. Having borrowed first loans of amount $800 he significantly expanded his business, has built the new cold store. The loans were paid back timely.
Now Murad wants loan amount of $1200 for construction of his own butcher shop.

loans.use: To construct his own butcher shop

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Mrs. Rose I. is a lovely and faithful mother.  She is 36 years old. She sells drinks and snacks to her community. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She hopes to use the loan for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and baking equipment for snacks for sale

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila G. lives in Beylagan. She is married and she has 3 children. She is engaged in trading, and has a market near her home. Jamila sells fruits and vegetables, and her husband helps her in her job. He buys fruits and vegetables and Jamila sells them at her market. But they haven't got much money to buy more kinds of goods. Jamila is a client of Normicro Beylagan Branch. She borrowed a loan in the amount of $300 in 2005 and 2006 and expanded her business. Now she needs a loan in the amount $500 to increase her daily selling.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en: Abdul is 25 years old and sells cigarettes and biscuits at the market in Magburaka.  He is married with a child and has a future to build in terms of a good family life.  He would like to develop his business into a big store in the future.  He said his previous loan has allowed him to move his business one step ahead.  Mr. B. therefore is requesting $175 for this purpose.

loans.use: Needs to increase his capital for purchasing more goods for trading.

loans.name: Ernesto Antonio

texts.pt:
Ernesto António T. was born in Maputo on December 13, 1977. Due to the financial situation of his parents, he abandoned his studies and began to work at 14 years of age. He began as a walking merchant selling various goods. Later, he was influenced by some photographers that he met at that time and decided to become a photographer. But he didn't have a camera nor money to buy one, so at age 19 he went to South Africa with the idea of getting a job there to save money for a camera. But he couldn't find work there, so he began working again as a walking merchant in South Africa. After 2 years, he was able to buy a camera and returned to Mozambique where he continued as a merchant while learning how to use his camera. Eighteen months later, he began work as a photographer, and at age 23, married his wife, with whom he has a 2 year old son. His wife tends to their mini market stand while he works in photography.

This loan will have a positive impact on his business because it will increase the volume of products he can offer and will allow him to buy another camera without having to go to South Africa for work. In the future he hopes to have his own photo studio.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Ernesto António T. , nasceu em Maputo aos 13 de dezembro de 1977 onde, devido a debilidade financeira dos seus progenitores foi obrigado a abandonar os estudos e iniciar o negócio com 14 anos. Iniciou como vendedor ambulante onde vendia vários artigos. Algum tempo depois ocorreu lhe a ideia de ser fotográfo influenciado por alguns Fotógrafos que ele conheceu naquela época . Mas , porque não tinha máquina e ném dinheiro para a comprar , teve que partir á África do sul já com 19 anos na perspectiva de encontrar um emprego que lhe podesse garantir o o dinheiro para a compra da máquina fotográfica. Não tendo conseguido o emprego, teve que começar o negócio em regime anbulatório ainda na África do sul. Dois anos depois consegue comprar a máquina e volta Moçambique onde veio continuar com o seu negócio de venda de vários artigos ao mesmo tempo que recebia instruções sobre o uso da máquina fotográfica . Dezoito meses depois inicia o trabalho fotográfico, aos 23 anos junta-se com a sua esposa com a qual tem um filho de dois anos. Quando estiver a trabalhar nas fotografias a esposa é que cuida do negócio do mini mercearia.

O valor de empréstimo teve um impacto positivo no seu negócio uma vez que aumentou o volume dos produtos e comprou mais uma máquina fotográfica sem precisar de ir trabalhar na África do sul. Futuramente pretende obter um estúdio fotográfico e uma cabelaria.

loans.use: To increase stock in his business.

loans.name: Khurshud

texts.en: Khurshud lives in Fatalikend village in Saatli. He is 44, married and has 5 children. He is the owner of a small farm where he is breeding calves for meat production. He is a very successful businessman, and to broaden his farming he wants to borrow 900 USD to purchase three additional calves for an estimated cost of 300 USD each.

loans.use: Going to purchase three calves

loans.name: Silveria

texts.es:
Mrs. Silveria previously was a vendor in the city’s municipal market, but that activity didn’t go well so she traveled outside the county to look for work.

She learned many things while abroad, among those, to make all kinds of clothing. She returned to her country and opened her own shop, where today she makes shirts, pants, dresses, and uniforms among other items.

Silveria wants to obtain a loan to be able to buy materials with which to work such as fabric, thread, zippers, and buttons, as she has several orders for business uniforms due at the end of January.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Silveria anteriormente era vendedora en el mercado municipal de la cuidad, pero dicha actividad no le resulto por lo cual viajo al exterior en busca de trabajo.

Aprendió muchas cosas estando fuera, entre ellas, a confeccionar todo tipo de prendas. Volvió al país y monto su propio taller, donde hoy día confecciona camisas, pantalones, vestidos, uniformes entre otros.

Silveria desea adquirir un crédito con el que podrá comprar materiales para trabajar como telas, hilos, cierres y botones, ya que tiene varios pedidos de uniformes de empresas para entregar a fines del mes de enero.

loans.use: Purchase fabric, thread, zippers, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Phạm Thị Thúy, 37 years old, lives with her husband and two school age children. When a branch of the TYM Fund was first opened in Sóc Sơn, she joined for one year and then left due to all her time was spent for two young children. In 2000, she rejoined the Fund and borrowed money to open a general store. Her house, on the Route 131, is an ideal location for the business. Most of her customers are farmers from nearby rural areas. The family’s economy is getting better, monthly income is 300USD. She is applying for a loan of 1200USD to replenish her store getting ready for up coming Tết.

From Wikipedia: Tết Nguyên Đán, more commonly known by its shortened name Tết, is the most important and popular holiday and festival in Vietnam. It is the Vietnamese New Year which is based on the Chinese calendar, a lunisolar calendar. The name Tết Nguyên Đán is Sino-Vietnamese for Feast of the First Morning, derived from the Hán nôm characters 節元旦. In modern Chinese, the characters for Nguyên Ðán (元旦) have evolved to refer to New Year in the Gregorian calendar, that is, January 1.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Phạm Thị Thúy, 37 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 2 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Thời gian Quỹ Tình thương mới về hoạt động trên địa bàn huyện Sóc Sơn, chị đã tham gia được 1 năm, song vì điều kiện con nhỏ, không có thời gian đi sinh hoạt nên chị đã xin ra khỏi Quỹ. Với bản tính năng động không chịu mãi cảnh nghèo, chị rất muốn vay vốn nhưng không biết vay ở đâu. Năm 2000 chị lai tiếp tục xin quay lại Quỹ và mở của hàng kinh doanh tạp hóa tại trục đường 131 là nơi rất thuận tiên cho việc buôn bán. Khách hàng của chị là ở phần lớn ở các vùng nông thôn đến lấy buôn. Cuộc sống gia đình chị Thúy đã có nhiều chuyển biến, mức thu nhập hiện tại của gia đình là 300USD/tháng. Chị vừa làm đơn xin vay 1200USD để mua hàng phục vụ Tết.

loans.use: Buy beer, cakes, candy for her grocery store

loans.name: Gilda Isabel

texts.es:
Gilda is the type of woman who likes to help her husband with the household expenses. In addition, her husband’s income is not enough to cover these expenses. It was for this reason that three years ago she began to sell lingerie by catalog to her neighbors. Little by little she has been increasing her sales and is making herself known in her area.

Nevertheless the household expenses are increasing due to the fact that they have a son in school. Because of this she does not have enough capital to be able to buy merchandise. She is requesting a loan of US $250, which she will repay over 3 months, and with this money Gilda will be able to purchase merchandise and her clients will have something to choose from. With your help Gilda will be able to help her family get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Gilda es una mujer a la que le gusta ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Puesto que con lo que gana su esposo no es suficiente para pagar los gastos de la casa. Fue por eso que comenzó hace 3 años a vender artículos de lencería por catálogo entre sus vecinas. Poco a poco ha ido incrementando sus ventas. Puesto que se está haciendo conocida en su localidad.

Sin embargo los gastos de su casa van incrementando, puesto que tiene a su hijo estudiando. Es por eso que no cuenta con capital suficiente para poder comprar mercancía. Por eso está solicitando un crédito de US $250 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 3 meses y con este dinero Gilda podrá comprar mercancía para que sus clientas tengan de dónde escoger. Con tu ayuda Gilda logrará sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara P. is the proud mother of three grown children. She and her family live in Primorsk, Ukraine. Tamara sells women’s clothing and footwear in the local central market. She always offers the same good quality merchandise, which makes her vending kiosk a popular destination for customers. Moreover, her honesty and friendliness with clients only adds to success of her trade. Presently, Tamara’s turnover capital is about $8000. Her monthly net profit is about $5000.

High inflation in Ukraine has hurt Tamara’s business and has caused some losses for her recently. That is why she is hoping to secure additional financing so she can purchase more merchandise for retail sale. Tamara is planning to open one more vending facility at the market in the near future. We believe her consistency and hard work will help Tamara reach her goals and take her business to the next level.

loans.use: To increase assortment of inventory for sale

loans.name: Saidato

texts.ru:
Saidato N. lives in the city of Yavan, is married and has 6 children. He is 47 years old. He is a farmer. He would like to obtain a loan in order to purchase a milk cow. His wife will sell the milk to the neighbors. This will provide the family with additional income. In addition to that the neighbors will be able to purchase milk at a lower price than the one on the market, which will in turn better their quality of life. Saidato plans to repay the loan within a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Неъмонов Саидато из города Яван.Женат , имеет 6 детей. Ему 47 лет . Он не имеет образования , но занимается земледелием и животноводством. Планирует получить кредит , для того , чтобы купить корову , которая будет давать молоко. Получаемое молоко будет продавать его жена соседям . Это поможет получать дополнительный доход для семьи. Кроме того продажа молока соседям по ценам ниже рыночных - это будет большая помощь населению.Погасить кредит сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase a cow

loans.name: Betty Katutu’S Group

texts.en:
Betty K. is a 52-year-old widow with six children ranging in age from 30 to 18. Her husband died in 2000, but even before that, she had her own business selling bitenge, fabric printed with colourful patterns that are tailored and worn by people all over Uganda.

She sells bitenge from her home, buying them from people who import them from Congo for 10,000/= (Ugandan shillings, about $6) each and selling them for 15,000-20,000/=. When she gets the money, she buys about 50 at a time to keep in stock, an inventory that she usually sells in about two weeks. She likes this business, she says, because “it doesn’t give her a headache,” allowing her time for church and to look after her children.

She joined MCDT in 2004 which provided the capital to increase her investment in her business. This will be her eleventh loan. With a new loan, she will add to her inventory of bitenge. “It helps me a lot to survive in the city.”

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Villa Progresivo Group

texts.en:
Alexandra P. is a young and ambitious female entrepreneur from Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic. She first learned the practice of selling clothes at the age of ten in her mother’s small restaurant. When her mother passed away a year later, it became her livelihood and her only means of survival. Now, Alexandra primarily sells men's pants, t-shirts, and shoes in the streets and offices of the nearby community, VilL. Progreso. It is her dream to someday own her own boutique men’s clothing store.

Alexandra is one of the coordinators of the 10-person micro-bank, VilL. Progresivo, which means “Progressive Village”. Each of these unique Dominican entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, allowing them to access funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own. The concept of this group bank paying their loan together is to reduce the risk of one person defaulting, as the others members gladly help cover one another’s payments in order to receive their next loan together. Some of the other women in this particular bank make a living selling clothing, running small salons, and selling sweets on the street. This Kiva loan will go towards the entire group and be divided among the members to pay back.

On behalf of Alexandra, the VilL. Progresivo group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support and awareness of the global issue of poverty, in which your efforts are helping to make a difference.

loans.use: To purchase men's pants, shirts, and shoes for sale in the streets, as well as hair products and ingredients for cooking deserts.

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en:
S. Marhabo is 39 years old, widowed and the mother of two children. After the death of her husband, Marhabo had to find ways to provide for herself and her family. For 11 years, she has run a business baking and selling the national bread, lepeshka. It has become a family business, with her now grown children helping her.

Marhabo is a cheerful and hard-worker despite the difficulties she faces. She has received and repaid two loans from IMON, each of which helped create stability for her business. Today, Marhabo is applying for a loan of 3,400 Somoni ($1,000 USD) due in 12 months. She will use it to buy coal and flour for baking. This will allow her to increase her sales and earn more so she can provide her children with a good education. With your help, this will be possible.

loans.use: To buy coal and flour to bake the national bread, lepeshka.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is married but has no child. He is 34 year old trader. He runs a mother care shop and sells assorted kids care materials like diapers, napkins, pampers, soaps, etc. for four years now. He does not have sufficient working capital to run the business. With the loan, he wants to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. He believes the loan will enable him to purchase good quality stock to upgrade her inventory. He would be grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To buy more stock of dippers, napkins, pampers, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Samoeun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Samoeun P. is a 60 year old widow who works as a dessert saleswoman; she earns approximately $3.20 per day. She has four children who all live with. Her oldest daughter, Vanthy Ou, is 34 and is a cleaner for a local NGO. Samoeun sells desserts to many citizens in the village. Her business is going well, and she wants to expand the variety of the desserts she sells. Hence, she needs a loan of $400 to use as capital in order to create a larger variety of desserts. The business is a small group that was formed and Samoeun was chosen to be the leader of two other members Mrs. Somang V. and Mrs. Chou K..

Mrs. Somang V., who is 44, is a staff member of a catholic temple, and her husband, who is 45, is a cameraman. She is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase a camera to replace broken camera, which he uses for his picture service. Mrs. Chou K., who is 51, provides a billing service for phone calls. Chuo is requesting a loan $200 to buy more phone cards to stock and sell for profit. They all live in Ratanak Commune, Battambang Province.

loans.use: use as capital to make dessert for sell

loans.name: Palmira

texts.es:
La señora Palmira tiene 62 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal San Luis y vive en el Barrio California de Carata en el caserío de Motil, distrito de Agallpampa, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió solamente lo que antiguamente llamábamos transición que equivale al actual primer grado de primaria y no continuó estudiando porque en la escuela de Motil no había más grados. 
Se casó con el señor Amaro Contreras y tuvieron 9 hijos. Actualmente ninguno depende de ellos, pero tienen bajo su protección a un nieto.
Palmira es una mujer emprendedora que se dedicaba a la costura, pero se dio cuenta que en la compra y venta de leña le va mejor ya que es el combustible que utilizan en la zona, entonces actualmente ese es su negocio.
Con su primer préstamo de 300 soles, cancelado en 4 cuotas, compró telas y empezó a almacenar leña.
Con este crédito de 1,000 soles, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, piensa comprar leña.
Palmira sueña con incursionar en el negocio de listones de madera.
texts.en:
Señora Palmira is 62 years old and a member of the community bank San Luis. She lives in the neighborhood California de Carata in the region of Motil, district of Agallpampa, province of Otuzco, department of La Libertad, Perú. She studied only through what was called the transition in the old days, which is equivalent to the present first grade of primary school, and she didn't continue studying because in the school of Motil, there were no other grades. She married to Señor Amaro Contreras and they had nine children. Presently, none depend on them, but they have a grandson under their protection. Palmira is an enterprising woman who was dedicated to sewing, but she realized that purchasing and selling firewood went better for her since since it is the fuel most used in their area, so presently that is her business. With her first loan of 300 Soles, repaid in four months, she bought fabric and began to stock up firewood. With this loan of 1000 Soles, which she will pay back in six months, she plans to buy firewood. Palmira dreams of stepping into the business of laths of wood.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy firewood.

loans.name: Maksida

texts.en:
Maksida was born in 1970 and she lives in a Živinice, a village in Bosnia.  She has 3 kids: her oldest son is 20 and works as a construction worker, and her two other sons are 14 and 12 years old and still attend school.  Her husband also works in construction.  

Maksida works at home, raising her children, growing vegetables, and raising cows.  She sells the milk and milk products from her cows in the local market, earning about 150KM/month (the equivalent of roughly $100 USD).  Maksida requests a loan of 1,200KM from Women for Women International to purchase food for her cows to survive the winter.

loans.use: To buy food for cows.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
This is Vicky Ruhambika, a married woman with three children. She is 32 years old and her children are between one and 10 years of age. She is running a grocery business. Her business is doing well and it helps her to get money that she uses to take care of her family. Her husband helps her to run this business,. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase a deep freezer for her business. In future she plans to expand her business.

She thanks you for your support.

---
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future

loans.use: To purchase a deep freezer for her business.

loans.name: Taiaopo
