He has never taken out a loan from any other bank and became aware of Hluvuku [Kiva field partner] through some friends who are also Hluvuku clients. This will be his fourth loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 12,000 MZN [Mozambique Meticais] with which he plans to buy construction materials (doors, sand, bricks, etc.) so he can continue building his house. His prior loans were in the amounts of 7,300 MZN [Mozambique Meticais], 10,200 MZN [Mozambique Meticais], 10,500 MZN [Mozambique Meticais], and 10,000 MZN [Mozambique Meticais] for this work. 

He plans to take out further loans from Hluvuku to finish his home and offer a more comfortable life to his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (doors, sand, bricks, etc.) so he can continue building his home.

loans.name: Munkhtsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Munkhtsetseg, 43, is a doctor in private medicine located in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She lives with her old mother, a pensioner, and her daughter in the slum district of the city. Munkhtsetseg has been working as a doctor since 1988 and is a skillful and experienced doctor of acuclosure or bone setting.

Currently her family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, and actually it is uncomfortable or cold to live in, especially for sickly people during the freezing wintertime. Because of this, she started building a new house beside her ger last fall, but she could not finish the building because of a lack of money to purchase some construction materials, especially brick, iron-pipes, window frames and insulation materials, etc. Her family will be moving to the new house and will be living in a warm, comfortable house If she can finish it before this winter.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan to purchase the building materials to finish building her new house.

loans.use: to purchase the building materials to finish building her new house

loans.name: Harold Narciso

texts.es: El Joven. Harold  es soltero, tiene 19 de edad,  Harold  estudia Telecomunicaciones en un Instituto de prestigio, Harold escogió esta carrera ya que es su vocación y tiene las capacidades y habilidades para desarrollarse profesionalmente, actualmente trabaja en la televisión “América” en el canal 4 donde realiza sus prácticas profesionales  de telecomunicaciones, Su sueño de Harold   es brindarle a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida y de alguna forma devolverle a ellos todo lo que hicieron por él, con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para pagar su matrícula y prácticas profesionales. Sabemos que El Joven. Harold cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo, así mismos con los préstamos que nosotros le brindamos le ayudaran a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Harold is a single young man who is 19 years of age.  He is studying telecommunications at a prestigious institute.  Harold chose this degree because it is already his vocation.  He has the skills and abilities to develop professionally.  Harold currently works on a television show called “América” on Channel 4 where he is doing an internship in professional telecommunications.  His dream is to provide his parents a better quality of life and somehow repay them for everything they have done for him.  

In order to keep growing, Harold is requesting a new loan so that he can pay for his tuition and professional seminars.  It is known that Harold will accomplish his goals through hard work and effort, as well as with the help of the loans from EDAPROSPO.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition and professional seminars.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 25-year-old young man. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary, and he also has a store that sells clothes. Mohammad wants to do a bulk purchase of clothes for the coming winter season so that he can have a new collection for sale, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay, so he needs to take a loan from FATEN. When Mohammad gets the loan, he will be able to purchase bulk of winter clothes for sale, so he will have a better, new collection to compete and increase his sales and increase his income. Mohammad is photographed in his store.


About this loan product:
 FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of winter clothes.

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
José, es agricultor, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, él tiene 10 años de estar dedicándose a la agricultura, inicio cuando era joven, ayudándole a su padre, pero en la actualidad es el único medio de ingreso para su familia.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de abono y herbicidas, estos materiales lo utilizara para aplicarlos al cultivo de maíz, con la esperanza que la cosecha sea buena y sana.
La aspiración de José es trabajar arduamente por sus hijos, con el compromiso de que no les falte ni alimentación, salud y educación.
texts.en:
José is a farmer living with his wife and children. He’s been a farmer for ten years having started while still young helping his father.  At present, it’s his only source of family income.

He’s asking for a loan to buy manure and herbicide.  He will use these supplies for his corn crop hoping harvest will be good and healthy.  José’s goal is to work hard for his children so that they will never lack food, health and education.

loans.use: to buy manure and herbicide.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon is guided him by his favorite quotation, "some people dream of success…while others wake up and work hard at it." That’s how Marlon is living now to succeed in his dream. Marlon dreams to have a stable source of income to give quality living for his family.
Marlon is 39 years old, married, and blessed with five children. His wife is a housekeeper and vends vegetables. Marlon manages his two hectares rice field. His earnings from the business was used to pay for his obligation to the private traders whom he got financial support for farming. 
Marlon doesn’t want to get financial support anymore from the private traders because the interest is costly. He desires to borrow P40,000 to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers. The loan will make a big contribution for him to stop getting financial support from the traders. He will do his best to achieve his dream.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Severino

texts.en: Born in the town of Cabatuan, Isabela, in 1961, Severino lives with his wife and their two children. Recognized by the people of his neighborhood as a jolly person, Severino, a farmer, would like to expand his crop production so that it becomes a viable source of income. To do that, he needs a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy seed and fertilizer. The income from his farm will then help him cope with the needs of his family and give all of his children a higher education. Severino is very grateful to everyone who can help him achieve his dreams with this loan.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Ligaya

texts.en:
This is Maria Ligaya, she is 41 and a resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rosendo, a contractor, and is the mother of four children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Maria Ligaya is a coconut dealer. She buys coconut from different farmers in nearby provinces and delivers it to her regular customers, the coconut retailers, who sell the coconut per piece or use it in their own business. She also manages a small variety store for added income. She earns a minimum of PHP 2000 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional stocks of the coconut needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Maria Ligaya hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes that her children will finish their studies up to college. She also dreams of buying a vehicle to be used in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.
 
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of the coconut needed in her business.

loans.name: Lucibel

texts.en:
Lucibel is 33 years old and is a married woman with a 7-year-old child. She earns a living by making and selling baskets. Lucibel has been in this business for only a year. She earns 4,000 PHP per month.

Lucibel has requested this loan to purchase materials to make baskets. She hopes for her business to grow. She also hopes for her family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make baskets

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Felicitas; ella tiene 38 años de edad y La socia es natural de Iscuchaka, Ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos, la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de leche de vaca,ella lleva leche a la ciudad de Cusco  y tambien vende productos secos quinua,trigo ,maiz y cebada,ella tambien los productos lleva a lugares como las diferentes ferias que se llevan a cabo en el distrito de Anta,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el socio de la socia es tener un local mas amplio donde pueda vender la leche. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar dos vacas lecheras para que amplie su negocio de venta de leche de vaca.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado
texts.en:
The member is Felicitas; she is 38 years old and a native of Iscuchaka. She is married and has 4 children.

The member continues working in the sale of cow's milk. She takes the milk to the city of Cusco and also sells dry products: quinoa, wheat, corn and barley. She also takes her products to the different markets that take place in the Anta district.

The member supports her children through this business.

The member wants to sell her milk across a wider area. She is asking for this loan to buy two dairy cows so she can grow her cow's milk selling business.

The member values and is grateful for the offered loan as it allows her to grow her business and improve her quality of life. At the same time she commits to fulfilling the payments of the instalments in the time stipulated.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows in order to grow her cow's milk selling business.

loans.name: Zebiniso

texts.ru: Зебинисо проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ей 35 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее муж находится в Российской Федерации. Сама Зебинисо открыла маленький продуктовый магазин. В этой области она десять лет. Кредит берет для покупки продуктов и приобретения небольшого холодильника.
texts.en: Zebiniso lives in the city of Tursun-zoda.  She is 35 years old, married and has three children.  Her husband is in the Russian Federation.  Zebiniso opened a small food store.  She has been in this business for ten years.  She is requesting this loan to purchase products and a small refrigerator.

loans.use: to purchase products and a small refrigerator

loans.name: Avefua

texts.en:
Avefua is forty-eight years old and is married with ten children.

Avefua owns and operates a business venture, selling fried foods in the local community.  She has two years of experience in this business.  Avefua needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase raw ingredients such as flour, sugar and cordials so she can make products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be WST 350 or US $146 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2011, Avefua joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Avefua's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients such as flour, sugar and cordials, in order to produce products to sell.

loans.name: Emprendedoras De Cerrito Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Emprendedoras del Chaco se unió con el propósito de poder trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo ayudarse las unas a las otras. Actualmente se encuentran en el decimo cuarto ciclo y comentan que están muy contentas por la ayuda recibida por parte de la fundación.
Francisca es una de las miembros y ella nos comenta que gracias a su arduo trabajo y al esfuerzo que pone en lo que hace, ha podido sacar adelante su negocio, el cual es una despensa. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y comenta que por medio de su negocio ha podido ayudar a su familia a salir adelante y tener un mejor estilo de vida.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de artículos de primera necesidad, como ser azúcar, fideos, harina y demás insumos necesarios para surtir su despensa.
texts.en:
The members of the "Mujeres Emprendedoras del Chaco" communal bank came together with the aim of working together, and helping one another through that work. They are currently in their 14th loan cycle, and are very happy about the help received from the Foundation.

Francisca is one of the members, and she tells us that thanks to her hard work and the effort she puts into what she does, she has been able to keep her small grocery store business going. 

She is a very hard-working woman and says that by means of her business she has been able to help her family succeed and have a better lifestyle.

She is applying for the loan in order to buy basic household necessities such as sugar, noodles, flour, and other supplies for stocking her grocery store.

loans.use: To buy basic household necessities for sale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Esther is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling provisions in Besease (near Elmina). She has been involved in this enterprise for more than ten years.Esther is married and has five children.Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Esther wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of groceries. In the long term, Esther plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels

loans.name: Djekadi A Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe DJEKADI A sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 47 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Kapala, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le pois sucré avec Madame Kia debout en première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et la semence pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 195.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants et de semences agricoles

loans.name: Digna Emerita

texts.en:
For a year now I have had a clothing business that sells mens womens and childrens clothing. On Monday, Tuesdays and Wednesdays, I travel to neighboring areas to sell in order to earn more money. My husband is a farmer. He only harvests one time per year. This is why we need to have a second income in order to pay for our children\'s food, health and education.

Loan Use: Purchase of blouses, skirts, shirts, socks, handkerchiefs and other supplies

Tengo un año de tener mi negocio en el que vendo ropa para todas las edades para dama, caballero y niño. Tambien los dias lunes, martes y miercoles salgo a comunidades vecinas a vender de manera ambulante para tener mayor ingreso. Mi esposo se dedica a la agricultura y solamente cosecha 1 vez al año, por lo que necesitamos tener otros ingresos para mantener a mis hijos en sus estudios y darles alimentacion y salud.

loans.use: Compra de blusas, faldas, camisas, calcetines, pañuelos y otros.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of an energy saving meko (cooking stove)

loans.name: Titus Wasike

texts.en: Titus is married with two children who have not yet joined school. Though he has finished his secondary school, he has not undertaken any job training. He started his business in 2000 in order to uplift his living standard. He operates a small kiosk at the center of a main market, and he also frequents other markets to increase his customer base. With a loan from PEMCI, he will increase his food stock and be able to buy in bulk (wholesale) and earn more profit on his retail sales. Through his business he has been able to support his family's needs and bring fresh foodstuffs nearer to the community center from local farms.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
With a lot of effort and hard work, I have been able to get a house. Thanks to God, my family has a solid roof of its head. The problem is that the house only has two rooms, and there are five people in my family, which is why I'm building another room at the front of the house. But I lack the funds to finish the job. I'm requesting a loan of $1,000 to do it.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo he podido sacar casa gracias a dios y mi familia tiene un techo seguro tengo un problema la vivienda es de solo 2 recamaras y somos 5 de familia por el cual estoy construyendo un cuarto en frente de la casa, me ase falta la loza para ya tenerlo terminado. Solicito $1,000.00 DLLS. Para la colocación de la loza.

loans.use: Add a room to my home

loans.name: Srey Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. H. Srey Touch got married in 1993 and has 3 children: 1 son and 2 daughters. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor and started her silk production business in 1991. Her eldest daughter assists her with weaving silk at home when she is free after school. Her husband is a rice farmer.

Mrs. Hour has taken out two loans from MAXIMA to date. She is now requesting a loan of $600. She will use this loan to purchase silk material and sewing thread and pay fees for selecting and building one more loom for her daughter.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and building one more loom for her daughter.

loans.name: Hamis

texts.en: Hamis is a 42-year-old father of four and a resident of Tandika. Hamis is a is tailor  and has done this job for the past ten years. He specializes in men’s trousers and making suits. He is a recipient of business training organized by the Youth Self Employment Foundation. He now wants to buy an electronic tailoring machine. He is in need of $350 to help accomplish his plan.

loans.use: EXPAND BUSINESS

loans.name: Titin

texts.en: Titin is a 49 year old married woman. She sells clothes on credit and usually earns $10 per day. She has to go around to various places to get customers. Her husband, E., is a traditional healer who has no regular income. She really needs a $50 loan to buy more clothes and hopes that she can earn more income. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Isabel started her business with a total of thirty dollars, which were lent to her by a family member, and were a tremendous help to her in undertaking this new challenge. Her good investment of the money and the good relations with her customers has given her a loyal client base. With the help of loans that she has received from financial institutions, including Integral, she sells all types of vegetables. She has a good location in the main streets of La Libertad, and also has ten years of experience in this business. Her experience is apparent in her manner. The income that she has and good management have made her able to invest in her home that she has been able to build and maintain her level of sales. She can in this way provide the products that her customers ask for. The loan that she needs is for the purchase of certain vegetables that sell well during the end of year season, such as tomatoes, cabbages and others.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Isabel inicio su negocio , con un monto de treinta dolares, los cuales un familiar le presto,y que le ayudaron en gran manera para poder emprender este nuevo reto , pero su buena inversión del dinero y el buen trato con los clientes le ayudado para que estos se fidelicen con ella además de el apoyo con los financiamientos que a recibido por instituciones financieras ,incluido Integral ella vende todo tipo de verduras en el negocio, ya que tiene una buen ubicación en las calles principales de La libertad, además cuenta con diez años de experiencia en este negocio, lo cual hace que se exprese con mucha experiencia , los ingresos que tiene y la buena administración le ayudado a invertir en su vivienda ya que con esfuerzos a podido construirla y tratar de mantenerse en sus ventas ,y a si siempre tener los productos que sus clientes le solicitan, el financiamiento lo necesita para poder comprar algunos verduras que son muy vendibles tales como la los tomates repollo y otros debido a la época de fin de año .

loans.use: She needs a loan to buy vegetables, tomatoes,carrots, potatoes,cabbages, plantains, etc.

loans.name: Jose Noel

texts.es:
José Z. has worked as a mechanic for 15 years in his shop outside of the Santa Ana market in Chinandega. He's the father of 4 children and he started his business in order to support his wife and children. His plans are to increase his business and invest in tools so he can provide better service to his customers.

So, Mr. Z. began working with Ceprodel 2 years ago and has received a total of 12 loans that he has used to increase his business and to purchase tools. His most urgent need is to purchase tools as they are extremely expensive and he doesn't have enough money to purchase them.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

José Z. es un caballero que desde hace 15 años se dedica a la mecánica teniendo su taller en la afueras del mercado Santa Ana en Chinandega. Es padre de 4 hijos y su negocio lo inicia por la necesidad de mantener a su esposa y sus hijos, según cuenta, sus planes son ampliar su negocio e invertir en herramientas para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Por esta razón es que el señor Z. acude a Ceprodel desde hace 2 años siendo beneficiado con un total de 12 créditos que los ha utilizado para la ampliación de su local y para la compra de las herramientas de mecánica. Su necesidad mayor radica en la compra de las herramientas ya que son sumamente costosas y él no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para comprarlas.

loans.use: Invest in mechanic business.

loans.name: Taing

texts.en: Mrs. Taing S. L. is 56 years old and she is a widow with five children. She raises pigs for a living and typically earns $2 per day. Three of her children are married and live away from her home. Her two other children, both of whom live with her at home, work to supplement the household income: one works as a hair dresser and has a salary of $80 per month, while the other child is employed by a garment factory and earns approximately $70 per month. To generate more revenue and income, Mrs. Taing S. L. wants to breed more pigs, so she is requesting a $300 loan from Kiva to do so.

loans.use: To breed additional pigs.

loans.name: Lopepe

texts.en: Lopepe is a married mother of three children. She is requesting a loan of $700 to pay for a fence around her taro plantation.  With the profits from her plantation, she can pay for her eldest daughter’s semester fee. Her daughter is entering University this year.  This will be her 3rd loan with SPBD and it shows how SPBD has helped her out very much in supporting her family. Lopepe’s business is the main source of income in her family, and she is very pleased with the great support that her family is giving her business. She aims to find a good market for her taro overseas.

loans.use: To purchase fencing materials for her taro plantation.

loans.name: Halima's Wavumi Group

texts.en:
Halima is married and has two children, ages 15 and 3. She and her husband also take care of one other person who is 58 years old. Halima earns money selling clothes; she started her own business in 2004. Every day, she works from 12 am to 12 pm at her store and can earn a monthly profit of about US$50 from the sales.

Halima now hopes to receive a loan to buy more clothes for her sales business. She will share this loan with her sub-group member Maria.

loans.use: Purchase of clothes for sale

loans.name: Kisaakye Women's Group

texts.en:
N. Fatuma, 37, is the chairperson of Kisaakye Women’s group in Rubaga. She is a widow with three children aged 14, 12 and 8 years. She also looks after her sister’s one-and-a-half year old twin daughters who were disowned by their father.

Fatuma has been selling used clothes--mostly T-Shirts--for men, women and children for 13 years at the Owino market, on Rubaga road, and at daily local markets known as “mubuulo.” So far she has been buying one bale of clothes at a time, but her dream is to buy 5 bales in a day if she could get the necessary capital for it. Right now she needs a loan to buy another bale of clothes because most of her funds have been spent on school fees now that the children are reporting for school.

loans.use: To increase an inventory of used clothes.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan, 32 years old, is married and has 1 child. He owns a furniture-making shop in a small village close to Nabatieh in South Lebanon. Hassan needs a loan for the amount of USD 1,200 to renovate his house that was damaged during the July 2006 War. This is the second time Hassan has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. He successfully repaid his previous loan on time.

loans.use: USD 1,200 to renovate his house that was damaged during the war.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana Q. sells Banku, a local meal, which she prepares for sale. She is married, but her husband's income as a fisherman is not sufficient for Diana and her 2 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El señor Félix Báez tiene 39 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. Lila de Báez, juntos tienen dos hijos, viven en Carepegua en casa propia en el Barrio San Vicente, su actividad es la fabricación de calzados que vende a los vendedores ambulantes de la zona.

Su esposa es docente, y aparte los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de calzados fabricados por el su esposo.

Es un señor muy trabajador desde muy joven aprendió este oficio que es su fuente de ingreso para la manutención de su familia.

Con el crédito comprará materia prima cueros ,plantillas
texts.en:
Mr. Félix Báez is 39 years old, married to Mrs. Lila de Báez, together they have two children, they live in Carepegua in their own house in the San Vicente neighborhood. His work is making shoes that he sells to the traveling vendors in their area. His wife is a teacher, and on the weekends she sells the shoes made by her husband. He is a hard-working man and learned this trade as a youth, and this trade provides the income to support his family. With this loan he will buy raw materials such as leather and insoles.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material such as leather and insoles

loans.name: Armande Dite Ramata

texts.fr:
Madame Armande dite Ramata Diakité est âgée de 43 ans et vit avec ses 4 enfants et son mari dans une famille nucléaire au quartier Médine de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali.)
Pour des raisons sociales elle ne fréquenta pas l’école et s’est très vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus. Madame Armande fait le commerce de pagnes et de parfums.
Dans le souci d’augmenter la taille de ses activités elle décide de collaborer avec le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 4 ans. Après avoir bouclé 6 prêts de groupe (prêt solidaire) tous correctement remboursés avec une association de son quartier, elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel.
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 25 pièces de pagnes Fancy et 18 pièces de pagnes Wax (tissus très prisés en Afrique de l’Ouest).
Elle s’approvisionne généralement à partir de la république du Bénin, des Emirats arabes unies et quelques fois à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). Elle effectue ses ventes chez elle à domicile ou en ambulant dans les services au comptant et à crédit payable mensuellement. Sa clientèle est constituée généralement de salariés (hommes et femmes).
Le cycle d’activité est mensuel et envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000FCFA.Son ambition est d’ouvrir une boutique de vente d’habits, de parfums et de chaussures dans la ville de Ségou.
texts.en:
Mrs. Armande dite Ramata Diakité is 43 years old and lives with her four (4) children and husband in a nuclear family in the Medine neighbourhood in the city Segou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

For social reasonss she did not attend school and very early on became interested with generating income from business activities. Mrs. Diakité is in the business of selling pagnes (decorative cloth) and perfumes.

Concerned about expanding the size of her business, she decided four years ago, to get involved with the loan program at Soro Yiriwaso. She has completed and duly repaid six (6) group loans that were taken out with an association in her neighbourhood. She is on her second individual loan.

She plans to use this loan to purchase 25 pieces of Fancy brand pagne and 18 pieces of Wax brand pagne (cloth that is highly prized in West Africa). She usually buys her stock in the Republic of Benin, the United Arab Emirates and occasionally in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). She conducts her sales from her home and door-to-door service, for cash or credit paid in monthly installments. Her customers are made up generally of workers (both men and women).

Her business cycle is monthly and she expects to realize a monthly profit of 150,000 francs CFA. Her ambition is to open a store to sell clothing, perfume and shoes in the city of Segou.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Wax and Fancy brand pagnes (decorative cloth)

loans.name: José

texts.es: José tiene 41 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos de 12 y 11 años de edad, junto a su familia habitan en el barrio memorial sandino. Trabaja como operador de limpieza  en una empresa de managua, tiene 17 años dedicandose a esta labor y empezó como ayudante de limpieza. En estos momentos José desea hacer una extensión a su vivienda, para darle más comodidad a su familia, es por eso que solicita el préstamo, para hacer esa construcción
texts.en:
Jose is 41 years old and is married with two children ages 12 and 11. He lives with his family in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. He works as a janitor at a company in Managua. He has dedicated himself to this work for 17 years. Currently, Jose wants to expand his home in order to provide more comfort for his family which is why he is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build an expansion to his home.

loans.name: Albertine

texts.fr: Madame A. Albertine est mariée et mère de 3 enfants résidant à Aného. Ayant perdu son mari, elle est seule à faire face aux besoins de la famille. Elle fait le commerce des bijoux qui ne lui permet plus de faire face aux charges de la famille. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour associer à son ancienne activité la vente de mèche et de produits cosmétiques qui est très rentable afin de pouvoir faire face aux besoins de sa famille et surtout pour la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. Albertine A. is married and the mother of three and lives in Aného. Having lost her husband, she is alone in coping with the needs of the family. She does commerce in jewelry that enables her to cope. She is requesting this loan to include in her former work the sale of hair extensions and cosmetics, which are very profitable. She can then address family needs especially schooling the children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell cosmetics, hair extensions, and jewelry

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith A. is 30 years old and married with four children. She sells foodstuffs and provisions. She travels to Warri, Delta State to purchase foodstuffs and provisions to sell in Benin City. She needs the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell. She says, "thank you to all that made this loan possible."

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora es socia del Banco Comunal Trébol.
Flora es casada, tiene 49 años y 3 hijos, Flora tiene una bodega en su casa ubicada en el distrito de Jesús Nazareno, en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días por las mañanas y por las tardes trabaja en un colegio como docente.
Flora necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Flora sueña con mejorar su negocio, su hijos culmine sus estudios y sea profesional.
texts.en:
Flora is an associate of the Cloverleaf Communal Bank. Flora is married, 49 years old and has 3 children. Flora has a convenience store in her house located in the Jesus of Nazareth district, where she sells groceries, vegetables, and fruits, an activity that she carries out every day in the mornings. In the afternoons she works in a school as a teacher. Flora needs a loan of 750 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of rice and sugar. Flora dreams of improving her business and that her children finish their studies and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar for her grocery business.

loans.name: Lidia Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa Trabajemos en quechua.
Sonia es casada, tiene 36 años y 4 hijos, Sonia vende ropa como buzos de polar que vende al por mayor y reparte a las tiendas, puestos de mercados, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Tacna, sus ventas también lo realiza en otros departamentos. Además Sonia tiene cabinas de Internet en su casa y esta administrado por su hija.
Sonia necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantallas de computadora.
Los sueños de Sonia son construir su casa de material noble e implementar una tienda de venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the Llamkasum communal bank, which works in the Quechua language. Sonia is married, 36 years old and has 4 children. Sonia sells clothign such as track suits that she sells at the wholesale level and distributes to stores and booths in markets. She acquires her products in the city of Tacna and sells in other areas. Sonia also has Internet booths in her house and these are managed by her daughter. Sonia needs a loan of 1500 Soles, which will be invested in the purchase of computer monitors. Sonia's dreams are to build a sturdy house and set up a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of computer monitors

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del comité  fue la señora Lurde G., está casada con el Señor Carlos A. es madre de 2 Hijos ella es Transportista vive en el barrio Fátima de C.D.E. A la señora le agrado mucho el Programa de comité e Mujeres Emprendedoras contacto con sus vecinas y amigas  para formar el comité en dicha zona.

El comité se denomina “Maria Auxiliadora”, está constituido  por 21 señoras muy activas y solidA. todas de la misma zona.

Ellas tienen actividades diferentes como ser Venta de: Pantalones, remeras, zapatillas, tomates, cebollas, maquillajes, polvo compacto, cremas para el rostro,  manzanas, bananas, gaseosas, galletitas, caramelos, melones, sandias, azúcar, leche, aceite y otras que emprenderán una nueva labor y cuentan con un  ingreso fijo.

Las señoras retiran un crédito de Gs 300.000 a 800.000 Gs
El Crédito destinaran a la compra de mercaderías para y artículos de primera necesidad para su posterior venta.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lurde G. founded this group. She is married to Mr. Carlos A., and is the mother of two children. She specializes in shipping, and lives in the Fátima de C.D.E neighborhood. She is very grateful to the group's program and to Mujeres Emprendedoras (Enterprising Women) for the contact she has with her neighbors and friends to form the group in this area.

The group is called "Maria Auxiliadora," and it is comprised of 21 active, united women, all from the same area. They all work in different fields, including sales of pants, t-shirts, shoes, tomatoes, onions, makeup, powders, facial creams, apples, bananas, sodas, cookies, caramels, melons, watermelons, sugar, milk, and oil, while other will begin a new line of work and rely on a fixed income.

The women are taking out a credit of $3050, which will be used to purchase merchandise and necessities for their sales.


Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for retail activities

loans.name: Rasoolan M. Iqbal Group

texts.en:
'My name is Rasoolan and I’m 45 years old and married. I have resided in a city named Lahore, Pakistan for the past 10 years. I am married to a man whose name is M. I. and he is a ticket checker in the railway. I have two kids: one son and one daughter. My son manufactures plastic bags. My daughter reads in 8th standard. I am an older lady and my family suggests I do household work. I have successfully repaid my first loan from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now I am applying again for a loan to buy plastic beans to expand my son’s plastic bag-making business.

I am the group leader for some more women from my locality. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy cloth and colored thread for her boutique. Parveen Akthar baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for transport. Nusrat Bano baji wants a loan to buy a welding machine. Farzana baji wants a loan to buy paint to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy plastic beans for making plastic bags

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: El sr. Cesar es un cliente antiguo de la institución, trabajó con un grupo solidario “los Cumplidos”, se individualiza y ahora solicita su crédito paralelo para  cancelar del saldo en la compra de una movilidad. Vive con su esposa la sra. Julia quien tiene un puesto de venta en la calle Garcilazo de la Vega, popular feria de la ciudad de La Paz, lugar muy comercial. Tienen tres niños en edad escolar, ambos se encargan de los gastos de la casa. Clientes responsables y conocidos por la zona.
texts.en:
Cesar is a longtime client of Emprender. He used to be part of the "Los Cumplidos" group, but now on his own is asking for a loan to finish paying for the purchase of a vehicle. He lives with his wife, Julia, who has a stand on Garcilazo de la Vega Street, in a popular market in La Paz. They have three school-age children and both of them take care of household expenses. They are responsible clients and known in the neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay off the balance on a vehicle.
